loans.name: Wampala West A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Aisha K.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to increase capital and buy more clothes. Aisha is 38 years old and is married. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has 4 children ranging from age 3 to 21 and her children go to school. Each week, Aisha makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save and educate her children. Aisha has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to expand a grocery business and the loan was paid back on time.

Aisha is joined in her small group by Sinyama N., Mariam B., Carol N., and Harriet Nsbuga. Sinyama N. has a business running a restaurant and wants to buy a fridge and increase her beverage selection. Mariam B. is currently operating a beauty salon business and wants a loan to buy a big hair dryer and steamer. Carol N. operates a beauty salon business as well and wants to open up a cosmetic's shop. Harriet Nusbuga is currently in the business of running a salon and is requesting a loan to start up a cosmetic's shop too.

loans.use: To boost tailoring business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen P. D. runs a small restaurant from her living room in the town of Picota, San Martin. She serves meals typical of the region, including many different soups, and chicken, fish, and rice dishes. She started the business 3 years ago and now has many loyal customers.

Carmen is 40 years old, married, and has 5 children. She started the business, because she loves to cook and make people happy. She also wanted the family to have a second income. Education is very important in her family, so Carmen is proud she can pay for her children to go to school.

A member of Manuela Ramos and the community bank Los Claveles, Carmen is requesting a loan of s/ 1000 to be repaid over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy food ingredients and to fix the restuarant bathroom.

loans.use: 1) Purchase of ingredients for a restaurant, and 2) repair of the restaurant bathroom

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a married mother of two children who are currently in school. Cynthia is thirty years old and she has been selling groceries, such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, cocoa products, assorted biscuits, candies, and canned soft drinks in Cape Coast for the past four years. Cynthia wants to use her loan to buy more products.

She is a member of the group called "Our Helper." Members of the group use peer pressure as social collateral to repay the loan.

The photo shows Cynthia with Lawrence, the loan officer.

loans.use: To buy more food for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nurjanah

texts.id:
Nurjanah is a mother of one. She lives in a rented room for IDR 150,000/ month (around USD 19/ month). Her husband is a sailor and he usually comes home once every 3 months.

She supports her family by becoming a massage therapist. She's been in this business for quite a while. She learns the massaging skill from her parents.

Almost everyday she receives requests from customers. Many of them are regular customers for years. In addition to her work as a massage therapist, she also works in a local food stall. She works from the morning until mid day. She is paid for IDR 500 thousand/ month by the stall owner. After that she works as a massage therapist.

She has to spent money to buy massage oil and also to pay transport cost to commute from her house to her customers' houses. Therefore she hopes that the loan money can help her to buy more massage oil and also to ease her transportation cost.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Saat ini, klien tinggal di Jl.Laksamana Suwung Denpasar bersama anak tunggalnya dengan menyewa sebuah kamar dengan biaya per bulan Rp.150.000. Suaminya saat ini sedang berlayar dan biasanya pulang 3 bulan sekali. Usaha yang dijalaninya saat ini adalah sebagai tukang pijat dan itu ditekuninya sudah sejak lama. Keahlian memijat ini didapat dari orangtuanya. Hampir setiap hari Nurjanah mendapat panggilan untuk memijat baik itu ditempat sekitar rampat tinggalnya maupun ditempat yang cukup jauh. Banyak langganannya yang tetap memakai jasanya selama bertahun-tahun. Selain sebagai tukang pijat, Nurjanah juga bekerja disebuah warung makan dengan bayaran Rp.500.000, tetapi untuk saat ini dia hanya bisa bekerja dari pagi sampai siang hari. Pada sore harinya dia bisa memenuhi panggilan pijat. Saat ini Nurjanah memohon bantuan untuk bisa dipakai membeli minyak pijat dan juga untuk biaya transportasi.

loans.use: To buy massage oil and cost of transport/ commuting  (Membeli minyak pijat dan transportasi)

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma is a trader. She is dedicated to the buying and selling of cheese. She acquires the product every weekend and distributes it among homes in the area. Emma's husband is a mason. They have four children who attend elementary school. The family's home is located in the Irpavi II zone of the city of La Paz. This is the fourth loan requested from Impro, the purpose of which is to reduce the purchasing costs and increase the benefits. Through the results of her work and a desire to overcome, Emma may access the loan without any inconvenience.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Emma es comerciante, se dedica a la compra y venta de queso, el producto es adquirido cada fin de semana y se distribuye en los domicilios de la zona. El esposo de Emma es albañil, la pareja tiene 4 hijos que asisten a la escuela primaria. El domicilio de la familia esta en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz. Este es el cuarto préstamo que solicitan en Impro, el crédito será destinado para adquirir queso en mayor cantidad, el propósito es reducir los costos de compra e incrementar sus beneficios. Por los resultados de su trabajo y ganas de superación, Emma puede acceder al crédito sin ningún inconveniente.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is 31 years old and has two children. She earns income selling fresh fish in the village to customers who then use the fish to prepare their dishes. Gifty currently needs a loan to buy additional trays of fresh fish for sale. This, she believes, would enable her to save some money to be able to afford renting a store for her operations and also to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Gifty is a member of the group called Isaiah whose members agree to provide a guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of fresh fish for sale

loans.name: Airin

texts.en:
Airin is a married with one child, who is three years old. She sells clothing, working everyday from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

Airin now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes to sell in her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Narayan Devi

texts.en:
Narayan Devi M., 40 years old, lives in Kritipur, Kathmandu. She lives in a nuclear family with her 45-year-old husband Sri Krishna M. and two sons who are studying in grades 11 and 12 respectively. Her husband works in a private office.

Her economic condition was so weak that she could hardly fulfill the basic needs of her family. So she opened her tailoring shop five years ago. Other tailoring shops are not available near her shop. The number of her customers is increasing by day, so she seeks a loan of Rs. 25000/- to buy another machine and employ a tailor to meet the demand of her customers. She will be happy if she earns more to spend for her children's education and for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
MARIA LETICIA G. C. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit.  Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

LA SEÑORA MARIA LETICIA ES UNA PERSONA DE EDAD MAYOR Y VIUDA, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE HAMBURGUESAS Y ES PROPIETARIA DE UNA PULGUITA DEL CUAL OBTIENE SUS INGRESOS, LA SEÑORA CUENTA CON EL APOYO Y EL RESPALDO  DE SUS HIJOS; ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA COLOCAR UNA LOSA DE CONCRETO PARA SU CASA YA QUE SU TECHO ESTA MUY DAÑADO Y POR MEDIO DE ESTE PRESTAMO TENDRA UN MEJOR ESTILO DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Ms Maria Leticia is a widow who dedicates herself to the selling of hamburgers. She is also the owner of a small stand from which she earns her income. She depends on the support of her children. This loan will help her set down concrete in her house since her roof is is on the verge of collapse. The loan will also help her improve her way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lay down concrete for a new roof

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs. Thuy T. was born in 1942 and lives in Kvav village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Moeng Lorn, are farmers who cultivate rice to earn for living. Their earnings barely support their needs and allow for no savings. Mrs. Thuy T. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This will increase income and improve her living condition.   Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a breeding cow

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly C., 47 years old, has four children, two of whom are day laborers, while the other two attend a local school. Her husband, Mr. Naov Ra, too, works as a laborer. Mrs. Ly C. lives in the Kampong Cham Province, earning income as a farmer. She cultivates rice on the 1 hectare of land that she owns. However, the earnings are inadequate for ensuring a decent standard of living for her family, partly because the field is far from an irrigation system. To increase her income, Mrs. Ly C. would like to cultivate rice also during the dry season. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to be able to purchase a pump to water the rice field.

loans.use: Purchase of a pump to water a rice field

loans.name: Mr. Nan Phen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people who live in O’Kandol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province are members of the village bank that is requesting this loan. Each of the bank members plans to use their loan for a different purpose. 

Mr. Nan P., the village bank president, is a motorbike taxi driver. He now faces a problem because his motorbike is too old, and he needs to spend a lot of money on petroleum. To deal with this problem, Mr. Nan P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike, and he hopes to save some money this way. 

His wife, Mrs. Mao Sareth, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. Mr. Nan P. is 44 years old and the father of three children. One of his children is employed in a garment factory. The others attend the local school. 

Mr. Samban S. does not come to the loan meeting, but his wife came, S. she is presented in the picture instead of her husband.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Adeyeyin

texts.en: Adeyeyin M. sells kerosene wholesale and retail to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time.  She hopes to expand this business through this Kiva loan. She learned this business from her mother. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She is 49 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Rafatu

texts.en: Rafatu Y. is 50 years old and married with five children. Rafatu has a shop where she sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 naira to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: El señor pablo M. L.  vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas, el trabaja como guardia de seguridad de una empresa de la localidad, su esposa es operadora de una maquiladora,  sus dos hijas estudian la secundaria la mayor el tercer año y la mas chica primer año. Ellos tienen 12 años viviendo en su casa, esta es de interés social con el paso de estos años la tubería del baño se le pudrió y tienen que cambiarla desde abajo. Esta familia ha batallado con este problema lo cual comenta que calientan el agua en la estufa y llenan botes para poderse bañar.
texts.en:
Pablo M. L. lives with his wife and two daughters. He works as a security guard in a local business. His wife is an assembly plant operator. His two daughters go to elementary school. The older is in third grade and the younger is in first grade. They have lived in public housing for twelve years. Over the years, the plumbing in their home's bathroom has rotted and needs to be replaced. The family has battled with this problem, which they deal with by heating water on the stove and then filling containers with it in order to bathe.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plumbing

loans.name: Mukaddam

texts.ru: Мукаддам 29 лет. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Муж работает, кроме этого занимается куплей продажей скота. Дома Мукаддам помогает ему и смотрит за скотом. Вместе они планируют увеличить поголовье скота и поэтому обратились за получением займа. На полученный займ планируют приобрести маленького бычка.
texts.en:
Mukaddam is 27 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband works and, besides that, buys and sells cattle. At home, Mukaddam helps him and looks after the cattle. Together they plan to increase their number of cattle, and consequently, they have applied for a loan. When they receive the loan, they plan on buying a small calf.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 19 años es madre soltera, tiene una hijita  de 2 añitos y vive con sus abuelitos. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches, contando con el apoyo de su abuelita. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el trato directo que tiene con sus clientes y darles una buena atención. Este negocio es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en un buen lugar, por donde transita gran cantidad de personas, además que ya cuenta con una clientela regular que degusta de su buena sazón. En adelante, Rosa quiere implementar su negocio con la venta de bebidas heladas. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en su negocio de venta de comida, comprando ingredientes e insumos para la preparación de sus platos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 19 years old, and the single parent of a 2-year old daughter. They live with Rosa's grandparents. Since 2 years ago, Rosa has been selling food at night, with the support of his grandmother. What Rosa likes about her job is dealing directly with customers, and giving them good attention. Her business is profitable because it is located in a good place, and large numbers of people pass by. In addition, Rosa already has a regular clientele. In the future, Rosa wants to increase her business by selling frozen drinks. This is her first loan with Microfinaza Prisma. Rosa will use the money to invest in her food business, purchasing ingredients for her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to use for her dishes

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo is 52-years old and married to O., who is a plumber, and they have four children. Iyabo sells bags of charcoal. Iyabo is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.en:
R. Nurullo is a lively entrepreneur with a small business selling shoes for women at the central market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is a very experienced entrepreneur having been self-employed for the past eight years. Business has been good for Nurullo as there is always a demand for shoes. Nurullo is a married man with four children. He is doing his best and he works hard to ensure that all his children have a good future. Nurullo has requested a loan of 10,000 somoni to increase his available working capital. Eventually, Nurullo hopes to have his own small store. This loan will help him purchase new inventory and continue to invest in his business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new shoes

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel  vive con su esposa la señora Elvia y son padres de tres hijos,
El trabaja en una empresa bien establecida y su esposa labora para una maquiladora con una antigüedad de 2 años. Son originarios de la ciudad de Veracruz pero se vinieron a esta frontera para salir adelante, para poder obtener un mejor estilo de vida para ellos y su familia. 
Ellos están tramitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en la parte trasera de su vivienda para tener una mayor seguridad y privacidad;por esta razón están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel lives with his wife Elvia and their three children. He works for a well-established company and his wife works for a maquiladora that has been in existence for two years. They are originally from Veracruz but came to the border to achieve a better life for themselves and their family. They are requesting this loan in order to build a wall in the rear of their house that will afford them greater security and privacy.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall behind their house

loans.name: Helen Achieng'

texts.en:
Helen is a 31-year-old married mother of four children aged from 8 to 16 years old, all of whom are in school. Helen sells fresh Tilapia, a kind of fresh fish, from nearby Lake Victoria. She buys the fish at a local market and then resells them to retailers, and the rest to consumers.

Helen says that right now she “lacks finances to buy fish,” and will use her loan to purchase stock for her business. She hopes that with the proceeds from her business she can continue to educate her children and boost her trade. She says that she wants people to know that she works hard to educate her children, and she hopes to live a long life.

loans.use: To purchase more fish

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
La señora Fermina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil casada y es madre de 04 hijos.  Fermina tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en la comunidad de Urani Marca Callo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 05 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con el cual compró ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado mayor, para engorde. Fermina nos indica que con una parte del préstamo comprará cereales para venderlo en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor sueño es poder  vender al por mayor.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Fermina belongs to the community bank "Manuela de Hoy" which is located in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno Department, Peru. She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Fermina completed her primary school education and now lives in the community of Urani Marca Callo.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement (a Peruvian feminist organization) for five years. She used her first loan, of 300 PEN, to buy small livestock.

She is now requesting a loan of 3000 PEN in order to buy large livestock to fatten. Fermina will use part of the loan to buy grain to sell at regional fairs.

Her greatest dream is to be able to sell products wholesale.

She enjoys the savings accounts and the meetings of her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large livestock and grain

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is a single parent with three children. She has a senior high school education. Esi sells plastic bowls at Esaman near Elmina, which she has done since 2004. Esi uses her income to pay for the education of the children. Esi will use the loan to purchase more plastic products for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to pay fees.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic products for resale

loans.name: Hoa Vo

texts.en:
Miss Hoa Vo T. is a vender in Mercado 4. She’s an extremely kind person and a hard worker. She sells phones and phone accessories, cosmetics, prescription glasses and sunglasses, and MP3 and MP4 players among other things. She’s a young woman who has started to become more independent and she now has two stalls in the Santo Domingo gallery.

Most of her clients include people that work in the market with her as well as other clients just passing through, some of whom are foreigners and some Paraguayans.

She is very well recommended in her community and is a very active person. She wants to start to work with the Fundación so she can have the opportunity to open another stall.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accesories for resale

loans.name: Lotovale

texts.en:
"Lotovale Tuavao (0) is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Leusoalii.  She is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Lotovale owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Lotovale has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Lotovale joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lotovale has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  Lotovale is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Lotovale plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
In God We Trust is a group of five borrowers led by Fanta D., who is 32 years old, married and has a two-year old child. Fanta is not educated, because before the late 1970’s her tribe, the Mandingo, believed that women did not need to be educated, but rather should rely on their husbands for their daily needs and financial matters. 

To deal with her lack of formal education, she learned tailoring and today both lives and works on McDonald Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She buys clothes wholesale and sells them retail. She also sells jewellery. Her business has been doing well.

Fatu started as a contractor but later opened her own shop. Sometimes, she faces difficulties and challenges because she has so many customers that she has a hard time taking care of all of them. Fatu believes that by buying the right goods and preparing them carefully for sale, she can retain her customers because everyone wants nice clothing.  

Fatu has been in business for more than 10 years but still wants to grow so she can own a big business and improve her skills. She would also like to build a house for her child.  She has applied for this loan to buy more clothes and better serve her customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Phearum

texts.en:
Phearum P., 28, has been married since 2007 and has a young son. He lives with his wife and mother in a small village along national road number one, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. His mother is a farmer; she grows vegetables and flowers. 

Phearum has been raising pigs for two years. His wife stays at home to take care of their son. She used to be a garment factory worker.  He hopes his business will do well, so he is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to purchase feed for his pigs.

loans.use: Purchase feed for pigs.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es: Porfirio R. L. de 52 años de edad reside en el departamento de San Salvador. Porfirio vive con su esposa y un hijo de 18 años de edad, estudiante. Porfirio tiene un negocio en una zona muy céntrica y de mucha afluencia, el ofrece variedades de frutas según lo que este de la temporada y cosecha, la mayoría de tiempo en el año, el coco nunca falta, pero hay ciertas frutas que siempre solicitan sus clientes que Porfirio debe surtir su inventario, y es por este motivo que solicita de un  crédito el cual destinara para  comprar frutas y bebidas.
texts.en:
Porfirio R. L. is 52 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador. Porfirio lives with his wife and his 18-year old son who is a student. Porfirio has a business in a centrally located and afluent area of town. He sells many types of fruit depending on what is in season and what has been harvested. For much of the year he sells coconut, but his clients always ask for certain fruits. So, Porfirio must offer a variety of products. He is seeking a loan to purchase more fruits and drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Augment Inventory

loans.name: Toem

texts.en:
Mrs. Toem S. lives in Andoung Samreth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Now she is requesting a loan to buy a water pump, fertilizers, and pesticides to support her rice field to make the crop more productive.

Toem S. is 66 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are motorbike repairers, one is a construction worker and the other two are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Koem Roeun, is a construction worker. He is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy an irrigation pump, fertilizers and pesticides for her rice field

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius C. is 32 years old and single. He transports people and goods on his motorbike in Mombasa's Changamwe area, something he has been doing for two years now. Pius has been able cover his living expenses with his income and has also managed to accumulate some savings. The location of his business is good and his services are in constant demand.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is now in his group. This will be his first loan. With a combination of the loan and his own savings, Pius plans to purchase a second motorbike to increase his daily income.

He hopes that one day he will become a leader in the transport industry and own several trucks. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: C5524 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Annonciatha is 31 years old, married with 3 children; they are 1, 6, and 12 years old.  In addition, she takes care of one dependent from another family who is 16 years old.  Annonciatha lives in Nyarugenge, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  Here, Annonciatha is the president of a group called Tuzamurane.  This is the group's third successful year in the business of selling foodstuffs such as beans, potatoes, fish, soft drinks and produce.  The hours of their business require that they work from early in the morning until late in the evening depending upon customer traffic on any given day.

The members of this group seek to improve their businesses and to increase their sales using the capital from this loan.  This is their first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, these members plan to carefully source and then purchase a greater quantity and variety of goods to sell.  The group believes that this will satisfy the needs of their customers as well as earn more profit for Tuzamurane.  With this profit, they will reinvest in their businesses so that in the future they can rely on equity and cash on hand for business expansion.  Also, they all plan to continue taking care of their families and loved ones and build secure futures for them.

loans.use: Foodstuffs such as beans, potatoes, soft drinks and produce

loans.name: Goussi

texts.fr: A. Goussi est née vers 1974 et réside depuis 26 ans à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Goussi est mariée à KOUASSI Codjo, un pêcheur, et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Fiégnon à Cotonou. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Goussi vend divers produits (savons, sardines, lait, sucre, piles, beurre, conserves, etc.) et aussi de la nourriture à son domicile. Goussi s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Il y a deux ans environs que Goussi exerce cette activité. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de l’institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Goussi sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de son activité et de constituer ainsi une épargne.
texts.en:
A. Goussi was born in 1974 and for the past 26 years she has lived in Fiégnon in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Goussi is married to Kouassi Codjo, a fisherman, and is the mother of four children, all of whom are attending school. The family lives in Fiégnon in Cotonou. Together, the couple supports the needs of the family. In order to handle the family's needs, Goussi sells a variety of products (soaps, sardines, milk, sugar, batteries, milk, jams etc.) and food; she sells these goods from her home. Goussi supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. For about two years, Goussi has had her business. She is an old client of ALIDé and she has obtained three loans from the micro-finance institution, all of each were fully repaid. Goussi is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, in order to grow her business and have greater savings.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products (boxes of james, sugar, soaps and milk)

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Heang P. (photographed with her daughter) has been a farmer for 20 years. She is 57 years old and lives along National Road No. 1 about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has nine children:  three sons and six daughters. Two of them are married and live away from the family home, two are garment factory workers, three attend school and the other two assist their mother with the farm. 
Heang is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela A. C., tiene la edad de 18 años, es soltera, y no tiene hijos. Ella vive con sus padres y dos hermanos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de 2 vacas para la cría y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia.Su padre se dedica  a la ganadería desde hace más de diez años y ella desea cooperar con esa actividad familiar. Es la primera vez que Marianela  se financea con  FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho, además que está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, además de poderse ayudar con sus estudios.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Marianela A. C., age 18, is single and has no children. She lives with her parents and two brothers. The loan she wants is for the purchase of two cows that that will bear calves. When the calves are grown she will sell them and obtain a profit. Her father has been involved with cattle-raising for ten years, and she wishes to collaborate with this family business.

This is the first time she has sought financing with FUDECOSUR. She states that the loan committee has helped her a lot. In addition, she is very happy with the terms they have offered her. She hopes to offer her family a better quality of life in the future and a more stable income. She also wants to be able to help with her school expenses. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle for breeding

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 24-year-old single man living with his parents and one sister. He has been working for the past eight years as an elevator technician. He works on a freelance basis upon request of his clients, taking new projects and repairing elevators.

Mohamad is the only provider for his family because his father stopped working after becoming old and sick. Today, Mohamad is requesting $1,000 to buy new tools needed for his work because he's planning to expand his business and take on more projects.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his business

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 36 years old and is married with one child who is one-and-a-half years of age. Jean Claude and his family live in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, in the village called Gatsata.

Jean Claude owns a small business selling timber and has been in business since 2008. This business is profitable for him simply because everyone in the town who needs to build has to use timber. His business is very organized and he employs five people from his community so that his business runs well.

Jean claude is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more timber for sale. With this loan he hopes to obtain more profits through selling more timbers every day from seven in the morning to nine in evening.

loans.use: To purchase more timber to sell

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla Patricia P. O. es comerciante del mercado Santa Ana ella trae el marisco desde jiquilillo para venderlo a las comerciantes de los dos mercados solo viene a entregarlos. La señora Karla P. empezó su negocio desde hace 15 años este negocio es familiar toda su familia entrega marisco su jornada empiezas desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las diez de la mañana tiene tres hijos todos en edad escolar la señora P. lucha por salir adelante para sus hijos y para ir acondicionando su casa. Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con estos financiamientos y los ha sabido administrar ya que ha salido adelante con su negocio y en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Karla Patricia P. O. is a trader at the Santa Market. She brings in seafood from Jiquilillo to sell to the merchants of the two markets that she supplies. Sra. Karla started her business 15 years ago. Her entire family begins their work day delivering seafood at 5am and continues until 10am. She has three children who are of school age. Sra. Karla strives to succeed for her children and provide them with a suitable home.

She has worked with these loans for four years and has been able to manage them so that she can get ahead in her business and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of seafood to sell to the market vendors

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille C. is from the village of Matab-ang, Dalipuga Iligan City. She is 36 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lucille owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lucille has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 2010 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucille joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the products offered. This will be the first loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the products offered

location.town: Matab-ang, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Esinyen

texts.en:
Esinyen has been selling fruit and vegetables from his house in Naivasha town for the last year. This has been very limiting as he can only reach his neighbors with his sales.

Esinyen now wants to build a kiosk to sell his fruits from. This will help him reach many other passersby who do not know he sells fruit and vegetables. This is the purpose of the proceeds from his loan. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.

Esinyen is 38 years old, is married to Esther Gikuri, and they have two school-going children.

Esinyen plans to grow his fruit and vegetable sales, open a big grocery shop, and become one of the main suppliers of fruit and vegetables in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy build a temporary kiosk to sell from

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren L. lives in Banga, South Cotabato. He is 59 years old and has three children.

Efren has only a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm but the income he gets from growing rice benefits all his children and grandchildren. He has spent his whole life as a farmer. He dreams that someday he will have bigger farm.

Efren would like to obtain a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy additional farm supplies to increase his harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva.
Alejandrina es soltera, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Alejandrina se dedica a la venta de golosinas de manera ambulatoria en una avenida concurrida, actividad que realiza todos los días por las tardes, y por las mañanas trabaja en una casa cocinando. Además se dedica a la crianza de animales menores.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuy y golosinas.
Los sueños de Alejandrina son tener casa propia y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 48, is a member of the "Agua Viva" (Living Water) communal bank. She is single and has 4 children. She sells snacks in an itinerant manner along a very crowded avenue every afternoon; during the mornings she works as a cook in a private home. In addition, she raises small farm animals. Alejandrina needs a 1000 sol loan to buy guinea pigs and snacks. Alejandrina's dreams are to have her own home and provide her son with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and snacks.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen H. is 34 years old, and he lives in Tsakhkunk village, Sevan area. His family consists of his wife, 3 children, his parents and his grandmother. He has higher education in the field of jurisprudence, but he hasn't any experience in his specialty. For about 10 years, Karen has been engaged in farming: he has a plot of land, some cows, calves, sheep and lambs. With income from farming, Karen provides for his big family’s needs and also he further develops his farming. 

In order to increase his family's revenue, Karen intends to organize potato growing, so he needs a 1,100,000 AMD loan to buy seed potatoes.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds to begin growing potatoes

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo E. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is a 53-year-old farmer and carpenter. He tills his own land where he plants and harvests rice crops for sale. He also does carpentry, mostly for people he knows in his community. He has been engaged in his businesses for more than twenty years now. He says he works hard to help improve his family's living conditions.

In 2009, Alfredo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and carpentry materials. This will be the second loan taken out by Alfredo from CEVI.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and carpentry materials

loans.name: Aline

texts.es:
La señora Aline es casada, vive con su esposo e hijo en casa propia en la zona Villa Pavón de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Aline trabaja en una óptica en la zona de Miraflores y su esposo es vendedor de una importadora de cerámica y ambos con su sueldo mantienen su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una losa flotante para la construcción de una habitación y esto mejorará las condiciones de la vivienda.
Esta es la tercera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ms. Aline is married and lives with her husband and son in a home of their own, located in the Villa Pavón zone of La Paz. Ms. Aline works in an optical shop in the Miraflores zone and her husband is a salesman for a ceramic importer. They use both of their earnings to maintain their home. They will use the money from this loan to build the foundation for the house they will build and this will improve their living conditions. This is the third occasion on which she has requested a loan, and our analysis of her socioeconomic status qualifies her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a home

loans.name: Bosco Feliciano

texts.es:
Bosco de 51 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas), el da el servicio de transporte de puerta a puerta. 

El se fue a Estados Unidos a trabajar y tener mas posibilidades económicas pero como sus hijos crecían sin la guía de su padre, el decidió regresar a Ecuador y trabajar como chofer. Poco a poco con esfuerzo el continuo con su trabajo de chofer aunque ya separado de su esposa pero dedicándole aun mas tiempo a sus hijos. 

No ha tenido el dinero necesario para construir mejo su casa por eso con el crédito quiere comprar cemento, bloques y cables, en el futuro quiere tener un taller de reparación de cocinas y alquilarlas.
texts.en:
Bosco is 51 and lives in Las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area that is called "The Orchids" because when it was discovered, there were many orchids here). He offers a door-to-door transportation service. He went to the United States to work and to have more economic opportunities, but as his children were growing up without the guidance of their father, he decided to return to Ecuador and work as a chauffeur. Little by little, and with effort, he continued his work as a chauffeur even though he was separated from his wife and was dedicating even more time to his children. He hasn't had the money he needs to build a home. This is why he will use this loan to buy cement, bricks, and cables. In the future, he hopes to have a repair shop for stoves and also rent them out.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, bricks, and cables

loans.name: Chuluunbat

texts.en:
Chuluunbat is 42 years old and lives with his wife and their 2 children and 3 grandchildren in his own ger, a  traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. He has three other children who are grown up and live separately. Before 2005 he used to rent a stall in a local market to sell garments.

In 2005 he improved his business, bought a minivan, obtained a license for carrying people and started a transportation business. During this time he has been four times nominated as the "Best worker of the year" by his employers. 

His route is 50 km's long and he runs this route  5 to 6  a day, carrying passengers all year around.  Chuluunbat has taken the loan from our organisation 4 times and each time he has repaid in full and on time. He has become one of our reliable customers. He used these loans to build a house for his son, who was just married. 

Chuluunbat is very responsible, hardworking person. He is asking for this loan, because winter time is coming and he wants to buy spare parts and make proper repairs and maintenance on his minivan and also to build a warm garage to his car.

loans.use: to repair his minivan and build a garage to prepare for winter's cold

loans.name: Mouena

texts.en:
Mouena C. is 24 and engaged with 1 child.  She owns a business venture planting, harvesting and selling fruits & vegetables.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.  

In 2008, Mouena joined SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Mouena's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.  She has had 2 previous loans with this organization, and is asking for a new loan of WST 2,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand her business.

About  SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD, and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline P., 47 years old, is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Lino P., a carpenter, and the mother of seven children, one of whom is in college and three of whom are enrolled in high school. The remaining three children stay at home, helping with the chores and running the household while Evangeline and her husband work.

Evangeline operates a rug-making business and does sideline work as a laundry woman. She primarily sells doormats but she also sells rugs, towels, braided quilts, bed sheets, and other crafts. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.  

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional raw materials, such as fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  Evangeline dreams of giving her children a good education through her hard work at her business. 

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups meet each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns

loans.name: Yessenia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Yessenia del S. C. S., es una joven de 29 años de edad, casada y con un hijo de 3 añitos, ellos viven en un pueblo de la ciudad de Masaya llamado Nindiri, su esposo labora como vendedor, proveyendo un importante sustento económico al hogar, ella labora como cajera de un sucursal de un Banco, de la ciudad, labora en esa identidad desde hace 3 años, ellos han logrado edificar su vivienda con mucho esfuerzo y poco  a poco, dentro de sus planes esta la culminación de las construcciones de sus vivienda y para esto solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que lleven a cabo este objetivo sobre todo que su pequeño ya está creciendo y las condiciones no son las mejores de esta manera se  atenderá  a su salud, bienestar, y protección, con este crédito lograran mejores condiciones que favorezcan a  toda la familia. Sobre todo que es un matrimonio de recién casados que se abren paso a emprender su bienestar economico-social.
texts.en:
Yessenia del S. C. S. is a young woman of 29. She is married and has a 3-year-old child. They live in a village in the metropolitan area of Masaya, called Nindiri. Her husband works as a vendor, providing significant economic support to the household. Yessenia works as a cashier in a bank branch in the city. She has worked at this job for 3 years. She and her husband have succeeded in building the basic frame of a house, with great effort and little by little. Among their plans are finishing the construction of their home, and for this reason they are requesting a loan to buy construction materials to achieve this objective. Above all, their little child is growing up, and their current conditions are not the best. In this way, they will be able to attend to his health, well-being and protection. With this loan, they will achieve better conditions which will benefit the entire family. Above all, this is a recently married couple who are reaching for an opportunity to improve their economic and social well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing the construction of their home

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is currently in the business of selling sugar and rice and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice to sell. Joyce is 40 years old and is married to a businessman. She has four children and her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to stock crates of beer to sell.

loans.use: Stock more bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Martha Johanna

texts.es: Martha Johanna tiene 22 años es una joven muy emprendedora y disfruta mucho de su actividad  que es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio que lo inicio por medio de la venta de ropa pues inicio poco a poco por lo que se ha caracterizado por conocer muy bien a sus clientes y ofrecer un excelente servicio esto es lo que atrae a la mayoría de personas que es muy responsable y dinámica. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de sabanas, toallas, manteles, ropa interior, cosméticos, ropa en general entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Martha Johanna, age 22, is a very enterprising young woman.  She greatly enjoys her work, which is selling general merchandise.  She has had this business for over three years.  She started the business by selling clothes.  Little by little she has become known for knowing her customers very well and for her excellent service.  This is what attracts most of the people; she is very responsible and dynamic.

She is requesting the loan to buy sheets, towels, tablecloths, underwear, cosmetics, and general clothing, among other things.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: 10 Estrellitas Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la Casa de Mirna R. un integrante del grupo 10 Estrellitas, que está ubicado en la ciudad de Orizaba en el Estado de Veracruz en México. Se ve a la señora Mirna junto alas demás integrantes del grupo en la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de temporada que inicio hace 10 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar suéteres, abrigos, cobertores, y más ropa para vender esta temporada. Sus clientes la consideran una persona honesta y responsable en la cual se puede confiar. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta y muy satisfecha. Tiene  40 años, estudio hasta la carrera comercial, es casada y tiene en total 3 hijos: 1 mujer y 2 varones. Quiere este crédito para comprar la ropa de temporada para vender. También espera poder hacer crecer su clientela y con esto incrementar sus ventas para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This photo was taken at Mirna R.’s house, one of the members of the “10 Estrellitas” (10 Little Stars) group, located in Orizaba, Veracruz, México.  One can see Mirna with the other group members in the photo.

She has sold seasonal clothing for the last 10 years.  She is asking for the loan to buy sweaters, coats, comforters and other clothes to sell this season.  Her customers consider her to be an honest and responsible person that they can trust.

She feels very happy and satisfied while requesting the loan.  She is 40 years old and studied a commercial career.  She’s married and has three children, one girl and two boys.

She wants the loan to buy seasonal clothes to sell.  She also hopes to increase her customer base so that sales will increase thus improving her income.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes.

loans.name: Jamiyansuren

texts.en: Jamiyansuren J. is 26 years old and lives with his wife and infant twin sons in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. They live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife is an economist and currently unemployed while taking care of their sons. Jamiyansuren is an engineer and operates a cellphone selling and repair business in his town. He started his cellphone business in 2010 after working in the local television center. He has established himself in the local business community and has a steady operation. He is a very hardworking and open-minded person who hopes expand his business in the future. He hopes to one day have his own electronic appliance trade center in his town. Jamiyansuren is requesting a 900,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase cellphone parts for his business.

loans.use: To purchase cellphone parts

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
Mariana De Jesús D. V. tiene 26 años. Es soltera, vive con la mama y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL BATAN se encuentra ubicada 90 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla esta conformado por 21 socios que se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Mariana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz desde hace mucho tiempo. Compra sus productos en el Cantón Bucay y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando.

Le gusta seguir trabajando con la familia..
texts.en:
Mariana De Jesús D. V. is 26 years old.  She is single and lives with her mother and her child.  She lives in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'El Batan' solidarity group is located 90 minutes from the Chillanes office, in Chillanes canton.  This group has 21 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, growing cacao, cassava and corn.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Mariana has been growing cacao, cassava and corn for a long time.  She buys her products in Bucay canton and sells them in Chillanes market and in the district.

Mariana is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her cacao crops.  The support of this loan will help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to continue working.  She likes to work with her family.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Daniel Mungai

texts.en:
Daniel Mungai, 35 years old, runs a general shop at Kingstone Estate, which is a densely populated area. He is married to Judith, and together, they have one daughter, Jane M..  He was introduced to KADET by another KADET client.

Daniel has been running this business for a period of seven years, and his monthly profit is Kshs 33,000.  This loan of Kshs 90,000 is his third loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use Kshs 40,000 to buy maize flour, Kshs 20,000 to buy cooking fat, Kshs 20,000 to buy wheat flour and Kshs 10,000 to buy four bags of rice. If the loan boosts his business, Daniel will open another shop.

Daniel dreams of owning a wholesale shop in the future. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To increase stock of Maize flour, wheat flour, cooking fat and rice

loans.name: Pum's Group

texts.en:
In Liek village in Kandal province, there are 15 members who form a village-bank loan. This village selected Mrs. Pum A., a 39-year-old married woman, as the village-bank president. The members of this village hope that they will increase their incomes to improve their families' living conditions with the use of this loan.

Mrs. Pum A. is a farmer who owns a piece of land in which she cultivates rice for a living. In order to support her family, she would like to ask for a loan to buy rice for eating. Her husband, Mr. Pech Bros, 40 years old, works as a construction worker and is able to earn only a little salary to support his family. 

This couple works very hard to support their three children, one of whom is a laborer while the others are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice for eating

loans.name: Francisca Maria

texts.es:
Francisca de 64 años, es una mujer trabajadora que el destino de la compañía donde trabajaba la despidieron comenzó a vender víveres para tener su tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Cuando ella fue despedida y con el dinero de la liquidación decidió comprar vivieres y ubicar una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Ha venido trabajando durante años en su tienda vendiendo variedades de víveres y en ocasiones cosméticos para tener un dinero adicional.  

Ella quiere seguir con su tienda pero por ahora quiere comprar con el préstamo cosméticos para surtir su tienda y que mujeres compren con más frecuencia.
texts.en:
Francisca, age 64, is a hardworking woman who began selling groceries from a store at the front of her house after she lost her job working at a company.

After she was fired, Francisca used her severance pay to buy groceries and open a small store in the front part of her house. Her business has been operating for many years and offers a variety of groceries and occasionally cosmetics to generate additional income.

Francisca wants to keep her store in operation, so she now wants to use this loan to restock her store with cosmetics that women frequently buy.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to sell in her store

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Felix Adolfo tiene 51 años. Es un hombre casado y tiene 3 hijos a si cargo que dependen de él. En su vivienda está ubicado el negocio de Felix que es una pulpería, en donde ofrece productos de consumo diario. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ayudado mucho para el apoyo familiar. El es un hombre muy humilde, pero trabajador, por lo que es siempre se ha encargado de vigilar que a sus hijos no les falte nada. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, pan y golosinas en general. Su deseo es obtener una pequeña distribuidora para seguir proporcionando a s familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Mr. Felix Adolfo is 51 years old; he is married and has three dependent children. He has a general store in his house where he sells every day products. He has had this business for more than 15 years and it has been his source of income. He is a very humble man and a hard worker who has always made sure that his family is well provided for.

He is requesting a loan as work capital to buy rice, oil, beans, sugar, bread and the like. His wish is to obtain a small distributor to be able to continue providing for his family.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mamoutou

texts.fr:
Monsieur MAMOUTOU M. est marié, âgé de trente trois ans et père de deux enfants. Elle vit dans une famille monogame avec sa femme et ses enfants à SANANKOROBA situé à 35  kilomètres de Bamako (capitale du Mali). 
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans réussite, il décida d’intégrer le système crédit  de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à son premier prêt individuel .
Il compte acheter, 10 sacs de sucre, 5 cartons de thé et d’autres produits à Bamako qu’il stockera chez lui, avant de les  vendre dans sa boutique, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et des femmes résidant à Sanankoroba et environnants. Il mène cette activité durant toute l’année et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois.
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice de 45.000  F CFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour les dépenses de la famille et investir dans son activité de vente de boutique.
texts.en: Mr. MAMOUTOU M. is married, 33 years old, and father of two children.  He lives in a monogamous family with his wife and children in SANANKOROBA, located 35 kilometers from Bamako (the capital of Mali).  After pursuing many businesses without success, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, where he has his first individual loan.  He intends to buy 10 bags of sugar, 5 cartons of tea, and other products in Bamako, which he will store at his home, before selling them in his shop to male and female customers that live in and around Sanakoroba.  He runs this business throughout the year and stocks up twice per month. He hopes to make a profit of 45,000 FCFA per month, which he will use for family expenses and invest in his retail business.

loans.use: Purchase of various products

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: H. is currently in a business of selling beer, soda and water. She is 34 years old and a widow, with two children who both go to school. H. took out a loan to stock more beer, soda and water to sell. In the future she hopes to buy cattle and open up a shop with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more beer, soda and water.

loans.name: Rosario Cristina

texts.en:
Rosario Cristina is 27 years old, married, and has one child who is currently in school. Rosario works as a weaver and has five years' experience in the business. She started out operating a machine and is now a skilled weaver. She hopes to one day own more machines and space in which to use them. 

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase some land for her family and business. This is Maria´s third loan through ASDIR. The previous two loans were paid back in full with no problems.

loans.use: to purchase land for her family and her weaving work.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El señor David hombre  convive con su pareja padre de 1 hija pequeña, su actividad es de el servicio de transporte urbano (taxi trufi) es muy importante saber que para nuestra satisfacción el cliente lucha para darle una mejor forma de vida a su familia la actividad que el realiza es diaria y tiene una competitividad grande en el mercado pero aun así el cliente lleva en su mente el crecimiento personal,  gracias al crédito otorgado por la institución emprender el cliente puede realizar su trabajo sin ningún riesgo  de parar y dejar de llevar la alimentación de cada día a su casa y familia, ya que el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en el mantenimiento  de su vehículo,  el rendimiento que tiene el cliente es bastante valorado por el crecimiento del mismo.
texts.en: David lives with his partner, and is father to a young daughter. He works in urban transport, driving a taxi. It's very important to know that for our satisfaction the client is struggling to give his family a better life. He works every day in a very competitive market, but he always keeps his personal growth in mind. Thanks to the loan offered by the institution Emprender, the client can do his work without the fear that he'll have to stop and no longer be able to feed his family every day. He will use the loan to pay for maintenance on his car, which is essential for increasing his income.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle and purchase accessories

loans.name: Mae Ann

texts.en:
Mae Ann owns and operates a dry goods sales business. She and her husband have two children and she works hard to help support her family. 

Mae Ann has requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy an Envirofit cookstove. This will make the firewood that she buys last longer because the Envirofit stove needs less fuel in order to cook food. Mae Ann is aware that by using the Envirofit, she is not only saving money but is also helping the environment, as well as reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo, de 26 años, es un hombre alegre y trabajador, convive con Cecilia de 22 años, ambos tienen 2 hijos, Sarai, de 5 y Tany, de 2 años, los cuatro viven en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Santa Clara. Sus planes futuros son adquirir terrenos agrícolas propios, por ello, hace 5 años que viene trabajando con ahínco en sus terrenos alquilados, donde siembra, papa, arveja, habas y demás hortalizas, las que después de cada cosecha las comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad de “Tarma”. Cada cosecha, producto de su esfuerzo,  le brinda buenas utilidades con las que gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal pudo lograrlo. Cada día está ahorrando y ya le falta muy poco para obtener su propio terreno, con ello augura tener más ganancias, y poder comprar muchos más. Además cuenta que posee 4 vacas lecheras que le proporcionan la leche suficiente para hacer moldes de queso que vende en las ferias que se realizan los días jueves y domingo, en el mercado modelo de la ciudad. Paralelo a este trabajo tiene 2 toros; grandes y fuertes que le ayudan a arar la tierra donde cultiva sus principales productos oriundos de la zona. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP; donde agradece las enseñanzas bridadas por los miembros de su entidad, los que le impulsaron a salir adelante y pensar en el futuro. Eso lo motivo a ser el presidente de su banquito. Eduardo comenzará su siembra de papa de la variedad “primeriza”. Papa que requiere de muchos cuidados, por ello con el dinero solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, fertilizantes naturales (guano de isla y de corral), para asegurar la buena producción.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 26, is a happy and hard-working man.  He lives with Cecilia, 22, and they have 2 children:  Sarai, who is 5, and Tany, who is 2.  The 4 of them live in their own house located in a rural area of Santa Clara.  Their future plans are to acquire their own agricultural land.  Eduardo has been working diligently for 5 years on rented land where he grows potatoes, peas, beans, and other vegetables.  After each harvest, he sells them at the central market in the city of Tarma.  Every harvest is a product of his effort.  He makes good profits, and he is thankful to his communal bank for their support.  He is saving money every day, and he now lacks very little to be able to buy his own land.  With it, he predicts that he will have more profits and will be able to buy much more.  He also has 4 dairy cows that produce enough milk to make molds of cheese that he sells at a market on Thursdays and Sundays.  He also has 2 strong, big bulls that help him plow the land where he grows his main native crops of the area.

He belongs to the communal bank, "Trabajemos unidos" (We Work United), and this is his seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  He is thankful for the lessons offered by the members of this group, which motivated him to get ahead and think about the future.  This is what motivated him to be the president of his little bank.  Eduardo began his potato crop with the variety, "primeriza," which requires a lot of care.  With the money requested, he will buy various bags of organic fertilizer (such as bird manure) to ensure a good production.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo” ubicado en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento D. Puno, tiene 59 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 06 hijos (3 independientes).  La señora estudió educación primaria (incompleta).
María se dedica a la venta D. animales caseros y venta D. soga, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace un año, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará dos paquetes D. cabuyas (sogas) para luego venderlas.  En el negocio la ayudan sus hijos ya que su esposo trabaja fuera D. la ciudad.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y crecer como empresaria.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
María is a member of the "Chijuyo Copapujo” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 59 years old, married, and has six children (three of whom live independently).  She did not complete her elementary school education.

María sells animals and rope.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her initial loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business.

María will use this loan for 1,000 soles to buy two packets of pita fiber (rope) to re-sell.  Her children help her in her business since her husband works outsiD. the city.  Her dream is to improve her business and grow as a businesswoman.

What María likes about her community bank is the interest she makes on her savings.

loans.use: to buy two packets of pita fiber (rope)

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria  es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos (2 independientes).  Ella cuenta con educación secundaria (incompleta).
Hilaria trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, su primer préstamo  solicitado de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio venta de artefactos, joyas y relojes, la señora tiene un puesto de venta en la localidad de Juliaca.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles incrementará al capital que tiene y comprará artefactos como: calculadoras, reloj, radios, etc, también dice que se dedica a la compra y venta de carros en la ciudad de Puno, su esposo trabaja en una empresa como operario de construcción. 
Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar el negocio.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal es la  facilidad del préstamo y las ganancias de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Hilaria is a member of the "3 de Mayo" community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 52 years old, married, and has four children (two of whom live independently).  She did not complete high school.

Hilaria has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling small appliances, jewelry and watches.  Hilaria has a sales location in the town of Juliaca.   She will use this new loan for 1,000 soles to increase her capital and buy small appliances such as calculators, watches, radios, etc.  She says that she also buys and sells cars in the city of Puno.  Her husband works for a company as a construction worker.

Hilaria's dream is to have more capital so that she can improve her business.  What she likes about her community bank is the ease of the loans and the interest that she makes on her savings.

loans.use: to buy small appliances such as calculators, watches, radios, etc.

loans.name: Elisa Jessica

texts.en:
Elisa Jessica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Elisa Jessica earns additional income from fish vending.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Elisa Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 32-year-old business man.  He is single and has no children. In 2001, this borrower opened his tailoring business. He started out as an apprentice and now is well-established and is sewing for important people. 

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 650,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy a new sewing machine. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000 . 

In the future, he plans to open up a fashion shop. The borrower's business has many competitors, but due to his excellent sewing, customers always request his services. He is a very hardworking youth. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Geoconda Marbelly

texts.es: Geoconda es casada, tiene 2 hijos, gracias a este proyecto habitacional obtuvo su vivienda para irla pagando poco a poco; obtiene sus ingresos por venta de leche, queso, cuajada y venta de joyas de plata. Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de continuar mejorando su casa, esta vez para poner el piso del porche y terminarlo, ya que con el credito anterior solo pudo hacer su cocina, y ahora espera poder terminar el porche para brindarle a sus hijos mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Geoconda is married and has two children.  Thanks to a housing project, she obtained a home which she is able to pay for bit by bit.  She makes income through selling milk, cheese, 'cuajada' (milk curd) and silvery jewelry.  

Geoconda is requesting her second loan so that she can continue improving her home.  This time she will lay flooring on her porch and finish it off since, with her previous loan, she was only able to do her kitchen and she hopes to be able to finish off the porch so that she can provide her children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to lay flooring on her porch

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анна – молодой предприниматель из Запорожья. Она торгует на одном из самых крупных рынков города – Анголенко. Она торгует польскими детскими товарами: верхней одеждой, бельем, шапочками и конвертами. Этот товар Анна считает самым качественным из доступных по цене большинству населения города. Хотя Анна работает в этой сфере торговли всего 3 года, она сумела приобрести хороший опыт и умение торговать.  

Свое дело Анна открыла благодаря помощи мамы, которая отдала ей прилавок и помогла финансово. За 3 года торговли Анна уже вложила 40.000 гривен в это предприятие. Ее ежемесячная чистая прибыль составляет около 6.000 гривен. На данный момент кредит в 20.000 гривен Анне необходим для закупки нового осеннего товара, пока не поднялись оптовые цены. В планах дальнейшего развития своего дела у Анны открытие как минимум еще одной торговой точки в ближайшем будущем. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Anna is a young entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She sells polish-made children's items (outerwear, undergarments, hats and baby carriers) at one of the largest markets in the city - Angolenko. Her goods offer the best quality for a reasonable price, Anna believes. Although she has held this job only for three years, Anna has become very experienced and acquired good salesmanship. 

Anna opened her business with help from her mother, who gave her a market stall and assisted financially. During these three years, Anna has invested 40,000 grivna's into her business and her monthly profit is about 6,000 grivna's.
