Anna is asking for a loan of 20,000 grivna's to purchase new fall clothing before wholesale prices rise. Anna plans to open a new sales point in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new fall merchandise before wholesale prices rise

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 10 años, el padre de José le enseño desde joven a trabajar en la agricultura, sembrando la tierra con tomates, chiles, ejotes y pipián, trabaja todos los días y dos veces por semana sale a ofrecer su producción.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono para la siembra de tres tareas de tomates, pues necesita preparar la tierra para que su siembra sea fuerte y resista a las plagas.
Este préstamo sea una gran ayuda para él, pues tendrá todo lo necesario para el cultivo; su sueño es contar con una vivienda elaborada de concreto para estar más seguros con su familia y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is a vegetable farmer and lives with his wife and 10 year old son.  José's father taught him how to work in agriculture at a very young age by sowing soil with tomatoes, chilies, green beans, and squash. He works everyday and twice a week he goes out to offer his products to sell. He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer to grow three crops of tomatoes and needs to prepare the crops to be strong and resistant to plagues. 
This loan will be of great help to him since he will have everything necessary to cultivate. His dream is to build a cement house to offer his family better security and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy fertilizer to grow tomatoes.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 33 years old, married with three children.  He runs a barber shop to earn a living.  In his barber shop, he also offers services like charging mobile phone batteries for a fee.  In addition, he sells charcoal to supplement his income.

With the income from his businesses, Daniel is able to provide for his family including educating his children.  He hopes to expand his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a shaving machine.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine

loans.name: Maria Liria

texts.es:
A sus 51 años de edad, Maria Liria es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace algún tiempo se dedica a la confección de camisetas y chaquetas lo que le permite contribuir con el cubrimiento de los gastos del hogar. 

Maria Liria necesita de un crédito para comprar una máquina recubridora lo que le permitirá generar mayores ingresos pues no tendrá que subcontratar este servicio como lo hace actualmente.
texts.en:
At 51 years of age, Maria Liria is an entrepreneurial woman who has been making t-shirts and jackets for some time.  This enables her to contribute towards covering her household expenses. 

Maria Liria needs a loan to buy a 'máquina recubridora' (a special kind of sewing machine used for hemming).  This will allow her to make more income as she will no longer have to subcontract out this service which is what she currently does.

loans.use: to buy a 'máquina recubridora' (a special kind of sewing machine used for hemming)

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a house that she rents, which neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighboring community members in the area. She does a fish selling business to add to her income. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in the businesses. Saumu dreams of expanding her businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, salt, sugar and dried fish for resale. Saumu joined Yehu Microfinance to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, salt, sugar and dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel tiene 25 años, es una mujer muy activa y emprendedora, convive con su pareja, con quien tiene tres hijos de 5, 4 y 10 meses. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. Su trabajo consiste en la venta de pescado seco, alimentos tiene demanda de los pobladores de su ciudad. Es así que se provee de este alimentos en el río Ucayali, y de ahi se encarga de secarlos y poner sal, por lo que pueden estar asi durante tiempos sin descomponerse.  En el que luego son llevado a vender a los comerciantes. Tiene cinco años realizando este trabajo, y en compañía de su esposo, que juntos hacen un buen equipo de trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que dispone de tiempo para cuidar de sus hijos, sin embargo corre riesgo cada vez que va al rio en busca de pescado, por que hay momentos en que es muy caudoloso. Además menciona que mas adelante le gustaría realizar otra actividad como es la siembra de maíz. Este será su sexto créstamo con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para concretar su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará semillas para empezar con la siembra de maíz, considera que es una buena inversión, pues demora tres meses para comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Raquel is an active, enterprising 25 year old woman. She lives with her partner and three children, ages 5, 4, and 10 months.  They live together in their own home.  She makes her living selling dried fish, a food that is in demand by the people in her city.  She obtains this fish from the Ucayali River, and then dries and salts it so that it may be preserved over time. Then she sells it to shopkeepers.  She has been engaged in this occupation for five years and she and her husband make a good team.  She likes this job because it gives her time to take care of her children.  However, she runs a risk each time she goes to the river in search of fish because there are times when the currents flow strongly.  

In addition, she mentions that, in the future, she would like to embark on another activity: growing corn.  This will be her sixth loan with MFP and she hopes for the support of each one of you to carry out her job.  With the amount requested, she will buy seeds to start planting corn.  She considers this a good investment because it takes three months to sell them.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea is a widow with three sons who are in school. She lives in a village off National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. She sells fruits and flowers, which she buys from fellow villagers and transports to sell in the Phnom Penh market. 

Thea hopes to continue her business, so she is asking for another loan of $1,000 to purchase flowers under contract for sale.

loans.use: To purchase flowers to sell

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en: Arnel is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. Arnel is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for the gasoline and maintenance. Arnel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Arnel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline and maintenance.

loans.name: Hernán De Jesús

texts.es: Tener un carro propio que le permita transportar las frutas es el sueño de Hernán de Jesús del municipio de Santa Barabara al suroeste del departamento de Antioquia en Colombia. Por ahora este emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de mangos y así obtener mejores precios para incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Hernán de Jesús' dream is to having his own car which would allow him to transport his fruit. He lives in the municipality of Santa Barabara to the southwest of the department of Antioquia in Colombia. For the moment, this entrepreneur needs a loan to buy a larger amount of mangoes to sell at better prices to increase profits.

loans.use: to buy mangoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for more ingredients to make fried snacks to sell.

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara is the leader of this group. She is 34 and married to a driver. Together with her husband she brings up four children. Three sons study at school and the youngest son is preschool age (under seven). In order to earn money to meet the family needs Dinara cultivates agricultural products. Selling some part of the harvest, she earns about 2000 soms per month. The profits gained from this activity helped the family to save money to purchase a mini-bus for transporting passengers and make additional money. With money received from the loan, Dinara wants to purchase 60kg of barley. In the near future she plans to start selling wheat and barley.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase 60kg of barley

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 54-year-old man from the Tegere area of Migori county, situated along the shores of Lake Victoria. He is married to Annah and they have six children.

Joseph operates a cereal selling business. Ha has been doing this for the past ten years and thus has vast experience. Joseph, who makes a monthly income of KES. 30,000, is taking his fourth loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy more stock of maize. He will plow back his profits and ensure that the business is always well stocked.

His dream is to improve his family’s living standards by providing them with the basic needs.

loans.use: To buy maize for sale.

loans.name: Yesenia Beatriz

texts.es:
Yesenia, vive con sus hijas, su madre, todos en la misma vivienda, ella 10 comerciantes de frutas tiene más de 10 años de experiencia, este puesto de venta no tiene instalado en una zona de comercio, sus hijas le apoyan para atender a los clientes.
Ella solicitó un préstamo para la compra de frutas frescas como manzanas, uvas, peras, bananas, entre otras que son muy necesarias y que los clientes la demanda a diario, esta inversión ayudará primeramente tener experiencia en el manejo de los préstamos y con su negocio fortalecido.
Sus sueños es ser una comerciante con un amplio negocio en diversas frutas, atendiendo a la clientela de una forma eficiente y proveyendo para su familia todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Yesenia lives with her daughters and her mother in the same home. She sells fruit and has more than ten years of experience. This trading post is not in a commercial zone. Her daughters help her serve her customers.  

She has asked for a loan to buy fresh fruit like apples, grapes, pears, bananas, etc that are needed and that her customers ask for every day. This investment will primarily help her get experience in how loans work and with strengthening her business. 

Her dream is to be a merchant with a large business with various fruit, serving her customers efficiently and providing her family with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy applies, grapes, pears, and bananas.

loans.name: Nancy Mwende

texts.en: Nancy is 29 years old, married, and has a four-year-old daughter. She describes herself as a jovial woman. She has run a pharmacy where she sells creams, syrups, tablets, and surgical supplies for the last four years. Her business is faced with the problem of insufficient funds. She will use the requested loan of KES 20,000 to buy syrups and surgical supplies. Nancy's dream and hope is to run a bigger pharmacy retail store.

loans.use: to buy medicines and surgical supplies.

loans.name: Tausili

texts.en:
Tausili is forty mine years old and is married with four children. Tausili owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has two years of experience in this business. Tausili needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2010, Tausili joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tausili's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a  63-year-old businessman who is married to Domifila, who is a farmer. They are blessed with three children, ages 26, 24 and 19.  For the past 27 years, David has been a livestock trader. He earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES that he uses to support his family.

David is applying for his fourth loan with KADET to buy more livestock to trade. He has successfully repaid his previous loans. David will use the anticipated profit from his business to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a pick-up truck to transport his stock to different markets.

loans.use: to buy livestock to trade

loans.name: Divine 2 Group

texts.fr: DIVINE 2 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Véronique (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 28 ans. Véronique n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Véronique est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Michel. Le couple a un enfant qui n'est pas encore scolarisé et à leur charge. Véronique vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Véronique vend de la nourriture de façon ambulante depuis six ans et des oignons de façon secondaire, ce qui lui permet de faire face aux divers besoins. Véronique s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Véronique sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe DIVINE 2, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, du poissons et des condiments.

loans.name: Be

texts.en: Mrs. Be is a hardworking woman, 43 years old. There are six people in her family. She would like to improve her family’s living standard but has a lack of capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from husbandry and hired labour.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Romel Josue

texts.es:
La creatividad corroe por la mente de Romel, un joven de 24 años de edad, que elabora artes de publicidad gracias al niño que lleva adentro y que lo hace crear artes innovadoras. Actualmente él está trabajando como diseñador gráfico de una empresa privada, está casado y está terminando su último año de la licenciatura en Mercadeo. 
El esfuerzo propio, ha hecho de Romel uno de los mejores en su trabajo y de su universidad. Ahora que se encuentra a punto de coronar esta etapa importante en su vida, no quiere tener ni una sola barrera para concluirla, por lo que solicita un préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación, con el que obtendrá su título como licenciado y podrá expandirse a un mundo laboral más amplio, donde podrá proyectar sus habilidades. En un futuro, este visionario desea establecer su propia empresa, mejorar su vivienda y así optimizar sus condiciones personales y profesionales.

loans.use: Pagar su curso de titulación.

loans.name: Logossou Kokou

texts.en:
Mr. Logossou Kokou A. nicknamed \"Paolo\" was born on October 18, 1972 in Lomé. A very bright and intelligent child, he never learn the form of artist/painting/drawer which he exercises with efficacity. His paintings have made him a celebrity during various expositions. Thanks to this work, he is able to take care of his parents and his three brothers. Today, he is hoping to hold a large art show which would allow him to be better known as his paintains are appreciated in greater depth in Europe and the United States. This project is important and deserves to be supported, and Mr. A. lacks the necessary funds to carry this out. It is important to note that Mr. A. already has experience with finance loans as he has already benefited in the past from two loans of $300 and $650 that he managed well and repaid without any incident. He can therefore be supported with confidence. He is asking for a credit of $1500 today which would allow him to open his own shop and to buy matierlas necessary to produce his work. This project would allow him to become even more famous and would allow him to have a more certain revenue to satisfy the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Logossou Kokou de sobriquet « Paolo » est né le 18 octobre 1972 à Lomé. Garçon très doué et un génie, il n’a pas appris métier d’artiste-peintre-décorateur-dessinateur qu’il exerce avec efficacité et ses tableaux l’ont rendu célèbre lors de diverses expositions. Et grâce à ce travail, il arrive à prendre en charge ses parents et ses trois frères encore élèves. Aujourd’hui, il cherche à donner une grande dimension à son activité et a l’ambition de préparer une grande exposition qui lui permettra de s’ouvrir davantage sur l’extérieur car les tableaux sont plus appréciés en Europe et aux Etats-Unis. Cet important projet qui mérite d’être soutenu, demande assez de moyens dont ne dispose pas M. A.. Il faut noter que M. A. a déjà des expériences en matière de gestion des crédits car il avait bénéficié par le passé de deux crédits respectifs de $300 et $650 qu’il avait su bien gérer et rembourser sans incident. Il mérite tout confiance d’être financièrement soutenu. Il sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $1500 qui servira à louer à aménager un local pour ouvrir sa boutique et à acheter des matériels de travail nécessaires pour ses prestations et productions. La réalisation de ce projet le rendra encore plus célèbre et lui permettra de disposer d’un revenu sûr pour la satisfaction des besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Rent and update a store to open his boutique and to buy work materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Nuck Rachael

texts.en:
Born in 1970, Rachael is married and has four children, all in school. Difficulties making money to meet especial the school needs of her kids motivated her to ask for her first loan in 2005. With her training in marketing techniques, credit and general management, and experience in the utilization and repayment of two previous loans, and available support from group and center members  Rachel plans to continue with her current line of business, Mixed Farming.

With a loan of $400, she plans to increase the size of her poultry as demand has continued to be greater than supplies. She will use the loan to buy fowls, drinkers, feeders, and feed and vet services. She intends to use the droppings in cultivating vegetables and yam, and to sell excess to other farmers in her community. 

Her community shall benefit additional supply of fresh organic food. from her activities in that there are always ready chickens for occasions. She equally sells the excess manure form her poultry to other members of her community. She promise to repay the loan in 18 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the first month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Buying of planting seeds, chicks and piglets

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.en:
Altagracia Bienvenida T. has a diner called “Bienvenida’s.” She cooks daily for a few drop-ins, but also contracts cooking with rather large businesses that surround her restaurant. There were some customers present during the interview and they explained: “She really cooks well!”

She lives with her two daughters (seventeen and ten), but she spends most of her day in the kitchen, working. She plans to buy an electric fan and a small stand where she can display what she wants to sell that day (now she can only bring it out as it is called for). Food generally consists of rice and beans with some other protein providing food, such as chicken, fish, and (rarely) red meat.

loans.use: Food exhibitor stand and cooking utensils, plus an electric fan for her diner.

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is forty-five years old, married, and has five children. Because her husband is unemployed, she is the main bread winner for her family. She owns a stall in the market town of Makeni. Her previous loan enabled her to buy more stock and attract more customers.  She is requesting a loan of $275 so she can continue to expand her business. Fatmata is determined to provide quality education for her children and to become a role-motel in the community.

loans.use: To increase her stock for her general store business

loans.name: Aflatun

texts.ru:
Mr Aflatun lives in the viscinity of the city of Saatli in Azerbaitsjan. He is married and has three children. His family is a low income family. His only source of income is a small herd of sheep and calves. Each year in August his wife (see photo) and him purchase lambs and calves with the money that they have been able to save over the year. They raise them on their property and then sell them to butchers on the local market. They use the money they obtain to provide for the family. However, the children are growing and so are their needs. Aflatun is planing to increase his income by increasing the amount of cattle he has in his herd. In order to do this he came to Normico, a Kiva partner, hoping to borrow $500.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Мр.Афлатун живет в пригороде Саатлы Республики Азербайджан расположенном в Южном Кавказе. Он женат, имеет троих детей. Семья у него малообеспсченная. Единственный источник дохода это небельшое стадо овец и телят в приусадебном хозяйстве. Ежегодно в августе он и его жена (см. фото) покупают на накопленные деньги ягнят и телят, выращивают их и продают на местном базаре мясникам. На вырученные деньги они обеспечивают семью минимумон потребностей. Но дети растут так же как и их потребности и Афлатун подумывает о увеличении своего дохода путём увеличения численности поголовья скота в своём стаде. С этой целью он обратился к местому отделению Нормикро - партнёру КИВА - с просьбой о предоставлении ему кредита в 500 долларов.

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta is a lady of 51 years. She is married with five children. She has applied for a loan to buy food and ingredients needed for making and running her business. She sells food at the nearby school every day. She also sells at companies near her house on weekends. She makes $140 WST ($56 USD) per day, and even more on weekends. She said she is very happy with her business because the money she earns helps to meet her family's needs. She hopes to stay in the program for a long time.

loans.use: To buy food and supplies for her fast food stall

loans.name: Aparicia

texts.en:
Aparicia Ramírez is more than fifty years old and is a single mother of two girls in elementary school. In order to achieve financial independence and to provide for young girls, she has had to work for years as a seamstress with a relative.

Thanks to her great management of profits made from mending clothing, Aparicia was able to set up her own convenience store where she sells various goods. Along with her work at the store, she also continues to mend and sew clothes to keep the store supplied, and make a greater income and support her family. She wants to insure her girls never go hungry.

Aparicia is asking for a loan so she may supply her convenience store with sugar, rice, cheese, corn, cookies, along with keeping the materials and supplies stocked in her seamstress shop.

loans.use: To  buy sugar, noodles, cheese, rice, corn and cookies for her convenience store.

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en: N. Munavvar was born in 1964 in the B.Gafurov region and has been a client of  MicroInvest since 2005. She is engaged in  commercial services and trading.  More specifically, she sells  different kinds of shoes that her son brings from China. She has a good assortment of shoes which she trades at prices that are lower than the bazaar prices.  Mrs. N. requests a loan of 2500 TJS ($725) for opening a new trade outlet.

loans.use: Opening a new trade outlet.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora is 53 years old, and she busies herself very ably in the small bodega that she opened long ago in her humble home. Demand for products is common; even more so now that she has become well know for the kindness with which she offers her services. She wants to increase the quality and quantity of her products to improve the quality of her business and for this reason she is seeking your help.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

TEODORA, tiene 53 años de edad y se desempeña muy hábilmente en la pequeña bodeguita que instaló hace mucho tiempo en su humilde domicilio, la demanda de productos es frecuente y aún más ahora que se ha hecho muy conocida por la amabilidad con el que brinda sus servicios. Desea incrementar la calidad y cantidad de sus productos para mejorar la calidad de su atención y con este propósito recorre en búsqueda de tu ayuda.

loans.use: To offer a greater quantity of products.

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en:
Adelaide is twenty-three years old and an single. She has been selling jewelry and different varieties of beads in Cape Coast for the past five years. Beads are precious ornaments (jewels) to women in Ghana, because they signify purity, beauty, and fertility and also to control weight. It is also believed to announce the presence of a woman to a man. Therefore, there is a high demand for such products.

Adelaide wants to expand her operation, so she wants to use her loan to buy more and varieties of beads and other metallic jewels for her customers.

She is a member of the group called "Our Helper." Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more hair ribbons, jewelry, and beads.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a divorced mother with two children. Her children are currently in school. She sells grocery products like toothbrushes, cocoa products, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, tinned milk, slippers, powdered milk, etc. Joyce wants a loan to buy more grocery products to increase inventory and also to avoid price hikes in the products. She is a member of the group called Achirensua I. The members of the group agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel is married and has 5 children, all grown and no longer dependent on him. He earned a living selling cheese and chorizo in the state of Tamaulipas for more than 20 years. Due to family problems, he moved to the city of Monterrey to live with his son and since he knows how to make cheese and chorizo, he started a business selling them in the city. Thanks to the business, he's been able to earn enough money to support himself.

Manuel is applying for a US$700 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, so that he can buy merchandise and go on selling his products. With your help, Manuel will continue to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Manuel es casado y tine 5 hijos quienes son mayores y ya no dependen economicamente de el. Se dedica en la venta de queso y chorizo desde hace mas de 20 años, en el estado de Tamaulipas pero debido a que tuvo problemas familiares, se vino a la ciudad de Monterrey a casa de su hijo a vivir y como sabe hacer queso y chorizo inicio el negocio en la ciudad hace algunos años, y gracias a esto ha podido obtener ingresos que le permiten solventar sus gastos.

El solicita un prestamo por US $700 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y asi poder seguir vendiendo los productos. Con tu apoyo Manuel seguira adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana has recently begun to sell fruit and candy. She considers herself to be an active and above all, capable woman, who at 25 is a single mother to an adorable little girl - the reason she puts so much effort into her work. Roxana sells from outside her own home so she can be near her little one. She would love to be able to pay for all of her daughter's education, including her University education and this is what she works so hard for every day.

The space from which she sells her products is very small, so she is asking for a loan to increase its size in order to improve it for herself, her products and her customers. Roxana awaits your help.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Roxana se dedica a la venta de fruta y golosinas desde hace poco tiempo, ella se considera una mujer activa y sobre todo capaz, a sus 25 años es madre soltera y tiene una preciosa niña, por quien dedica su esfuerzo en esta actividad. Roxana vende en las afueras de su domicilio para estar cerca de su pequeña, a ella le gustaría brindarle todos los estudios, inclusive los universitarios por ello se esfuerza cada día en su negocio. El espacio donde ella vende sus productos es muy reducido, por ello solicita un préstamo para ampliarlo, mejorar los espacios tanto para ella y sus productos, como para sus clientes. La señora Roxana espera de tu ayuda.

loans.use: To expand and improve the space from which she sells fruit and candy

loans.name: Elishiwaria's Rehema Group

texts.en:
Elishiwaria is 23 years old. She is a married with 2 children, aged 4 and 7. She has been selling clothes and rearing chickens since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Elishiwaria now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and chickens for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Rogathe, who has business in brick sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and chickens for her business.

loans.name: Claire

texts.fr: Claire B. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est revendeuse ambulante de pagnes à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise.  Il souhaite par ce crédit s’approvisionner en pagnes afin de répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et aussi louer une pièce afin de pouvoir exposer ses marchandises. Cette opportunité lui permettra de mieux gagner sa vie
texts.en:
Claire B. is 38 years old, married and the mother of two (2) children. She sells "pagne" (decorative cloth) door-to-door in Kplime, a town located about 120 kilometers from Lome, the Togolese capital. With this loan she plans to purchase sufficient pagne to meet the needs of her customers and to rent a stall to exhibit her merchandise. This opportunity would allow her to improve her income.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of "pagne" (decorative cloth) and fabrics for resale

loans.name: Mawussé

texts.fr:
Mawussé E. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle tient une boutique d’alimentation générale  à Lomé, la capitale togolaise.
Avec ce second crédit, elle souhaite faire davantage d’approvisionnement de ses stocks de marchandises et autres comme les boissons, les sandalettes, les boites de conserves et autres produits en vue d’augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Mawussé E., age 39, is married and the mother of 3 children. She runs a grocery store in Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this second loan, she wishes to bolster her stock of various products, such as drinks, sandals, canned food and other products to strengthen her business. Her profits will enable her to better provide for her family needs.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to bolster her stock

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
This group has three members. Mrs. Ny H. is 37 years old and works as a local farmer, raising vegetables behind her house. She sells the produce herself, usually three months after planting. Ny is married to Mr. Bo Phen, who is 37 years old and makes a living carving wood. He sells his work to a retailer. They have one child, who is a student. Ny need a loan of $150 to buy seeds.

Ny leads a group with two other members. Mrs. Botheng S. is 38 years old and makes a living growing vegetables. She is seeking a $100 loan to buy seeds. And Mrs. Chat S. is 24 years old and works as a farmer. She has applied for a loan to buy rice seeds.

All three women live in Somroang Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Chandara

texts.en:
Chandara L., is 27, single and lives with his widow mother, brother, and cousin. The family lives in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh City.
Chandara has been an invitation letter publisher (wedding, ceremony, etc.) for two years. He bought publishing materials from Toul Tumpong market so he could work at home. He hopes in the future he will be able to build his own printing shop .
Chandara is requesting a loan of 500 to purchase a motorbike for his family.

loans.use: To purchase one motorbike for using in the family.

loans.name: Mrs. Vy Yab Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of ten people is located in Phum Da Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Vy Y. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a fisherwoman. In her business, she now faces a small problE. because she does not have enough fishing tools, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy nets and fishing lines to catch fish. She hopes she can gather more fish to support her family. Mrs. Vy Y. is a 48-year-old widow with 10 children, five of whom are working in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school and also help their mother when they have free time.

Mrs. Vy Y. will share this loan with the other group members, who will use their portion for a variety of purposes.

All the members in this village bank are seeking end-of-term (EoT) loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fishnets and fish lines to catch fish.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou K. est âgée de 36ans, mariée et père de deux enfants. elle est une commerçante dynamique et tient une boutique de prêt à porter dans un quartier commercial de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Madame est une cliente fidèle de FECECAV et désire par ce deuxième crédit consolider son  fond de roulement permettant d’acheter de nouvel arrivage. Avec cette chance de Kiva, elle pourrait désormais faire face à  clientèle exigeante en tissus de marque, gagner plus d’argent et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Kokou K. is 36 years old, married, and the mother of two. She is an energetic merchant with a ready-to-wear clothing shop in a commercial district of Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is a loyal client of FECECAV and would like to use this second loan to consolidate her working capital, allowing for the purchase of newly arrived goods. With this Kiva opportunity, she would then be able to address customer demands for name-brand fabrics, earn more money, and help improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her ready-to-wear clothing shop

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is 45 years old and married with four children. He has a provision shop where he sells foodstuffs, drinks and kerosene. He is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 naira to purchase more provisions to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions for his grocery store.

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
Houssein is a 48-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Houssein owns a bakery. He does “saj,” “mankoucheh,” and “knefeh." The “saj” is the metal oven where you do the saj bread and the saj bread is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome used to make Markouk (thinned) bread and doughy confections or mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza with the most common toppings being zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Knefeh is a traditional breakfast Lebanese sweet; it is a special kind of braided cheese that is served with liquid sugar in rounded bread. It is also served as a dessert, but somehow it tastes better in the morning also. In America and in Europe, knefeh is known as a gourmet dish that will surpass in popularity the cheesecake and the pancake. Houssein requested a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a refrigerator for his sweets and the sodas and to purchase additional raw materials. This is the first time that Houssein has requested a loan.

Houssein is known for his good mankoucheh and his knefeh. His clients can be anybody from his region. Houssein worked in a restaurant before he opened his bakery, but he left the restaurant because he wasn’t earning enough and needed to increase his income. That is why he decided to start his own business. In the future, he plans on expanding and improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and additional raw materials.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace G. is 40 years old and is married to a soldier. She has four children that go to school. Grace currently sells food at a hotel and is requesting a loan to buy more plates, cups, tables, chairs, etc. to use there. She hopes to be able to build a big hotel and lodge with the extra profits she earns from taking this loan.

Kiva partner BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan in 2007. The microfinance program, which is targeted to returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non government organizations) as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

loans.use: buy more plates,cups,tables,chairs etc for the hotel

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Duyên Lê (1704060083) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has three school-aged children. To making a living, Duyên operates a family member's business in the manufacturing sector. The main source of income for this business comes from manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. Duyên has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3500000 dong a month from these activities.

In 2006, Duyên joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Duyên has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Duyên is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 dong which will again be used to purchase livestock. This loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Duyên plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 47 years old and married with five children. She sells lubricants, and she is requesting the loan amount of N150, 000 to purchase more lubricant to sell. Joy is an active LAPO client. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more lubricant to sell

loans.name: Anne-Marie

texts.fr:
D.  Anne-Marie est née le 26/07/1967 à Ouidah, une des villes historiques et touristique du BENIN. Anne-Marie est mariée à ANGO Justin employé à la Société Béninoise de la Brasserie. Anne-Marie et Justin ont cinq (5) enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Anne-Marie et sa famille vit au quartier Enagnon, un quartier peuplé de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Depuis plus de dix (10)ans, Anne-Marie vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.), des liqueurs et des produits vivriers (haricot, riz, mil, maïs et les farines de manioc et de causette d’igame). C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Anne-Marie s’approvisionne en ses différents articles. Anne-Marie a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et augmenter le volume de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Anne-Marie sollicite de ALIDé un cinquième prêt. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
D. Anne-Marie was born on July 26, 1967 in Ouidah, one of the historic and tourist cities of Benin. She is married to ANGO Justin, an employee at the Société Béninoise de la Brasserie. Anne-Marie and Justin have five children, all in school. She and her family live in Enagnon, a populated district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For over ten years, Anne-Marie has been selling various goods: candy, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soap (for the laundry, dishes, and bath), liquors, and staple foods (beans, rice, millet, corn, cassava flour, and yam chips). There, in Dantokpa, the grand international market of Benin, she stocks up on these different items. Anne-Marie has already been the recipient of four loans with Alidé for developing her business. To bolster her working capital and to increase her business volume, so as to do better in satisfying her customers, she’s requesting a fifth loan from Alidé. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 boxes of canned milk, a box of powdered milk, a box of sugar (chucks and powdered), 3 boxes of soap for the laundry and the bath, 2 boxes of canned tomatoes, a half-box of sardines, a dozen hair straighteners, a dozen shampoos, 2 sacks of rice, 50 kg of beans, five 50-kg sacks of corn, a 50-kg sack of cassava flour, and 2 boxes of liquor.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca manages a simple store in their village. She displays her products just in front of their house since she does not have a permanent store yet. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 11,000 for her business to enable it to grow and become stable someday.

Francisca is 55 years old and is already a widow. She has five children and is thankful that they support her in times of crisis. Her youngest is still studying while her second youngest works as a housemaid. Some of them are already married.

Francsica hopes that Kiva will allow her to increase her income so that she may give her two youngest children a better living. They are humbly living in the peaceful Barangay of Tandul, somewhere in Cabatuan, Isabela. She is thankful that her store has worked well so far because it is very important to her and her family. She promises to work hard to expand her business and become a productive ASKI-Kiva client for her family.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Kihara Mothers 2 Rachael Namahe Group

texts.en:
Rachael N. is 28 years old, married with one boy child who is in school and she is looking after two dependents. She has operated a business dealing in smoked fish and baking madasi for one year so far.

She is using the loan to purchase smoked fish and wheat flour, cooking oil, and baking powder for making madasi. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to educate her child and develop herself.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish and wheat flour, cooking oil, & baking powder for making madasi.

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
La señora Yola, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Pomata, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 57 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, es madre D. 02 hijos y tiene estudios primaria completa, vive en el Jr. Odria s/n.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 6 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra D. harina para elaboración D. pan. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. harina e insumos para preparación D. pan, negocio que actualmente maneja.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando, para mejorar en su vida junto con su familia.

A ella le gustan las charlas y los encuentros.
texts.en:
Yola belongs to the "Medalla Milagrosa" Communal Bank, which is located in the Pomata district in the province of Chucuito in the Puna area. She is 57 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. She has completed her primary school studies and lives on Jr. Odria Street. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 6 years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to buy flour to make bread. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy flour and supplies for bread making, a business which she currently manages. Her wish is to continue working in order to make a better life for her family. She likes the bank's chats and meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour for making bread.

loans.name: Las Semillitas Group

texts.es:
La señora Edelmira Núñez, natural D. Chosica Lima – Perú, tiene 40 años D. edad conviviente, con  4 hijos. 
Trabaja con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 2 años, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D.  la alcancía comunal “Las Semillitas”, el cual  esta conformado por  11 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades como: venta y alquiler D. vestidos y ropas, venta D. comida y otros.
Inicialmente se dedicaba a la preparación y venta D. tamales, tortas  y lonches, según pedidos, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles.
Actualmente tiene su restaurante “EL PIQUEOS” desD. hace un año, con el  préstamo D. S/.1200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara los insumos necesarios para abastecer tanto para la comida, postres y tamales, mediante los cuales le ayuda incrementar sus ganancias y mejorar la calidad D. vida educativa D. sus hijos.
En el futuro anhela formar una pequeña empresa D. tamales y que sus hijos sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edelmira, from Chosica, Lima, Peru, is 40 years old and lives with her partner and 4 children. She has already been working with EDAPROSPO for 2 years and now assumes the position of president of the small community bank “Las Semillitas”, which is maD. up of 11 members who have various businesses such as: selling and hiring out clothing, selling food, and other things. Originally she maD. and sold tamales (steamed corn-dough wrapped in banana leaves), tortas and snacks, maD. to order. Her initial loan was for 500 Peruvian soles. Now she has had a restaurant “El Piqueos” for a year. With the loan of 1,200 soles she will buy the necessary supplies to prepare the food, deserts and tamales, which help her to increase her income and improve her children’s quality of life and education. In the future she would like to start a small tamales business and for her children to have good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the necessary supplies to prepare food, deserts and tamales

loans.name: Sara Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Sara del Socorro reside en el barrio 380 de la capita de Managua, tiene 35 años de edad, casada  y con una bella familia de dos hijos, una niña de 10 años y un varón de 5 años,  los cuales estudian su primaria, su esposo trabaja como conductor a una empresa privada. La señora Sara es ama de casa y vive cerca con su mama lo cual comparten la felicidad y los problemas en el núcleo familiar, ella recibe remesa de su hermana mayor  que emigro a España para contar con mejores ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia, lo cual su meta se hecho una realidad, ya que han mejorado en gran medida, sus condiciones económica y remodelación de la casa. En Afodenic lleva el tercer ciclo  el cual este realizara la terminación de un cuarto de la casa  para tener mejores condiciones de vida y comodidad en el haga. Su meta es poder encontrar un trabajo y poder asegurarles una economía mejor a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Doña Sara del Socorro, aged 35, is married and the mother of two beautiful children, a girl aged 10 and a boy aged 5, who both attend primary school. She lives in the neighborhood 380 of the capital city of Managua. Her husband is a driver in a private company. Sara is a housewife and lives with her mother who shares the happiness and the problems in this small family. Sara's older sister emigrated to Spain for better income and periodically sends money to Sara to help her to improve the living conditions of her family. This goal has become a reality, as they have greatly improved their economic condition and renovated their house.

This is Sara's third loan with Afodenic. She will use it to finish the construction of a room in their house to have better living conditions and more comfort in their home. Her goal is to find a job and be able to provide her two children with a better economic future.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to finish a room

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en: Susitina M. (0) is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Lalovaea. She is married and has eight adult children. Susitina owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling soft drinks in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 150 WST a month. In 2009, Susitina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Kenadi

texts.en:
Kenadi J. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and is requesting a loan to purchase more groundnuts for making paste to sell. 

 Kenadi is 36 years old and is married to a soldier. She has two children and her children go to school. 

 With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house that she will rent out.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more groundnuts

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 50 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Jamal has been doing handicrafts for twenty years. Jamal is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase accessories for his work and pay his children’s school tuition. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time. 
Jamal is special in his work because of his creativity and he knows how to understand his clients demands. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience, as well as he wanted to have independent work, but most importantly, because he likes what he does. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase accessories for his work and pay his children’s school tuition.

loans.name: Mary Jepkosgei

texts.en: Mary is married and blessed with seven children. Her cafe is located at Tembeleo in Eldoret. She was introduced to KADET by an existing borrower. With her loan, Mary is planning to purchase baking flour and cooking oil for her cafe. Her future dream is to buy a dairy cow to provide milk for sale in order to better support her family. About KADET The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes G. sells goods in her general store, which is located at her house at the village of Santiago, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She is 52 years old and married to her loving husband, Erwin, who is 38 years old. The couple is blessed with two children named Edna and April Joy, both of whom are studying in school. Edna is a third year high school student, while April Joy is presently a Grade IV student.

For two years, the main source of income for Lourdes is through her store, thus she really values it. She wants to continuously manage her store and she is requesting a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders as her additional working capital. She wants to purchase additional commodities for her store, such as canned goods and soft drinks. She really aims to increase her income, especially to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for resale

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth sells cooking oil and food spices at retail prices to her customers. She is 38 years old and married with three children. She is a friendly and hardworking woman. Her friendliness attracts customers to her shop. Janeth is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more food spices and cooking oil to sell. She hopes to sell her goods at wholesale prices to her customers in the future. 
Janeth says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil and food spices to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn sells clothes, hats, shoes and bags at retail prices to make a living in Lagos state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria. Evelyn is 44 years old and has a child. She is a friendly woman and she is determined to excel in her business. She hopes for the loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more clothes, shoes, hats and bags to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, shoes, hats and bags to sell

loans.name: Celina

texts.en: Celina sells groceries at retail prices to her customers.She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is 50 years old, married, with 6 children. Her husband is a teacher and he also supports the home.She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is requesting a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more groceries to sell.  She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes M. is from the village of Lobong, San Jacinto, Pangasinan. She is 50 years old. Lourdes is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lourdes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lourdes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosmery Guadalupe

texts.es: Rosmery Guadalupe T. 26  años de edad, reside en Sensuntepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cabañas. Vive junto a su madre, la cual posee una venta de pupusas. Rosmery cuenta con una venta de productos varios como: maquillaje, crema para cuerpo y cabello, shampoo, accesorios, carteras y muchos otros productos más. Ella posee su negocio en el mercado Municipal de Sensuntepeque obteniendo muy buenas ganancias, las cuales son utilizadas para el mantenimiento de su hogar, es por esta razón que Rosmery trabaja desde muy joven para poder brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su madre, ya que es ella quien luchó por muchos años por darle una vida digna a Rosmery. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar medicina natural y de esta manera poder extender su negocio, así mismo comprar mayor cantidad de productos de los que ya posee, y los cuales es consciente que se venden mucho en el lugar tales como los cosméticos. A Rosmery le llena de mucha ilusión el imaginarse un negocio muy surtido en el cual pueda obtener mayores ganancias, es por esto que solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
Rosmery Guadalupe T. is 26 and she lives in Sensuntepeque, which is in the Cabañas department. She lives with her mother, who sells pupusas. Rosmery sells different products such as makeup, body and hair lotion, shampoo, accessories, bags and many more products. She runs her business at the Sensuntepeque Municipal market and is making a very good profit which is used for household expenses. This is the reason Rosmery has worked since she was very young - to be able to provide her mother with the help she needs, since she has fought for many years to give Rosemery a decent life. She is asking for a loan so that she can buy natural medicine and so expand her business, as well as buying greater quantities of the products that she already has, such as cosmetics, which she is confident will sell well . Rosemery is full of hope imagining a well stocked business in which she can earn greater profits and this is why she is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of natural medicine and cosmetics.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en: Haytham is a 22-year-old single man. He started working when he was very young. He has been repairing computers and maintaining electronic equipment to help improve his living conditions as well as business abilities and activities. He has been involved in this occupation since 2004. With the income from his business, he is able to support his father. Today, Haytham is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy new tools to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy new tools

loans.name: Yawa Felicité

texts.en: Yawa Felicité O. is 35 years old, single, and does not have any children. She works in the Grand Marché de Hédranawoé in Lomé, Togo, selling a variety of grocery products. The busy and popular location of her business allows her to serve many customers in any given day. Ms. O. began her business in 2002 and is now requesting her first loan from Kiva partner, WAGES, to resupply her stock of groceries. With your help, Ms. O. will be able to keep her shelves full and her customers satisfied.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products for resale

loans.name: Dorca Elena

texts.es: En el municipio de san Pedro del norte, la señora Dorca Elena G., se dedica a la producción de granos básicos y ganado bobino así como también a actividades comerciales como la venta de comida y bebidas las que desarrolla en una jornada laboral de 10 horas las que realiza con su hermana y mama quienes le colaboran con el negocio, la señora Dorca Elena G. provee de alimentos y lo necesario a sus dos hijos de 4 y 5 años cada uno y su esposo quien le envía remesas de un país vecino provee lo necesario para el pago cumplido de sus cuotas, por tal razón ella solicito este crédito para realizar la compra de materiales de construcción dentro de los que se incluyen bloques, hierro, alambre de amarre, zinc etc entre otros con los que pretende terminar de construir su casa, con la que espera mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ofrecerles un techo a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
In San Pedro del Norte, Sra. Dorca Elena G. makes a living farming and raising cattle. She also earns extra money selling food and drinks, a business that she developed, working 10 hours a day, with her sister and mother. Dorca Elena supports her two children, 4 and 5 years old. Her husband, who works as a driver in a neighboring country, pays the installments [on a property of some kind?]. She is applying for a loan so that she can buy construction materials--cement blocks, iron bar, wire ties, roofing, etc.--so that she can finish building her house. She hopes the house will improve her living conditions and provide her young children with a roof over their heads.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for house construction.

loans.name: Flavia Harriet

texts.en: Miss Flavia Harriet N. is an encouraging business woman, thirty-five years old. She operates a bar business which she has stayed with for over four years. She wants the loan to purchase wines, beer, soda, water and so forth for her bar business to meet her customers' demands. Her dream is to build rental houses to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase wines, beer, soda, water, and so forth for her bar business to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Maria Lizeth

texts.es:
la señora Mirla Lizeth B. R. tiene 25 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Martir Romero quien labora en la empacadora de mariscos San Lorenzo. Tienen un hijo. Martir le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y Mirla atiende el pequeño negocio que tiene en su casa en donde vende maiz, arroz, azucar, manteca, aceite etc.

utilizara el credito para comprar mas productos y asi tener mas inventario en su negocio, ya que estos productos se venden rapido.
dice sentirse feliz porque esta viendo que su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco y su meta es poder tener una pulperia grande en donde venda de todo tipo de productos.
texts.en:
Mirla Lizeth B. R. is 25 years old and lives with her partner Martir Romero, who works in the San Lorenzo fish packing plant. They have one child. Martir helps with household expenses and Mirla runs the small business they have in their house, selling rice, sugar, lard, oil, etc. Mirla will use this loan to buy more products to sell. She needs more inventory as these products sell rapidly. Mirla says she feels happy to see her business grow little by little. Her goal is to have a large grocery store selling all types of products.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oil, lard, rice, sugar, and corn for grocery.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn D.  a 50-year-old farmer from Banga South Cotabato, has four children, her eldest 22 years old. Merlyn has a farm which she hopes can provide for the daily needs of her family. Because she wants to make her livelihood more profitable in order to improve the family's economic situation, she is applying for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 56 years old and is the married father of six children aged 14 to 31 years. Two of the children are still attending school.

Paul is a farmer from Eastern Kenya in Nkubu town. He has been farming for twenty-three years and has been able to employ six casual workers. His main produce is fine beans which he sells to Homegrown Horticulture Company in Kenya. He also earns income from mining, where he sells ballast (gravel) to the local market. His biggest challenge in farming is lack of a market for his produce and pests and diseases that attack his dairy animals.

Paul successfully cleared his first loan of KES 46,800 from Juhudi Kilimo which he used to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He has requested this new loan of KES 57,200 to purchase and insure another dairy cow. The income from this loan will improve the living standard of his family and educate his children, too.

In future, Paul intends to expand his farming activities by planting bananas.

Paul says loans from Juhudi Kilimo are unique; he has not seen any other micro-finance institutions offering loans for farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Bujuuta B Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
B. Gorreti is a cheerful 44-year-old married mother of four lively school children. She runs a five-year-old salon business in Bujuuta, Lugazi. She offers hairdressing services and also sells cosmetics to her ever-increasing clientele.

Gorreti left her farming business to start up her current business. With monthly profits of 300,000 shillings, she casts her mind to the future with optimism. Her sense of determination is an attribute she says is invaluable in this kind of business.

With this loan, Gorreti wants to buy more cosmetics and also hairdryers for improved services.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and hairdryers for her salon

loans.name: Gloregen

texts.en:
Gloregen A. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 27 years old. Gloregen is married and has 3 school-aged children. She is involved in farming. She earns a living through planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also manages a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells basic food and daily use products. Gloregen hopes for her ventures to prosper.

Gloregen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloregen has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gloregen is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. This will be the second loan taken out by Gloregen from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Luz Del Carmen

texts.es:
Luz es una madre de familia de 22 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo de dos años de edad en el distrito agrícola de Chepén, una zona de regular movimiento comercial ubicada en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar vendiendo desayunos en un puesto ambulante situado en una avenida bastante frecuentada de la ciudad en donde vive. Por la zona transitan bastantes personas, ya que en esa área se encuentran ubicados bastantes locales que pertenecen a empresas de transporte que unen a Chepén con sus diversos distritos y también con otras ciudades del país, además por el lugar donde trabaja se encuentra ubicado el hospital de la ciudad.

Sus clientes habituales son los transportistas y las personas que hacen uso de los medios de transporte. La continua demanda por los productos que ofrece ha hecho que ella piense en ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas insumos que le permitan preparar mas alimentos con los cuales pueda incrementar su stock y sus ventas. Para lograr su meta ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Luz es una mujer emprendedora y que siempre entrega lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su negocio y ayudar a su esposo, que también es comerciante, en el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares. Sus familiares y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
Luz is a 22 year old mother who lives with her husband and two year old son in the farming district of Chepén. This area experiences regular business activity and is located in Chepén Province in the region of La Libertad, which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. Luz sells breakfasts from a mobile food stand situated on a busy avenue in the city where she lives. Plenty of people pass through this area since Chepén has several local transportation companies that provide service to various districts and to other cities throughout the country. In addition, the place where she works is located near the city hospital. Her regular customers are drivers and people who use public transportation. The continuous demand for the products she offers has made Luz think about expanding her business. She plans to buy more supplies which will allow her to prepare more meals, increase her inventory, and generate more sales. To accomplish this goal, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN. Luz is an enterprising woman who always tries her best to succeed in her business and help her husband, who is also a merchant, with providing for the family expenses. Her relatives and acquaintances consider her to be a peaceful and reliable woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her mobile food stand

loans.name: Jorge Remigio

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padre y hermanos en el caserío Las Delicias, un centro poblado del área rural del distrito de Oyotún, un distrito agrícola situado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace mas de diez años, el cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar arroz, la zona de Oyotún cuenta con terrenos bastante propicios para sembrar este producto debido a la abundancia de recurso hídrico en la zona. Al igual que la mayoría de agricultores de la zona,  Jorge se dedica a sembrar este producto dos veces por año y depende de esta actividad para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Jorge ha instalado una hectárea de arroz y desea valerse de este cultivo para sacar adelante a su familia, el está trabajando arduamente todos los dias para poder conseguir este propósito, actualmente desea aplicar a su cultivo diversos abonos para garantizarse una buena prducción, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Jorge es una persona bastante trabajdora y que gusta mucho de la labor que realiza, su mayor anhelo es seguir adelante y poder obtener siempre buenas cosechas que garanticen el bienestar de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 45 years old, single, and lives with his father and siblings in the village of Las Delicias, a rural area in the central part of the district of Oyotún, which is two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Jorge has been farming for more than ten years. He has enough farmland in the Oyotún area that is sufficient for producing rice because of the abundance of water in the area. Like most farmers in the area, Jorge grows rice twice a year and depends on this activity for meeting his family expenses.

Jorge has a hectare of land for growing rice and wants to continue producing this crop so that his family can get ahead. He works hard every day so that he can continue in this manner. Jorge wants to apply different types of fertilizer in order to guarantee a good production. To achieve this goal, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Jorge is a hardworking person who enjoys what he does for a living. His greatest wish is to move forward and be able to achieve good harvests so that he can guarantee the welfare of his loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for his rice crop

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita S. is from the village of Cabisera 25, Ilagan. She is 62 years old. Carmelita is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Carmelita raises livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and resale. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Carmelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Mirian Marcelina

texts.es:
La señora Mirian Sánchez se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa interior nueva para damas y niños, su negocio esta ubicado en la Terminal de buses costado norte de la empresa Contreras.
La señora Sánchez cuenta con cinco años de experiencia en su negocio.
 
Su negocio es semi ambulante ya que los días: lunes, viernes y sábados, se ubica en la Terminal de transporte y los días martes, miércoles y domingos lo hace de manera ambulante.
La Sra. Mirian es casada y madre de tres hijos los cuales dependen a un 100% del matrimonio su esposo es Pastor de una iglesia Evangélica.
Mirian tomo la decisión de dedicarse al negocio ya que la situación económica para ellos no era muy favorable y ahora con los ingresos que le genera su negocio colabora con su esposo a cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa interior.
texts.en:
Mirian Sánchez is a merchant; her main activity is the sale of women’s and children’s underwear. Her stand is in the bus terminal on the north side of the Contreras firm. She has five years experience. Her business is semi-itinerant because on Mondays, Fridays and Saturdays she sets herself up in the bus terminal but on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Sundays she’s an itinerant vendor. Mirian is married and has three children who depend on her 100%. Her husband is pastor in an Evangelical church. Mirian decided to go into business because their economic situation wasn’t very favorable and now the income her business produces helps her husband meet certain household expenses. The loan will be used to buy underwear.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's and girls' undewear.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
This is Anita T., 39, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Frederick, and is the mother of two children, both of whom are in high school. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send both her children all the way through college.
