This is the dream of most Filipino parents like Anita, who herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.
Anita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Anita earns an income by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling at piece rate. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 19,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Anita dreams of having new businesses in the future. She also prays for good health for her and her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To expand her product inventory by purchasing groceries, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Safarmurod

texts.ru: Мавлонов Сафармурод проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Сыновья в Росси на заработках. Сам Сафармурод имеет среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Safarmurod M. lives in the Yavan region. He is 51 years old. He is married and has six children. His sons are now working in Russia. He has secondary education and has been doing animal husbandry for more than ten years. He mainly breeds for future resale. He is taking out the loan to buy large cattle to increase their count.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of large cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of foodstuffs in the restaurant

loans.name: Filiberto

texts.es:
el señor Filiberto E. tiene 54 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de granos basicos como ser maiz, maisillo y frijoles.
Filiberto es una persona muy seria, honrada y muy trabajadora.
el adquiere su producto en su misma comunidad donde reside.
Filiberto lucha fuerte para sacar adelante a su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de granos basicos.
texts.en:
Filiberto E. is 54 years old. His work is selling staple foods such as corn, millet and beans. Filiberto is a very serious, honorable and hard-working person. He acquires his products in the same community where he lives. 

Filiberto is working very hard to help his family get ahead. He will use the loan to buy staple foods.

loans.use: Buying corn, millet and beans

loans.name: Mercedes Yanec

texts.es: Mercedes Yanec tiene 32 años, su actividad es la venta de productos varios. Hace más de 15 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy importante para ella mantenerlo, pues la mayoría de sus clientes siempre llegan a buscar los frijoles cosidos, productos lácteos, y tortillas, que son muy importantes pues son productos que diariamente las familias de escasos recursos solicitan. El motivo de este crédito es para la compra frijoles, leña y productos lácteos. Sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en: Mercedes Yanec is 32 years old.  She has a business selling various products.  She has had this business for more than 15 years.  It has been very important to her to maintain it since most of her clients are always looking for baked beans, dairy products and tortillas.  These are very important since they are products that families of limited means ask for every day.  This loan will be used to buy beans, firewood and dairy products.  Mercedes dreams of being able to finish building her house and expand her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gulzat Kushubakova's Group

texts.en: Gulzat K. is the leader of this group. She is 25 and married. Together with her husband they raise two sons, both of them of preschool age. Generally the family capital is being raised by Gulzat’s husband. In the past four years he has increased his budget by selling cattle. He decided to start running this business after following practical advice. Currently he is operating the business together with his brother in the local cattle market. Out of his profits he has managed to build a house. The family needs are growing as the children are growing. Considering this fact, the head of the family wants to increase profits and for this purpose Gulzat is requesting a loan for the family business. Their future plans include selling an old car in order to obtain a new one. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es: María Concepción M. D. A. D. 56 años D. edad, resiD. en San Marcos, en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella vive junto a dos hijos D. 19 y 17 años D. edad. María trabaja muy duro día con día en su propio taller D. costura, el cual se encuentra en su casa D. habitación y en donD. trabaja desD. hace 10 años, tiempo en el cual ha ido obteniendo gran experiencia y así mismo clientes fijos. María elabora cortinas, cubrecamas, manteles, entre otros artículos más. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para la compra D. telas, hilos, agujas y otra materia prima la cual fundamental para este trabajo, D. esta forma María espera mejorar su negocio y así mejorar la economía D. su hogar.
texts.en:
María Concepción M. D. A. is 56 years old and lives in San Marcos in the department of San Salvador.  She lives with her two children, who are 17 and 19 years old.  

María works very hard every day at her own sewing shop, which is located in her home.  She has worked there for the last 10 years, and she has gained a lot of experience and many repeat customers.  She makes curtains, bedspreads, tableclothes, and other items.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase fabric, thread, needles, and other essential items for her sewing work.  She hopes to improve her business and improve the finances of her family.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, needles and other sewing materials

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Mujeres De Valor Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora Fatima C. ella estubo en otro grupo anteriormente y decidio retirarse y formar su propio grupo, lo cual esta yendo muy bien, todas las integrantes son del barrio Ypati de la ciudad de Villa Elisa.
Todas las mujeres son muy trabajadoras y se esfuerzan para tener para su pago y no fallarle a la fundacion , todas ellas se dedican a la venta de toda clase de productos ,otras tienen su trabajo seguro con sus propios sueldos .
Las reuniones se realizan en el domicilio de la Señora Fatima C., una señora muy alegre, trabajadora, honesta y todas las del grupo tambien todas son mujeres que siguen adelante con sus emprendimientos con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación y están muy agradecidas a la fundacion por haberles dado esta oportunidad única y por hacer posible que ellas puedan mantener a sus respectivas familias y a sus propios negocios. 
La señora Fatima se dedica a la venta de bebidas y quiero contar con buena cantidad y variedad de bebidas para este fin de año.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como vinos, sidras, cervezas y otros.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to Mrs. Fatima C..  She was in another group before and decided to leave it and form her own group, which is doing very well.  All the members are from the Ypati neighborhood in the city of Villa Elisa.

All the women are very hardworking and make an effort to make their payments and not fail the Foundation.  They all sell all types of products, and some of them have secure jobs with their own salaries.

The meetings are held in Fatima C.'s house.  She is very happy, hardworking and honest, and all the ladies in the group are women who move forward with their plans with great effort and dedication.  They are very grateful to the Foundation for having given them this unique opportunity and for making it possible for the ladies to support their families and keep up their businesses.

Fatima sells drinks and wants to have a good amount and variety of drinks for the end of the year.  She is asking for the loan so she can buy merchandise like wine, cider, beer and other drinks.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise like wine, beer, soft drinks and other beverages

loans.name: Mrs. Nou Savet Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The 16 members of this village bank loan in Dak Por village in Takeo province have selected Mrs. Nou S. as village bank president. They will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standards of living.

Mrs. Nou S. weaves silk at her home in order to earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Phorll YoE., is a construction worker and farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support his family. Mrs. Nou S. has a problE. because her roof is broken, but she doesn't have enough money to rebuild it. To improve this situation, Mrs. Nou S. is seeking a loan to rebuild her roof. She is the mother of three children; oN. is a silk weaver while the others are public school students.

loans.use: to rebuild her roof

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
Don Juan, tiene 44 años de edad, administra una tienda, vive solo en la Ciudad de San Miguel, él es soltero, se dedica a atender una tienda que la tiene ubicada al frente de una escuela, lugar propicio para tener un buen número de clientes ya que todos estudiantes forman parte de los clientes frecuentes, él les ofrece galletas, jugos, dulces, entre otros que los niños buscan, también tiene productos para el hogar, su horario de atención es de 7:00am a 4:00pm.
Actualmente, en vista que está por iniciar  el año escolar el solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería y abastecer la tienda de aquellos productos que son demandados por los jóvenes estudiantes, esta inversión le ayudara a prepararse para atender de una mejor manera a los clientes y aprovechar cada venta para generar ganancias.
Su proyección es lograr crecer en el negocio y estabilizar sus ingresos para tener mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Don Juan, age 44, runs a store. He lives on his own in the city of San Miguel. He is single and manages a store that is located in front of a school, an ideal location for having many customers because students frequent the place. He sells them cookies, juice, candy and other products that they want. He also sells household products. His business hours are 7:00 am to 4:00 pm.

Currently, because the school year is about to start, he is requesting a loan so that he can purchase merchandise and restock his store with all those products that are in high demand with students. This investment will help him prepare to provide better customer service and make the most out of each sale to generate profits.

His plan is to expand his business and stabilize his income to improve his financial situation.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ketty Veronica

texts.es:
Ketty de 31 años, es una microempresaria que empezó su negocio con pocos productos. Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha surtido la tienda para alcanzar sus objetivos y aspiraciones. 

En la actualidad vende todo tipo de productos alimenticios como aceite, arroz, azúcar, aceite etc. Trabaja desde muy temprano para generar mejores ingresos y vende los productos de su tienda con precios muy accesibles para sus clientes como la libra de azúcar a $ 0.35. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con el negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo quintales de arroz, aceite ente otros víveres. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y que sus dos hijos tengan una buena vida económica.
texts.en:
31 year-old Ketty is a small businesswoman who started her business with few products.  Through her hard work and commitment, she has stocked her store in order to achieve her goals and aspirations.

She currently sells all kinds of food products such as oil, rice, sugar, etc.  She works from very early in the morning in order to make most income and she sells the products in her store at very affordable prices.  For example, a pound of sugar costs $0.35.  She has many aspirations for her business.  She would like to use this loan to buy 100lb bags of rice, oil and other food products.

In the future, she would like to finish building her home and for her two children to be financially comfortable.

loans.use: To buy rice and oil

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie F. is from the village of Disud. She is 44 years old. Rosemarie is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Rosemarie operates a business venture selling different products, such as clothes and other ready-to-wear products. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosemarie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosemarie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Fabiola Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Fabiola  es comerciante de ropa, ella vende poleras, tiene un hijo de 8 mese de edad, vive en la casa de su mamá quien le ayuda con el cuidado de su bebe, tiene cuatro hermanos  a quienes ayuda a mantener, su papá es albañil, ella es muy joven y emprendedora su negocio lo realiza viajando al desaguadero de donde trae la mercadería y la lleva a vender a Cochabamba ahora quiere llevar y traer mercadería también de Oruro para ello solicito el crédito para la compra de poleras por docena, su meta es hacer crecer su negocio  y enseñar a sus hermanas menores  esta labor  y hacer construir su casa en el terreno que tienen donde actualmente viven en dos cuartitos, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Fabiola is a clothes saleswoman - she sells shirts.  She has an 8 month old son, and lives with her mother who helps her to care for the baby.  She has four siblings, who she helps to take care of.  Her father is a mason.  She is very young and entrepreneurial.  She travels to Desaguadero to get her merchandise and takes them to Cochabamba to be sold.  She would also like to begin carrying and bringing merchandise from Oruro, and for this she has asked for a loan to buy shirts by the dozen.  Her goal is to grow her business and teach her younger sisters the work, and to build a house on the land where they currently live in two small rooms.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: To buy shirts by the dozen

loans.name: Mujeres Independientes Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Valientes  se formó con la unión D. las vecinas del barrio Santa Barbara D. Santaní.
Todas las integrantes se dedican a la confección D. ropas.
Este comité está empezando con su 1er ciclo con muchas ganas D. sobresalir adelante en grupo.
La señora Isabelina se dedica a la confección D. ropas, y como está en auge la época D. realizar nuevos uniformes para los colegios y alumnos, ella necesita D. más telas para poder realiza los trabajos que le piden, a fin D. dejar satisfechos a sus clientes y poder prosperar económicamente ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Valientes [Brave Women] Committee was formed when neighbors of the Santa Barbara D. Santaní got together. All of the members make clothing. This committee is beginning its first cycle and is very eager to get ahead as a group. 

Isabelina makes clothing, and since it is the busy season for making uniforms for schools and students, she needs more fabric to be able to do fill the orders she has. She wants to sastify her customers and be able to prosper financially with her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Rubén Freddy

texts.es: El señor Rubén se dedica a la construcción es albañil contratista el vive con su hermano en casa de sus padres  en la zona de Pucara grande, sus padres viven en la ciudad de Oruro el y su hermano ambos solteros se dedican a trabajar para costear sus estudios profesionales actualmente el señor Rubén estudia ingeniería civil indica que toma pocas materias por el escaso tiempo que tiene para dedicarse a esta actividad, es una persona muy responsable que tiene que dividir su tiempo entre estudiar y trabajar, su deseo es el de terminar un día su carrera universitaria y ejercer su profesión, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la  compra de herramientas que necesita para su trabajo, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Rubén works in construction as a building contractor. He lives with his brother in his parents' house in the Pucara Grande region of the city of Oruruo. Rubén and his brother are both single and are working to finance their educations. Rubén is currently studying civil engineering and is only taking a few classes right now due to having limited free time because of his job. He is a very responsible person who must divide his time between studying and working. He wants to finish his studies one day so he can practice his profession. The loan will be used to buy tools he needs for work. He is grateful to the lending institution for its support.

loans.use: to purchase tools

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses M., age 27 and unmarried, has worked as a farmer for the past four years. His monthly income is KES 9,000, with which he supports his parents. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET staff member and is now applying for  his first loan with the organization. He plans to use his loan to buy essential farm inputs. 

With the profits generated he plans to expand his farming efforts and to expand into a livestock-keeping business.

He dreams eventually to be rich. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite his limited resources.

loans.use: to buy essential farm inputs

loans.name: Nitzia

texts.es:
La señora Nitzia A. tiene la edad de 27 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria y esta casada, ella tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos estudian la primaria, en vive en una comunidad llamada el Jicaro a treinta minutos de Tierra Blanca en el estado de veracruz.

Doña Nitzia nos platica que ella desde muy chica se fue a trabajar a estados unidos en donde conocio a su esposo se caso y tuvo a sus hijos pero hace un par de años sintio el deseo de volver a su pueblo a vivir cerca de su familia, ella nos dice que desde que regreso a tenido que trabajar muy duro junto a su marido para sacar a sus hijos adelante ya que la situacion economica en nuestro pais cada dia es mas mala.

ella inicio a trabajar en su propio negocio  de cria de cerdos hace un poco mas de dos años, ella nos platica que su negocio consiste en tener cerdos para que tengan chochinitos y cuando ya tienen tres meses de nacidos los vende y vuelve a engordar a sus cochinas para que crien mas. 

ella nos dice que quiere agrandar su corral para meter mas cerdos y criar mas cerditos, ella piensa que este credito lo invertira en la compra de alimentos y materiales de construcion(block, barillas, cemento, cal y arena).

Doña NItzia desea que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que desea en un futuro darles una profesion a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vidad.
texts.en:
Nitzia A. is 27 years old and has a high school education.  She’s married and has three children who attend elementary school.  They live in a community called Jicaro, 30 minutes from Tierra Blanca, Veracruz.

Nitzia tells us that she went to work in the United States when she was a very young.  This is where she met her husband.  They married and had children, but years later she wanted to return home to live close to her family.  She says that she and her husband have had to work very hard since returning, in order to get ahead with their children, because the economic situation in [her] country gets worse every day.

She began working at her own business, raising hogs, a little over two years ago.  She has pigs that have piglets and she sells them when they’re three months old.  She continues to raise her pigs so that they’ll continue having piglets.

She wants to expand her pen to be able to add more pig and will invest the money from this loan in feed and building materials (cinder blocks, fencing, cement, salt, and sand).

Nitzia wants to prosper with this investment in her business.  She wants to give her children a better quality of life and the opportunity to attain professional careers.

loans.use: to buy feed and building materials

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 26 años; vive en concubinato con Erminio. Ambos tienen 2 hijos, Braham y Verenise; a los que cuidan y alimentan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Su actividad económica es la agricultura, tiene 7 años de experiencia en la siembra de arvejas, habas, papa y maíz; los cuales se sitúan en el caserío de San Antonio, donde todas las mañanas sube muy contenta a cuidar de sus cultivos, con la ayuda de su esposo y de peones que le ayudan en tiempos de cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la temporada de siembra ya que se encuentran maduros, púes ve concretado su esfuerzo en la venta de sus cosechas en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Su principal dificultad son los gastos que realiza en la educación de sus hijos; por ello se siente contenta con el trabajo que realiza en el banquito comunal. Ahora ella espera muy gustosa, poder mejorar el revestimiento de su casa, donde está segura tendrá el apoyo de todos ustedes. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que le brindan en la realización de su casita. La casa de Luzmila, no posee cerco, ventanas, ni puertas; por ello con el crédito invertirá en la implantación de un muro, así como también puertas para su cocina y habitaciones.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 26 years old and cohabitates with Erminio.  They have 2 children, Braham and Verenise, who they care for and feed.  They live in their own house located in the town of Bellavista Huaracayo.

Her primary economic activity is farming.  She has 7 years of experience growing peas, beans, potatoes and corn; her crops are located in the hamlet of San Antonio where she goes contently each morning to tend to her plants.  She has her husband’s help, and also other laborers who assist at harvest time.

What she enjoys most about her work is the planting season, and seeing her crops mature so she can witness the fruit of her efforts when she sells her products at the wholesale market in Tarma.  Her biggest challenges are meeting the educational expenses of her children. For this reason, she is very content to work with her small cooperative bank.

Currently, she waits gladly to be able to make improvements to her home, an endeavor she is sure she will have all of your support for.  She belongs to the “Señor de Muruhuay” cooperative bank, and this is her third loan with MFP.  She is very grateful for the support they provide her towards fixing her house.  

Luzmila’s house doesn’t have a fence, windows or doors; for this reason, the loan will be invested into building a wall, as well as for installing doors for her kitchen and bedrooms.

loans.use: build a wall for her house, as well as doors.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Enrique, tiene la edad 29 de  años, está en unión libre y vive con  su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El  lo que pretende es realizar la compra de los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de los cultivos. El alquila el terreno a un vecino y lo tiene ya sembrado lo que quiere es generar las ganancias necesarias para seguir adelante con el proyecto der los granos básicos y ser un gran agricultor de la zona. También pretende generar las ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida con su esposa y seguir adelante con sus proyectos personales. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Enrique, 29, lives with his wife who is his main priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy farming supplies to enhance his crops.  He leases the land from a neighbor and has already planted it and what he wants is to generate the necessary profits to continue with his basic grains project and become a great farmer in the area providing his wife with better wellbeing and to continue with his personal projects.


This is the first loan he’s gotten from FUDECOSUR.  He has had no previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered him the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Steven

texts.fr: Steven  est client d’ACB depuis 2010. Il est marié, il est  âgé de 29 ans ,il a  2 enfants entre 4 mois et  6 ans, il a 1 enfant va à l’école et il a 3 personnes en charge.  Il est né au  Rwanda.son niveau d’éducation est 3ans de primaire.il est  agri-éleveur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utilise le prêt pour achète une vache  à élever. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire  est d’améliorer son élevage pour être plus moderne et ajouter les nombre des vaches pour être un grand distributeur de lait et de vache pour les boucheries. Dans l’avenir il voudrait devenir un grand distributeur  de lait et pour devenir un vendeur des gros bétails et pour sa famille il voudrait éduquer ses enfants, et prépare un meilleur avenir  pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Steven has been a client of ACB since 2010. He is married, 29 years old, and has two children, 4 months and 6 years old. One child goes to school. He is supporting three people.

He was born in Rwanda, and his formal education consists of three years of primary (elementary) school. He raises livestock for a living.

This is Steven's first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy a cow to raise. His strategy to expand his business is to modernize his farm and increase the number of cows in order to become a large supplier of milk and of beef for butcher shops.

In the future he would like to become a large dairy supplier. To become a large livestock merchant and to help his family, he would like to educate his children and prepare a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 48 years old. She is married and has 5 children aged 7, 9, 12, 15 and 25. In 1980, she established her provisions business. She started her business because she wanted to generate income and establish savings. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 850,000 every month. 

She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans. She now requires a new loan to buy more provisions by the carton and packet such as milk, sugar and sardines. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit by approximately Le 250,000. 

In the future, she plans to supply to retailers, educate her children and buy land. She is very determined and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for provisions, milk, sugar and sardines

loans.name: Triunfadores Group

texts.en: Nelby's business is raising chickens. She is 19 years old and married. She lives with her parents and her two children who are 3 years old and 1 year old. Nelby is of strong character, works hard and is friendly. Nelby’s mother taught her everything she knows about raising chickens and Nelby also dedicates her time to the same work. Nelby works alone and reports that her business is going well except for the recent rains that killed some of her chickens. Because of this loss, she is seeking this loan to obtain and care for more chickens. This is her first loan and she hopes that it will help her succeed and support her children, as her children’s father does not support them. Nelby’s dream is to build her own house, move forward with her children, and return to school to work on having a bigger and better business. The Triunfadores Group is composed of four people who live near the city of Ibarra, Ecuador. Their group name means “Triumphant Ones.” There are three men in the group and one woman. The president of the group is Nelby.

loans.use: to purchase and care for chickens.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Дилрабо проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 22 года. Она не замужем. У нее среднее образование. На сегодняшний день она занимается торговлей миндаля. Она собирает миндаль, сушит, а потом выносит на продажу. В основном она ходит по дамам и продает свой товар. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже год. Кредит берет для аренды торговой точки на центральном рынке района.
texts.en: Dilrabo lives in Shahrituz.  She is 22 years old and single.  SHe has a secondary education.  She sells almonds. She gathers almonds, dries them, and then takes them to sell.  Mostly she sells her goods door to door.  She has been doing this work for a year already.  She is taking out a loan to rent a shop in the region's central market.

loans.use: to rent a shop

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: Doña Nicolasa vive en la comunidad de Barrio las Peñas, pertenece al municipio de el Oro, México, la señora tiene 76 años de edad y lamentablemente es viuda, tubo 4 hijos, 3 ya son casados pero todavia ve por un hijo que va a la escula, para ´poder ganar dinero la señora cria pollos y los vende no tiene muchas ganancias de sus pollos y son tardadas ya que hay que esperar para que sus pollos crescan, por eso tambien vende nopales que son los que siembra y tambien siembra para vender lo que es cooll, coliflor, y brocoli, con esto la señora se ayuda para sacar dinero, ella vende sus verduras en el centro de la comunidad y nos comenta que las dificultades por las que pasa son que no habia agua para su cultivo y las plantas no crecian por eso tampoco tenia ventas y veia muy dificil para poder obtener dinero, con el credito quiere comprar pollitos y gujolotes para criar y vender.
texts.en: Ms. Nicolasa lives in the community of Barrio las Peñas, which pertains to the municipality of El Oro in Mexico.  She is 76 years old and is sadly a widow.  She has four children, three of whom are married and one who is still in school.  In order to make a living, she raises chickens and sells them.  She does not make a lot of money off of this because she has to wait for them to grow before she can sell them.  As such, she also sells "nopales" (a prickly pear cactus stem) which she grows and cauliflower and broccoli to earn a living.  She sells her vegetables at a shopping center and mentions that her greatest challenges have been obtaining water for her crops.  With this credit, she plans to purchase chicks and turkeys to raise and sell.

loans.use: to care for the chickens that she sells and to harvest broccoli and cauliflower.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: This is 29-year-old Salamatu. She is a hard working and honest woman.  She is married, and has two children aged seven and fourteen. She has one other dependent, her mother-in-law. In 2001, Salamatu established her palm oil business. She began her business to augment the effort of her husband in running the home. Working seven days-a-week, and ten hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. Salamatu requires a loan in order to buy palm and empty drums. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. In the future, Salamatu plans to build a house, and to give her children a quality education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy palm oil and empty drums.

loans.name: Rodolfo Jose

texts.es: Rodolfo José tiene 42 años, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador. Su actividad económica es la venta abarrotería, hace mas de 6 años que inicio este negocio Rodolfo aprendió este negocio porque trabaja en unas distribuidora,  tiene 8 hijos y Rodolfo siempre se hace cargo de este medio de vida. El se levanta muy temprano, ya que tiene que arreglar sus estantes para colocar sus productos.  Actualmente solicita el financiamiento para granos básicos, especies, golosinas, detergentes, pan, galletas, entre otros.
texts.en: Rodolfo José is 42 and a responsible, hard-working man with eight children.  For over six years he has been in the grocery store trade, which business he learned about while working for a distributor.  As the full-time manager of his store, he gets up early in the morning to organize the product shelves.  He is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, spices, sweets, detergents, bread, and cookies, etc.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, spices, sweets, detergents, bread, cookies, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 32 years old and supports a family of three people. He has been in the business of making and repairing shoes for the last two years. Right now his monthly income from the business is 1,500 KES. He is borrowing 12,500 KES, which he plans to use to buy materials for his business like threads and leather for making shoes. He plans to use the anticipated profit to invest back into the business. This is his first loan. His hopes and dreams are to provide his family with a good standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more threads and leather materials

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman who has two adult children. She and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Cristina does her best to help augment their income. She also wants to be able to extend support to her children even though they have their own families now.

Cristina has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. Cristina hopes that this loan will help increase their harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. Teresita has operated a shop for 2 years, selling coconuts and bananas. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell. Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is 45 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 22 and 20.  In 2001, she established  her furniture business.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy wood and timbers for her business.  In the future, Bina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way.  Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture.  With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets.  With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor.  This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buys wood and timbers.

loans.name: Angela Rosa

texts.es: Palacaguina municipio de Estelí, en donde proviene doña Ángela una amable y calidad señora de 41 años, quien se dedica a elaborar unos sabrosos frescos, es madre de dos hijos, casada. Ella desde temprana edad trabaja antes vendía guineos vendía y compraba plátanos también los vendía en toda su comunidad, pero un decidió que rea tiempo de hacer algo nuevo fue entonces que comenzó a vender frescos sus primeros clientes fueron sus propia familia quienes la motivaron aun mas para poner su negocio. Actualmente se dedica a vender a los trabajadores de las fábricas cercanas a su comunidad. Ella requiere el préstamo para arreglar las puertas de  su hogar , algunas partes de su casa esta algo deteriorada pero la preocupa las puertas de su casa que necesitan mayor seguridad, es por ello que quiere ir componiendo su casa poco a poco , seguir con su negocio, luchas por mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Angela, a kind woman with good qualities, comes from the small town of Palacaguina in the municipality of Estelí. She is 41 years old and works making delicious drinks. She is married and has two children. 

From an early age she worked selling bananas, buying and selling plantains throughout her community. But then she decided to do something new and it was then that she began to sell beverages. Her first customers were her own family who motivated her even more to have her own business. Now she sells to factory workers in the community. 

She is asking for a loan in order to fix the doors of her house. Some areas of her house are a bit deteriorated but her biggest worry is the doors of the house that need be better secured, and this is why she wants to go on repairing her house little by little, and to continue in her business, struggling to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to fix the doors of her house

loans.name: Syrgaim

texts.ru:
Сыргаим  52 года, замужем и имеет пятерых взрослых детей. Сыргаим - активная,  трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина, вкладывающая свою позитивную энергию и любовь в ручной пошив кыргызских национальных изделий. Ее красивые и изящные изделия пользуются большим спросом среди местного населения, и становятся частью приданого для местных невест.  
Также энергичная Сыргаим занимается животноводством – откормом и продажей скота.  Начав этот бизнес три года назад с начальной суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS), она сумела развить хозяйство, насчитывающее 4 барана и 2 коровы с ежемесячным доходом в 3,000 сом.    
  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сыргаим обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота.   В дальнейшем, она планирует увеличить свое  хозяйство и расширить бизнес.
texts.en: Syrgaim is 52 years old, married and has five adult children.  She is an active, hardworking and happy person, who invests her positive energy and love into hand-sowing Kyrgyz national items.  Her beautiful and elegant products are in high demand among the local residents and become included in dowries for local brides.  The energetic Syrgaim is also involved in animal husbandry - fattening up and selling livestock.  Having started this business three years ago with an initial sum of 3,000 som (KGS), she was able to grow her business to include four sheep and two cows and yield a monthly income of 3,000 som.  In order to further develop her business, Syrgaim requested a loan in the sum of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional livestock.  In the future, she plans to grow her farm and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Kenjegul's Group

texts.en:
Kenjegul is the treasurer of this group. She is 36 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two sons and three daughters. The first son studies at university. The oldest daughter and the second son are at school, and the two younger daughters are preschool age (under seven). Seven years ago, with an initial investment of 5,000 soms, the family started to breed livestock. Kenjegul’s husband sold two sheep and gained a good profit. And since that time, the family has been engaged in livestock breeding. With money received from the loan, Kenjegul wants to purchase four sheep for breeding, fattening, and further reselling. In the future she wishes to build a big house and improve the family’s welfare.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman.

Veronica has been engaged in fishing for 20 years. She and her husband now work together to grow their fishing business. Veronica sells her husband's catch and also buys fish from other fishermen to sell. Veronica works hard to improve their income and to continue providing for their family. She requested a loan to purchase nylon, bait and crab traps. Veronica hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase nylon, bait and crab traps.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 11 children. 

For six years, Evangeline has run a food shop, or sari-sari store. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Imelda has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Imelda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a 39-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be focused and hardworking. She operates a food stall where she sells food, snacks, tea, etc. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a fast growing area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve her food stall. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy cereals, flour, rice, salt and cooking oil.  Her business goal is to run a hotel within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy cereals, flour, rice, salt and cooking oil for cooking.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 36-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan, for three years. 

Rebecca is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy es una mujer de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente por diversas razones se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella es padre y madre para sus pequeños y dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacarlos adelante; por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Lucy no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Lucy trabaja como obrera en una empresa agrícola de su ciudad, adicionalmente también trabaja vendiendo ropa, tanto para hombres y mujeres, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Lucy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de prendas de vestir para su negocio, tales como polos, camisas, chompas, pantalones, entre otras prendas; de esta manera Lucy tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, así ella espera poder seguir trabajando para aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su casa propia y poder brindarles una buena educación a sus pequeños, ya que sueña verlos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.

loans.use: Para la compra de prendas de vestir para su negocio, tales como polos, camisas, chompas, pantalones,etc.

loans.name: Gulshan's Group

texts.en:
Gulshan has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband's milk and yogurt selling business.
He has been operating his business for many years and due to the good quality of his yogurt and milk, he is able to make very good sales every month. 
With the loan investment, he will buy milk in larger quantities, which will help him fulfill the needs of his clients and expand his business further. 
Gulshan expects that her husband will utilize the money in a better way and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy milk and a refrigerator for a milk and yogurt selling business.

loans.name: Isabelle

texts.fr: Isabelle âgée de 22 ans, n'a pas fréquenté l’école mais appris la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce de façon secondaire. Isabelle est mariée à un certain Placide. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et aucun à leur charge. Isabelle  vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Pour cette raison, Isabelle vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans son atelier ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux dépense de la maison. Isabelle s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de Isabelle devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Isabelle sollicite une première fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des  mèches et des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 54 years old, married and blessed with four children. She is a farmer and has been in this business for the last 16 years now. She will use the loan from Vision Fund Kenya to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm. She hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income, and support her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm in hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell.

loans.name: Junie

texts.en:
Junie is 48 years old. He has 4 children and his main activity is bamboo chair making and renting premises. He has had these businesses for some years and they are doing well. Junie has many customers who seek him out because of his good service and attention. He is a a very responsible man and is dedicated to his business. He is requesting the loan to pay for bamboo, hammers, saws, hacksaws, etc so that he can keep his business going and make the income necessary to keep raising his family.
His dream is to be able to give his children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase materials to more bamboo chairs to sell etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is married and lives in the city of Monclova, Coahuila. It has been seven years since she started selling cosmetics - she has always been a person very much wanting to grow and be independent. This way she generates her own income and she does not totally depend on her husband. Sonia wishes to build a house of their own to be able to provide a good quality of life for their future children. She has had to struggle for what she has achieved until now despirte the difficult situations that have crossed her path - she has always known to get up and keep going.

Today she requires a loan in the amount of $650 that she will repay in a term of 8 to 16 months that she will put towards the purchase of merchandise requested by her clients. Now is your chance to become part of the realization of Sonia\\\'s dreams. She needs you to keep going and she is thankful for your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Sonia es casada y vive en la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila, hace ya siete años que inició a vender cosméticos, pues ella siempre ha sido una persona con muchas ganas de crecer y de ser independiente. De esta manera ella genera sus propios ingresos y no depende totalmente de su esposo. Sonia tiene el deseo de construir un a casa propia para poder brindarle una buena calidad de vida a sus futuros hijos. Ella ha tenido que luchar mucho por lo que ha construid hasta el momento y a pesar que ha a atravesado por situaciones complicadas ha sabido levantarse para continuar.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 650 DLLS, mismos que cubrirá en un plazo de 8 a 16 meses y que utilizará para comprar la mercancía que sus clientes le piden. Ahora es tu oportunidad de se parte e la realización de los sueños de Sonia, ella te necesita para continuar y te agradece tu generosidad.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Absalon

texts.en:
Absalon has worked in the production and sales of frames and mirrors for 8 years. He began learning the trade from another person 20 years ago. Upon his release from his work with that person he decided to frame a print of a painting and offer it for sale. He sold it to a friend. This moved him to open his own business. Using his savings, and a loan, he was able to rent a space where he began to buy printed works, mount them and then sell the framed paintings. His business grew to the point that he had as many as six people working for him, selling the frames that he created. Unfortunately, competition came to the area. He began manufacturing mirrors, which worked out well for him. Currently, he produces both products without any help, aside from his son who now paints frames. He works seven days a week from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. His shop is located in his home.

Absalon would like to obtain a loan to invest in the production of mirrors which he has stopped making due to his lack of funds.

Absalon is married. He is 40 years old and has 4 children, one of which has begun to assist him in the production of the painting frames. His wife works as a homemaker. With the investment, he would like to once again engage salesman, allowing him to better his business.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Absalon tiene una experiencia de 8 años en el negocio de fabricación y venta de cuadros y espejos, actividad que la aprendió por medio de una persona desde hace 20 años. Una vez que se abrió de dicha persona para la que trabajaba decide elaborar un cuadro y salirlo a vender el que se lo vendió a un amigo. Esto lo impulso a tener ya su negocio propio. Con los ahorros que tenia y un crédito logra alquilar un local donde comienza la elaboración de cuadros. Llego a tener hasta seis personas a su cargo que eran los que les vendían los cuadros que el elaboraba. Lamentablemente llego la competencia por lo que decide elaborar espejos con los que le fue muy bien. Al momento elabora los dos productos pero sin ayudantes, solo su hijo que ya pinta los cuadros. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. Tiene el taller ubicado en su domicilio.

Absalon desea el crédito para poder invertir en la elaboración de espejos los cuales ha dejado de fabricar por falta de capital.

Absalon es casado. Tiene 40 años y 4 hijos de los cuales uno ya le ayuda en la elaboración de sus cuadros. Su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Su deseo es poder con la inversión que hace lograr incluir nuevamente a vendedores que le ayuden a mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and equipment to begin producing mirrors again.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Claudio M. is 41 years old, but he is still single. He does not have children and he lives in a humble home with his mother and 2 brothers. Twelve years ago, he traveled to Argentina in search of a better future. There, he worked in various jobs, the blacksmith trade among them, and this has been his field of work since then. Nevertheless, his greatest dream is to run a little bakery, which is something he also did in the past. He is already acquiring the necessary equipment for this business, but he still needs a dough mixer. This is why he asking for a loan, to buy a second hand mixer and realize his dream.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudio Martínez tiene actualmente 41 años pero aún sigue soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con su madre en una casa humilde que comparte con otros 2 hermanos. Hace 12 años viajó a la Argentina en busca de mejores horizontes. Allí realizó varios tipos de trabajos, entre ellos la herrería y se dedica a eso desde ese entonces. No obstante su mayor anhelo es montar una pequeña panadería, actividad que también conoce y desarrolló alguna vez. Para ello ya está adquiriendo de a poco las maquinas necesarias para equiparla pero aún le falta una amasadora. Es así que le gustaría acceder a un préstamo para comprar una de segunda mano y de esa forma cumplir su sueño.

loans.use: Buy machinery for a bakery.

loans.name: Husen

texts.ru:
Husen works on a collective farm. He is married and has 3 children. At home he has farm animals and every year his family and he dry apricots. He takes apricots from the collective farm that are allocated to him for his work. He also purchases apricots from other farmers in order to increase his profits. The prices for dried apricots increase as winter gets closer and Husen then sells them. The profits go towards family expenditures.

Last year Husen got a loan from MicroInvest for the purchase of apricots. That loan brought him good profits. This year he plans on getting a new loan for the processing and storage of dried apricots. In the photo is Husen’s family processing apricots.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хусен работает в колхозе. Хусен женат и у него 3 детей. Дома он держит домашний скот и еще каждый год он и его семья сушат абрикосы. Для этого он берет абрикосы в колхозе, которые ему выделяют за его работу. Еще чтобы получить большую прибыль он покупает абрикосы у других колхозников. Цены на сушеные абрикосы повышаются к зиме, и тогда Хусен продает их. Вырученные деньги идут на расходы семьи. В прошлом году Хусен получил займ в Микроинвест на покупку абрикосов. Тогдашний займ принес ему хорошую прибыль. В этом году он собирается получить новый займ на переработку и хранение сушеных абрикосов. Семья Хусена во время переработки абрикоса.

loans.use: for purchase, drying and storage apricots

loans.name: Gill

texts.es:
Gill, 58, is an auto tire servicer, and married to Saturnina Lesme, a teacher. They have two sons: one is a police officer and the other is a first-year law student at college. Gill has had a tire shop for more than 20 years; he learned the trade from his uncle, whom he worked with many years. Later, Gill got married and with his savings, he found his shop in an area where there were no other competing tire services. Together with his wife, they have been able to provide an education for their children. With the loan, he plans to buy a compressor. His services are in high demand and without it, he is unable to fully satisfy his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Gill tiene 58 años, gomero de profesión, casado con Saturnina Lesme quien es docente y aporta para los gastos del hogar. Tiene dos hijos, uno es policía de carrera con ingresos, y la otra estudiante del primer año en la Carrera de Derechos de Universidad. Gill tiene una gomería hace mas de 20 años, aprendió el oficio de su tío con quien trabajó por muchos años, luego se casó y habilitó su propia gomería, con su ahorro logro comprar un terreno bien ubicado, sin competencia en la zona que en la zona no había ninguna gomería que prestaba servicios. Gracias al esfuerzo de él y su esposa logaron educar a sus hijos. Con el crédito proyecta comprar una compresora, tiene una alta demanda y no logra satisfacer plenamente a sus clientes.

loans.use: buy a compressor

loans.name: Mwahija

texts.en:
Mwahija is 40 years old and works in multiple small trades in order to support her household. Left by her husband 4 years ago, she single-handedly takes care of 10 children – 4 of her own, 2 stepchildren from her husband, and 4 orphans. Her main business is a cement store called “Mwahija Y. Kabira,” which opened 8 years ago. In one month, Mwahija is able to earn a profit of around US$350 from selling 200 sacks of cement at her store. On the side, she sells corn flour, charcoal, chicken feed, and rents out 6 rooms from her house.

Mwahija’s last loan, which she paid back successfully, was spent on school fees and buying cement. She now hopes to take out a new loan of US$900 to buy another load of cement.

Mwahija belongs to a group called Subira (Swahili for “patience”) - the group has 22 members who keep each other accountable and help each other pay back their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of cement

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Mrs. Estela is a partner of the Communal Bank “Women for the development of Pariahuanca”, she dedicates herself to the sale of grains: wheat, corn, as well as hulled wheat and corn for wholesale. Her business is located in the market in the Province of Huaraz, in the city of Ancash; she sells on Mondays and Thursdays. With this loan of 1,800 soles, which will be paid off in 6 installments, she will buy 4 sacks of corn to hull, 4 sacks of wheat to hull as well, 5 sacks of corn, 1 sack of lime and 3 sacks of ash. She is 50 years old, she is married and has 3 children, 2 males and 1 female, all are older and independents. Her income has allowed her to support her children with their studies and sometimes economically support her grandchildren. Her husband helps her in this business and the income of the business allows them to pay for the expenditures of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Estela es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Desarrollo de Pariahuanca”, se dedica a la venta de granos, trigo, maíz y pelado de trigo y de maíz al por mayor. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la feria de la provincia de Huaraz, Departamento de Ancash, vende los días lunes y jueves. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará 4 sacos de maíz cuzqueño para hacer pelado, 4 sacos de trigo para también hacer pelado, 5 sacos de maíz para cancha, 1 saco de cal y 3 sacos de ceniza. Ella tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos, 2 varones y una mujer, ambos son mayores de edad e independientes. Sus ingresos le ha permitido apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios y de vez en cuando apoya económicamente a sus nietos. Su esposo le apoya en este negocio y los ingresos de este negocio les permite solventar los gasto de sus hogar.

loans.use: The purchase of grains for wholesale.  The purchase of lime and ash (supplies).

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is a very active woman who dreams of improving her lifestyle. She's been selling beauty products for many years: Perfumes, shampoos, powders, lipsticks, nail enamel, etc. With her hard work she's been able to acquire many customers and for this reason, she wishes to purchase a window display. She's a 28 year old single mother of two wonderful children. All she hopes of them is to become successful professionals. This working mother wishes to get a loan as soon as possible in order to achieve her goal. With your help Esther will be able to accomplish her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer,

Esther, es una mujer muy activa y con muchos deseos de superación, ella se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la venta de productos de belleza como: perfumes, shampoos, talcos, lápiz labiales, correctores para uñas, etc; con su desempeño ha logrado con este trabajo una gran gama de clientes y por esa razón optado por poner su mostrador (vitrina) con el objetivo de surtirlo con estos productos de belleza. Ella a sus 28 años es madre de dos hijos maravillosos y lo único que espera es que estudien y sean profesionales exitosos.Esta trabajadora madre precisa de un capital lo más pronto posible para lograr su objetivo y cumplir con lo que realmente quiere. Con tu ayuda la señora Esther logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase of a window display and go add more capital to her business

loans.name: Mazakhir

texts.en:
Mazakhir is a 40 year-old, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan of the Fizuli region. He settled in the Fizuli region of Kayidish village, a village that was built for IDPs.

He is married with two children. He plans to buy calves which he hopes to fatten before their sale. He has five years of experience in this business. Now, he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 2 calves to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Nicida

texts.es:
Señora Nicida belongs to the communal bank called "Women with Perseverance 2" which is located in the district of Yarina Cocha in the city of Ucayali. She's 32 years old and she's a mother of 3 children. Her husband is a salesman.

She currenly has a small place where she sells natural remedies/medicine. She opens up her store at about 8:00 in the morning, and then in the evenings she collects money from people who owe her money.

With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase more natural remedies/medicine such as a box of tonics, 2 boxes of capsules for different illnesses, etc.

Nicida is very happy since her business keeps growing daily. She can provide her children with basic necessities. Her family is very happy for her.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nicida pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Preserverantes 2, ubicado en la Carretera Antigua de Yarina Cocha 290, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un local donde vende sus productos de medicina natural, abre su local a las 8 am., y en las tardes se dedica a la cobranza de sus créditos que deja a algunas de sus clientas. Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertira en la compra de medicinas naturales como: 1 caja de tónicos, 2 cajas de cápsulas, para diferentes enfermedades. Nicida esta muy feliz, su negocio esta creciendo sus ventas aumentan y todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para darles una buena educación y futuro a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase more natural medicine to sell

loans.name: Saumu's Sasa Kazi Group

texts.en:
Saumu is 20 years old and is a single woman. Saumu is a shoes seller; she started her business in 2008. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more shoes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Rukia, who has a business dealing in fish sales.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for her business

loans.name: Felicity

texts.en: Felicity B. is twenty six years old and she is single. She is very serious with her work since it is her major source of livelihood. She owns a small hair product's shop in one of the busy local markets, with the help from her previous loan. She sells products like weave-ons, hair pomade, shampoo, combs and plastic bows and plates. She wants to use the next loan to buy a variety of weave-ons, hair pomade, shampoo and plastics to increase her stock of goods to meet the taste and preference of her customers, and increase her income. Felicity belongs to the community group called Shepherd Trust Group. Members guarantee one another as social collateral to access a loan.

loans.use: To buy more the assorted weave-ons, hair pomade, shampoo and plastics

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Mr. Sary L., age 27, is divorced and lives with his widowed mother and 1 younger brother along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. His brother is in high school.

Mr. Sary has been a beauty products seller for 5 years, a skill he learned from his uncle. He bought the products from the market in Phnom Penh for resale in Kampong Cham province about 150 kilometers from his home and at a nearby village. Mr. Sary is requesting a loan of US$200 to purchase more beauty products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for resale

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa Amelia is 46 years old and married with 4 children, all of whom are now independent. Her husband is already retired, but he works as a taxi driver in order to increase the family's earnings.

Rosa Amelia has a convenience store in her home with which she supports the family. They live in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, an area known for a high delincuency rate. Rosa wants to assure that her home and her business are secure, She is requesting a loan with which to buy a wooden door and wrought iron for a gate, in order to secure the entrance and give her peace of mind when she leaves the house empty.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rosa Amelia tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos que ya son independientes a ella. Su esposo ya está jubilado, pero trabaja en un vehículo taxi para percibir mayores ganacias para la familia.

Doña Rosa Amelia tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación con la que apoya a los gastos familiares. Habitan el barrio Villa Reconciliación lugar conocido por un índice delincuencial alto, y Doña Rosa desea asegurar su vivienda y su negocio, solicita el préstamo para comprar una puerta de madera y hierro para ponerle verjas y así asegurarla y darle mayor tranquilidad cuando ella sale y deja su casa sola.

loans.use: Reinforce the entrance to her home.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.en:
Soria is a 41-year-old woman who lives with her seven children in the slums that surround Santo Domingo. Her children range from 23 years old to 9 years old.

She has a small business where she sells various hair accessories, beauty supplies, and feminine accessories. She asked for this loan so that she could invest more money into the supplies that she is able to sell from her store. With the extra income from this story she hopes to save her money so that one day in the next couple of years she can open an even bigger store and be known as a respectable business woman and leader in her community.

Her dream is to own her own home one day, and one that is built from concrete blocks so that it will withstand the hurricanes and tropical storms that pound her tiny country every year. She also hopes to see her children go to college, and continue with their studies.

Soria and her story represent the Las Flores Bank of Hope; she belongs to a group of 10 women and men and women who are taking out their first micro loan with Esperanza. Each of these men and women has taken out a similar loan to that of Soria’s—on behalf of all of them, and our team here at Esperanza, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To invest in  the purchase of a better variety of merchandise for her accessories store.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana Q. C. es casada y tiene dos hijos (3 y 6 años de edad). Vive en un pequeño departamento  en la C. 3  de la zona 23 de Marzo  en la ciudad de El Alto. 

Trabaja como ayudante en el minibús, el cual conduce su esposo.

El crédito será destinado para adquirir  llantas para el vehiculo. 
 
Es su primer  crédito con Impro, los resultados de nuestra evaluación indican que puede acceder al préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana Q. C. is married and has two children (3 and 6 years of age). She lives in a small district on street "3" in the "23 de Marzo" zone in the city of El Alto.

She works as an assistant in the minibus that her husband drives.

Her loan will be allocated to acquire tires for the vehicle.

This is her first loan with Impro. The results of our evaluation indicate that she is qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle Maintenance

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela de 40 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juan Pablo II”, ella piensa instalar un locutorio y un Internet, para poder tener mas ingresos ya que sus dos hijos están adolescentes y pronto ingresaran a estudiar una carrera superior.
Durante 15 años, ella se ha mantenido en su negocio, venta de abarrotes, que lo tiene en su propia casa o como ella dice en la casa de sus padres, a pesar que su esposo es mecánico de profesión, no se abastece lo suficiente para mantener a sus hijos, todos los productos que ofrece los  compra en Huaraz  de los mayoristas que le  ofertan en su propia casa.

Ella ha sabido crecer en este difícil negocio, a pesar, de las constantes competencias que se han presentado en su barrio  de pedregal que se encuentra  en la ciudad de Huaraz. Lo mas difícil para ella es cuando sus clientes  a veces se fían y después no le pagan.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200 soles, que lo pagará en 6 cuotas, ella comprará  productos al por mayor, como arroz, azúcar, bebidas gasificadas y alcohólicas,  para  surtir  su tienda.
texts.en:
Adela, 40, is a member of the Juan Pablo II ("John Paul II") community bank. She's planning to set up a "locutorio" (a shop that sells on-site phone and Internet services) in order to increase her income. Her children are teenagers now and she needs more money to pay for their future schooling. For 15 years, she's operated a grocery business in her house or, as she says, in her parent's house. Although her husband is a mechanic, there's not enough money to pay for all that their children need. She buys products for her shops from wholesalers in Huarez.

She has figured out how to grow in this difficult business even though she faces enormous competition from similar businesses in her neighborhood of Pedregal, a part of the city of Huarez. The hardest thing is when her customers buy on credit and then don't pay.

With this loan of S/.1,200 (1,200 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 6 installments, she will buy wholesale supplies of products such as rice, sugar, sodas and liquor to supply her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for grocery business.

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en:
Mrs. Bopha H. is 42 years old. She is a decorator for wedding parties and other ceremonies. She also works in farming, while her husband, Mr. Chanveasna Chean, 39, is in the military. Bopha is the mother of three children, two of whom go to school, and one daughter who helps her in her business. They all live in the area of Prolay Commune, Kompong Tom Province. Bopha has many years of experience; hence, her business is going well with many clients.

Bopha requests a loan of US$1,000 to purchase decorating materials to fulfill her customers' requirements. The loan will be helping this modern business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for fulfill her customers' requirements

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Sam-at Y., 32, and her husband, Hout Thol, 29, live in a small village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have been married for eight years and have four children; one son and three daughters. Three children attend school and the other one is still young and stays at home.

Sam-at has been a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh for ten years. Her husband has been a full time employee in an electrical shop in Phnom Penh for seven years. Sam-at is requesting a loan of US$900 to build a restroom for the family house.

loans.use: To build one restroom to use in the family house

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Run C. is a group leader of six who live in Tropang Thmor village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Run C. is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. Since the second plantation is doing well, she wants to expand. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more watermelon seeds to cultivate. Her husband, Mr. Oeurn Pheap, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Run C. is 43 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining five attend the local school. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The four members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more watermelon seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Ayeben (Soyez  Unies) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ayében  est un regroupement de 6  femmes  qui ont longtemps cohabité ensemble. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 5  enfants, vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Heremakono de Kimparana, Préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Pour augmenter  leurs chiffres d’affaire afin de tirer le maximum de profit de leurs activités, ces femmes ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Le montant du premier prêt est de 50.000 FCFA, c’est un groupe qui est à son début de collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elles mènent  deux activités (la vente de condiments comme  principale activité et la restauration comme  secondaire).  Elles se procurent de leurs  marchandises au grand marché de kimparana et kouroubadougou. Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter divers condiments destinés à la vente et à la restauration. Elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 40 000 CFA chacune avec ce prêt, elles vendent les condiments à la porte de leur maison pendant la journée et  pour la restauration elles ont des gargotes au marché. En dehors du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Ayében group is made up of six women who have lived together for a long time. They average 31 years of age, are married and have at least five children. They all live in traditional families in the neighbourhood of Heremakono in Kimparana, San Prefecture, in Mali. In order to increase their sales and maximize their profits, these women have decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. Their first loan request is for 50,000 FCFA. This group is just beginning their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso. They have two sources of income: the sale of condiments is their primary activity and catering is their secondary activity. They get their goods from the main market of Kimparana and Kouroubadougou. This loan will be used to buy an assortment of condiments for resale and for their catering business. They expect to earn an average of 40,000 FCFA each with this loan. They sell their condiments at the door of their home during the daytime and for their catering business they have diners in the market. Aside from repaying their loan, they will use a portion of their revenues to contribute to the household expenses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments and ingredients for their food stalls.

loans.name: Loida Grimaneza

texts.es:
LOIDA GRIMANEZA, pertenece al banco comunal “Vecinas  Unidas”, ubicado en Jr. Padre Bietman  N° 168 – Distrito D. Callería, tiene 54 años D. edad, 04 hijos todos mayores D. edad, su esposo es docente cesante, realiza la elaboración y venta D. Wantanes y corbatitas fritas.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue Trescientos Nuevos Soles (S/. 300.00), compró insumos para su elaboración, 01 saco D. harina, una cocina pequeña sartén para freír los wantanes y corbatitas, tiene muchos clientes ya que sus productos son deliciosos y muy solicitados.

Con este préstamo D.  S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró 01 saco D. harina, 01 paquete D. aceite D. 1 litro, ketchup, chuño, insumos en variedad como bolsas para empaquetar, como así mismo  va ampliar un espacio mas en su casa para que pueda tener mas comodidad. Loida cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo.

Se siente más consolidada económicamente, independiente, ayuda con la economía del hogar, gracias a Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
