LOIDA GRIMANEZA belongs to the community bank “Vecinas Unidas” (United Neighbours), located in Jr. Padre Bietman, number 168, in the district of Callería. She is 54 years old and has 4 grown up children. Her husband is unemployed, and she works making and selling wontons and fried pasta. The first loan that she received was 300 Soles (S/. 300.00). She bought ingredients for her work, 1 bag of flour, a small kitchen frying pan to fry the wontons and noodles. She has many clients and her products are delicious and in high demand. With this loan of S/. 2,000.00, she will buy 1 bag of flour, 1 one-litre package of oil, ketchup, potato flour, and various items like bags to package her wares. In this way she will make a bigger space in her home so that she will have more convenience. Loida has the help of her husband. She feels much stronger economically and independent, helping with the economics of the household, thanks to Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 1 bag of flour, 1 one-litre package of oil, ketchup, potato flour, and various items like bags to package her product

loans.name: Eka

texts.en: Eka F., 29, is married and has four children. She has just started planting, harvesting, and selling bananas and taro. She sells to the village people and general public three days a week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145 USD).  SPBD loans are Eka’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Eka is motivated to improve her buisness so that she pay for her children's school fees and improve her family's way of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, chemicals, and equipment

loans.name: Jorge Raul

texts.es:
Jorge  es conviviente  tiene 42 años, tres hijos de 15, 9 y 4 años que están en la escuela  estatal.
Jorge vende pollos y le quedaban bastantes residuos, su esposa vende comida y también le quedaban residuos y  tenían que pagar para que se lo lleven, es cuando vio que los residuos le podían ser útiles como  comida de chanchos, es cuando decidieron criar chanchos, actualmente tiene 180 chanchos. 
Jorge necesita 1600 soles, para comprar chanchos  vivos, y comida para chanchos.
Desde que está en Finca, ha progresado económicamente, también  aprendió a ser puntual en sus pagos por que le cuesta.
El sueño de Jorge es comprar una camioneta para su negocio.
texts.en:
Jorge is 42 years old and he lives with his wife and children. He has three children that are the ages of 15, 9, and 4 years old. They are all in public school. Jorge sells chicken and his wife sells food, and they used to always have leftovers. They always used to have to pay people to take away the leftovers until Jorge got the idea to raise pigs and to feed the leftovers to the pigs. He now has 180 pigs. Jorge needs $525 to buy live pigs and food for them. Since Jorge has been in the group Finca, he has progressed economically. Also, he has learned to be punctual in making his payments on loans for his business. Jorge’s dream is to buy a truck for his business. (Translated by Reece of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jorge needs $525 to buy live pigs and food for them.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim H. is a 47-year-old trader who sells cosmetics in the small village of Agsu city. Rasim is married and has five children! He started his business 20 years ago and, step by step, he achieved his goal and built his own store.

Rasim also works as a teacher in the local school but his salary is just not enough to cover his family's basic needs. Rasim is focused on developing his own business and for this purpose he applied for $1,500 loan to increase his income and pay for his children's university education.

loans.use: To increase number of items he sells

loans.name: Ahmadchon

texts.ru:
Ахмадчон Ортиков  мужчина 1950 года рождения.Проживает с женой Ортиковой Дилбар и 3 детьми в зафарабадском районе поселке Мехнатобод.С 25 лет он занимается животноводством. Откармливает и перепродает крупонорогатый скот.
 Хочет получить займ в размере 2000 сомони сроком на 8 месяцев. 
 Дополнительно Ахмадчон  занимается  переработкой молока, а так же  является  директором  дехканского хозяйства «М.Чумаев».
texts.en:
Ahmadchon O. was born in 1950. He lives with his wife Dilbar and their 3 children in the village of Mehnatobod in the Zafarabad district. He has been involved in animal husbandry since the age of 25. He feeds and sells cattle. He wants to obtain an 8-month loan in the sum of 2000 somoni. In addition to this business, Ahmadchon is involved in milk processing and is also a director of the M. Chumaev dekhan farm.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Базарова Адолат проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст 44 года , вдова. Одна воспитывает четверых детей.муж погиб в автокатострофе. Уже 4 года она занимается пошивом национальных платьев, ватных одеял, подушек и др. Для покупки новой более универсальной швейной машинки решила получить кредит .Это поможет ей наладить бизнес.
texts.en:
Adolat B. resides in Gissar. She is a 44-year old widow with 4 children. Her husband was killed in a car crash. For the past four years Adolat has been making a living by sewing national dresses, cotton blankets, pillows, etc. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase a better sewing machine and get the business running.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Meena

texts.en:
Meena U. is the successful business owner of a nursery, which is located 26 km north of Kathmandu Valley, towards the Tibetan border.

Meena employs 20 people in her nursery and, although she lives Kulashwor in the Kathmandu Valley, she regularly travels a long way to oversee her business. The flowers grown at Meena’s nursery are sold at a number of locations in the Kathmandu Valley and her business is growing over time.

Meena is applying for a loan of 30,000 Nepalese Rupees to purchase new seedlings for her nursery. Because it is monsoon season in Nepal now, it is an important time to plant new seeds in time for the rain.

Meena has one daughter who has recently finished high school and is hoping to begin university soon and a husband who works in the government service.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings for the nursery

loans.name: Aïchatou

texts.fr: A. Aïchatou est née le 17/05/1984 à Porto-Novo dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Aïchatou est mariée à MIWkounou Frédéric, un commerçant. Aïchatou est mère de deux enfants. Aïchatou et son mari ainsi que ses enfants vivent au domicile de ses beaux parents. C’est les divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.) que Aïchatou vend à la devanture de ses beaux parents à Agblangandan un quartier de Cotonou. Aïchatou a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits de ALIDé ; et Aïchatou rembourse ses crédits toujours sans aucune difficulté. Pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire davantage ses clients, Aïchatou sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Aïchatou was born on May 17, 1984 in Porto-Novo in Ouémé county, in southern Benin. She is married to MIWkounou Frédéric, a merchant, and is the mother of two children. She and her husband, as well as their children, live in the home of her parents-in-law. Various goods, such as candies, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardine, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, batteries, candles, etc., are what Aïchatou sells in the entryway of her in-laws, there in Agblangandan, a district of Cotonou. She has already benefited from three loans from Alidé and has always repaid them without any difficulties at all. To bolster her business and to satisfy her customers more, she is requesting a fourth loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a 50-kg sack of sugar, 50 kilos of cassava flour, three boxes of cookies, and some boxes of candy

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa A. R. tiene 64 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, Provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria. Tiene 4 hijos pero ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
Rosa se dedica a la venta de quesos, quesillos, manjar blanco y mantequilla. Los cuales los venden a sus amistades, vecinos y familiares.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles inicio comprando quesos, quesillos, manjarblanco y mantequilla.
Este crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de productos lácteos como: queso, quesillo, manjarblanco, mantequilla, yogout, para poder cubrir sus pedidos a tiempo, aumentar sus ventas y su ganancia.
Rosa sueña con aumentar su clientela y colocar un puesto en el mercado de Moche.
texts.en:
Rosa A. is 64 years old, and lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. She completed 5th year of secondary school. She has 4 grown children. Rosa sells cheese, cheese curd, caramel, and butter to her friends, neighbors, and family. With her first loan for 300 Nuevos Soles she began buying cheese, cheese curd, caramel and butter. With this loan for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles she will buy dairy products such as cheese, cheese curd, caramel, butter, yogurt in order to be able to meet her orders, increase her sales and her earnings. Rosa dreams of increasing her clientele and opening a stand in the Moche market.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese, cheese curd, caramel, butter, etc.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina C. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Christina sells soft drinks in Elmina, which she has done since 2009. Her husband is a security officer. Christina uses her income for school fees and other bills. Christina will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Christina plans to save some money and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Sarita Angelica

texts.en:
Sarita is a member of the Purple Christ communal bank. She is 32 years old and has four children who are 14, 12, 10, and 4 years old. All her children go to the local public school. For 8 years, Sarita has been working with her mother selling comforters in her district. She also sells carbonated water and cleaning supplies.

Since Sarita joined FINCA she has learned to manage her savings and invest in her business. She wants to buy a computer for her children so that they can learn some computer skills and do their homework. Sarita needs a loan of 1,200 soles to buy rice, sugar, and oil which she also wants to start selling. Her dream is to move out of her parents’ house and have a house of her own for her family.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, and oil for resale

loans.name: Horm

texts.en:
C. currently makes rattan furniture. She is 31 years old and is a resident of Kompong Tom province, located about 200 km from the capital, Phnom Penh. She has two children, both of whom are teenagers and attend school.

C. saves up over ten sets of rattan and then sells them to her buyers for profit. Generally, her valued clients need to order a few days or a week in advance.

Another source of family income comes from her husband driving a motor taxi. C. requests a loan to allow her husband to buy a trailer to connect with his existing motorcycle which will enable him to pick up more customers.

loans.use: To buy a trailer for her husband's existing motorcycle

loans.name: Villa Florida Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Villa Florida, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Huanchos, distrito de Chinchihuasi, Provincia de Churcampa, departamento de Huancavelica. Esta Comunidad está a 45 minutos del distrito de Paucarbamba, comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, así como al comercio.

Sonilda, es madre soltera, tiene 01 hijo. Sonilda es una mujer muy emprendedora, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su pequeña bodega, vende dulces en un colegio y también cría y vende animales menores en su casa. Gracias a sus préstamos y el apoyo de su familia ella sigue haciendo crecer sus negocios. Con su nuevo préstamo, ella comprará mercadería para su bodega y aumentara la crianza de sus animales.

Máxima, es casada y tiene 01 hijo. Ella se dedica hace mucho tiempo a la venta de abarrotes, negocio en el cual le ayuda su esposo e hijo. Máxima, se abastece de productos en la ciudad y los lleva a su comunidad para su venta, por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The Villa Florida Communal Bank is located in the community of Huanchos, Chinchihuasi distrcit, Churcampa province, Huancavelica department. This community is 45 minutes from the Paucarbamba district and is dedicated to agriculture and cattle farming as well as commerce. Sonilda is a single mother of one son. She is a very enterprising woman who sells groceries in her small store as well as candies and sweets at a local school. She also breeds and sells small animals from her home. Thanks to her loans and the support of her family, her business continues to grow. With her new loan, she will buy merchandise for her store and increase the number of animals she breeds. Máxima is married and has one son. She has sold groceries for a long time, and her husband and her son help her with the business. Máxima stocks up on products in the city and brings them back to sell in her community. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Villa Florida Communal Bank is requesting a loan to invest in 16 member businesses.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
Kadie is a trader who sells textiles (cotton wax prints and lace materials). She is married to a building contractor and has five dependents, two of whom are her kids. One of her children is in secondary school and the other in primary school. She has ten years of business experience.

Kadie is seeking a Le 3,000,000 loan for six months in order to buy additional cloth from Guinea as well as beverages and toiletries which she supplies to NGOs in Bo. Her shop is rented and is located in the heart of the central market—Shenge. She is dedicated to her business and works very hard. Kadie usually works alone unless she needs additional help during the holidays at which time she recruits the help of her children.

Kadie hopes that her income will enable her to continue to pay her kids' school fees as well as help to finish their home which is under construction.

loans.use: To buy textiles for her store

loans.name: Najjanakumbi E Nakito Sarah Group

texts.en: N. Sarah, 32, is a hardworking business lady, who is married with four children, three of whom are in school. She has been rearing poultry for over ten years. She will use the loan to purchase poultry drugs and feed, expand the poultry shade structure, and purchase chicks to replace the current inventory. She is very encouraging and her dream is to work very hard and provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies, inventory, and expand the poultry shade structure.

loans.name: Laureto

texts.en:
Laureto is a tricycle operator and also a driver. He is 52 years old and married to Perlita, a full-time housewife. For almost 30 years they have also been running a typical retail store in their village. They have one daughter named Karen Pearl, who is 16 years old and a first year college student. They are presently living in baranggay Sta. Maria, Alicia, Isabela – a rural area. Most people living there are into farming. Their house is located along Maharlika Highway.

Laureto's daily net income is 300 up to 500 Philippine pesos (PHP). He desires a loan of 7,000 PHP as additional capital for repair and maintenance of his tricycle. He continuously dreams of increasing their productivity which he wants to achieve in the near future.

loans.use: For repair and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 41 years old, single, and works as a dairy farmer in Montecato, just outside of the city of Cochabamba. She also has a small grocery shop that she runs out of her home, where she sells snacks like crackers and soda. Leonor has been working as a dairy farmer for 12 years, beginning when she was a young teenager helping her mother.

Leonor is the youngest of her parents' children, so she is responsible for caring for her elderly parents. She has also been taking care of her nieces and nephews, as their parents left them under the care of Leonor's parents and never visit them nor pay for their education. Leonor makes sure the children attend school near her home, so she can look out for them. She is a very hard worker and works from very early morning hours, while also attending to the shop in her home and caring for her parents.

With this loan from CIDRE, Leonor is going to build a stable for her cows. Leonor's dream is to grow her milk production and earnings so that she can take care of her elderly parents well.

loans.use: Construction of a stable for dairy cows

loans.name: Leopoldina De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Leopoldina se dedica a la venta de ropa para poder cubrir los gastos del sustento de su familia, su esposo siempre ha trabajado en el comercio de dedicaba a la venta de tomate pero por la artritis su enfermedad no esta trabajando lo que hace que doña Leopoldina se esfuerce mas para poder ayudarlo con sus medicamentos. Hemos sido una familia de pocos recursos pues por gracia de Dios pudimos hacer nuestra pequeña casa de concreto y tabla aunque ya muy vieja por que no sean cambiados debidos que no se ha podido por que los ingresos son poco y a pena ajusta para la canasta básica. Procreo cuatro hijos los cuales trabajan en un mercado muy visitados por los Nicaragüense por su costo bajo como por su variedad de ventas, no lograron terminar su ciclo de estudio debido a que no tenían los recursos de dinero para terminar es por eso con la necesidad De poder sustentar buscaron trabajo. Con este financiamiento desea poder comprar ropa variada de hombre y mujer para poder cubrir la demanda de sus encargos como poder captar clientes nuevos. Y poder seguir adelante pero solo mediante este crédito podré reforzar mi inventario para poder trabajar y sastifacer las necesidades a diario de la alimentación.
texts.en:
Leopoldina sells clothes to cover the costs of sustaining her family. Her husband used to work in commerce selling tomatoes, but due to his arthritis, he no longer works. For this reason, Leopoldina has increased her efforts, in order to help with his medicines.

They have always been a family of limited means but by the grace of God, they were able to build a small house of concrete and construction board. It is now very old and hasn't been improved because their income has been low, barely serving for the basic market basket. They had 4 children who now work in a market that's very popular with Nicaraguans due to its low cost and variety of goods. The children were unable to finish school because of the lack of money. They too needed to work in order to survive.

With this loan she wishes to buy a variety of clothes for men and women, covering her orders and increasing inventory, so she can work and satisfy daily food necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A VARIETY OF CLOTHES FOR MEN AND WOMEN TO SELL

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en:
Sylvester is 42 years old. He is a divorced with three children. He is a retailer of car spare parts and scraps. He buys his supplies from spare-parts dealers and sells on a retail basis to his customers. He enjoys his trade very much. However, he is handicapped by low working capital since prices have gone up. He therefore needs the loan to remain in business. 

He wants to use the loan to buy new stock of spare parts and scraps to serve his customers. He believes this will enable him to make a good income to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in bulk

loans.name: Rosa Nery

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Nery, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas de Belén”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años y es madre de 08 hijos, 06 que aun dependen de ella.

Su carácter y anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito. Desde entonces, poco a poco, ha ido ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad y supo salir adelante.

Rosita, como le dicen de cariño, nos cuenta que sus ventas, le están yendo muy bien y sus clientes día a día, acuden a su tienda a comprar, porque en ella  encuentran todo lo necesario, que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal, paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y marcas para de esta manera satisfacer y brindar una mejor  atención a sus clientes. 

Rosa Nery, se siente con muchas fuerzas aun, para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela R. por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Rosa Nery belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Activas de Belén,” located in the Moyobamba district, Moyobamba province, in the department of San Martín. She is married, 40 years old, and is the mother of 8 children, 6 of whom are still dependent upon her. Her personality and her desire to accomplish her dreams motivated her to start her own business selling groceries, located in the central market of her district. Since then, little by little, she has gained experience in this type of activity and has learned how to succeed. Rosita, as she is affectionately called, tells us that her sales are going very well and that her customers come to her store each day to buy because she has all of the necessary items that a housewife could need. She personally attends to her customers with her characteristic charm. With this loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles she will buy rice and sugar in sacks, packaged noodles, cartons of milk and boxes of canned fish in a variety of brands, household cleaning and personal care products and packs of soft drinks with different flavors and brands so that she can satisfy her clients and provide them with better service. Rosa Nery feels very capable of continuing to work, and she is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela R. organization for helping women like herself so that they can have the opportunity to develop in their field of enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de artículos de uso medico como jeringas, guantes quirúrgicos, fármacos, etc. Las ventas las realiza acudiendo ella misma a ofrecer estos productos a hospitales, farmacias, consultorios médicos, etc. y los vende al por mayor. Su meta es ser una de las más importantes distribuidoras de estos artículos médicos a todos los establecimientos de salud de su zona. 
Pero al ser una mujer de negocios y también madre, no descuida la atención de sus hijos, es por ello que distribuye su horario para no descuidar su hogar. Hasta  el momento Ana manifiesta que es un negocio rentable y una primordial fuente de ingresos para su familia.

Esta es la  sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, como parte de un banco comunal se mantiene perseverante y promueve la responsabilidad en su grupo, ya que para ella trabajar en equipo es lo más gratificante. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más artículos médicos, en mayores cantidades, ya que los últimos meses sus pedidos han aumentado.
texts.en:
Ana is 49 years old, she lives with her husband and two children in their own home. For the past 12 years she has been selling medical supplies such as syringes, surgical gloves, medicines, etc. She goes personally to offer her products to hospitals, chemist's, medical consults, etc., and she sells them wholesale. Her goal is becoming one of the most important distributors of medical supplies to the health establishments in her area. However, being a businesswoman and also a mother, she does not neglect her children's care, which is why she arranges her schedule so as not to neglect her home. For the time being Ana says that the business is profitable and a very important source of income for her family. This is the sixth time she asks for a loan from MFP. As part of a Communal Bank she is persevering and promotes responsibility in her group, since for her team work is most gratifying. The money she asks for now will be invested in the purchase of more medical supplies, in larger quantities, since in the last few months the number of orders she has taken has risen.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory: medical supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, oil, rice and dried fish in bulk

loans.name: Sirikatou

texts.fr: D. Sirikatou est née en 1948 à Sèmè-Podji, mais vit maintenant au quartier Sènadé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Mariée à SOHE Wahidi, retraité de la douane, Sirikatou est mère de trois enfants.  Certains des enfants sont scolarisés.  Sirikatou vit ensemble avec son mari et les enfants.  Sirikatou n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Sirikatou vend des bois de chauffage, et de la glace de façon secondaire, à son domicile.  C’est à ONAB que Sirikatou s’approvisionne.  Sirikatou a 20 ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et a déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé. Les crédits ont été bien remboursés. Sirikatou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’accroître son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande des clients.
texts.en:
D. Sirikatou was born in 1948 in Sèmè-Podji but now lives in the Sènadé district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to SOHE Wahidi, a retired customs agent, she is the mother of three children.  Some of the children have had schooling.  She lives together with her husband and children.  Sirikatou never attended school.  To meet her needs, she sells firewood, and she sells ice on the side, out of her home.  She gets her supplies at ONAB.  She has twenty years of experience in this domain and has already had two ALIDé loans.  The loans have been repaid.  She is requesting a third loan from ALIDé in order to grow her business and to satisfy customer demand better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying firewood

loans.name: Malang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Malang M. is a villager who lives in Boeng Krom Kraom village in Kandal province. She is the group leader of this five-member group loan offered by AMK. With this loan, the members will use it to purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support each of their own different purposes.
Mrs. Yalang M. and her husband, Mr. Yornn By, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice, but their farm struggles because they do not have enough money to support their crops. Thus, Mrs. Malang M. decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticides and gasoline to help tend her farm. Mrs. Malang M. is 25 years old and the mother of two children, who both are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Rozina's Group

texts.en:
R. is the wife of Muhammad Riaz and they both live in a city named Borewala, in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines.
Her husband is involved in a timber selling business. He sells timbers in the community. He started this business when there was no other person operating this business. But now he is facing high competition and to maintain the customers he needs capital to purchase timber in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase timber in bulk

loans.name: Noel Anselmo

texts.es: El Señor Noel Anselmo tiene 67 años, el tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte de carga pesada. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es una persona muy admirable ya que tiene que trabajar muy duro para ganarse el pan de cada día. El está muy conforme con su negocio, pues es el que le proporciona los alimentos diarios. Esto lo conlleva a solicitar este financiamiento que será destinado para la compra de llantas, caja de velocidad y el sistema de freno hidráulico. El sueña con mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Noel Anselmo is 67 years old and has been working with the Foundation for a long time. He has been providing heavy cargo transport services for more than 16 years. Noel is an admirable person who works extremely hard to earn a daily income. He is very happy with his business, which provides for his everyday needs.

This loan will be used to purchase tires, a gearbox, and a hydraulic brake system. He dreams of improving the living conditions for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires, a gearbox, and a hydraulic brake system

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en: Mrs. S. grows crops on the farmland behind her house. Her husband helps with the farming as well. They earn a combined $2 per day and live with two children, who attend school. Due to rising family expenses, they must both work very hard every day to grow enough crops to support the family. S. is asking for a loan of $100 to support her farming business.

loans.use: To support her farming business.

loans.name: Mukue Ole

texts.en:
Mukue Ole N., 43 years old, is married to Natuyo N. and the father of two school-going children.  A wheat farmer for the past ten years, Mukue learned about KADET from group members who were already registered clients. This will be his second loan with which he is planning to plant more wheat which normally does well due to good climatic conditions in his area. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more farmland to meet the strong demand for wheat.

A hardworking man with a vision to improve his living standard, Mukue's dream is to become a large scale farmer and have his own farm machinery.

loans.use: He is planning to plant more wheat

loans.name: Chaka

texts.fr:
Âgé de 38 ans, Monsieur Chaka est mariée à deux épouses, père de 7 enfants et vit chez lui-même avec sa famille dans le quartier Darsalam I de la préfecture de Koutiala   (Région de Sikasso).  
Dû à des problèmes de famille, il n’a pas pu continuer  les études raisons pour laquelle il s’est vite accroché aux activités génératrices de revenus  depuis son jeune âge, auprès de son frère. Il y a 15 ans que Chaka s’est spécialisé dans l’achat vente de motos Djakarta et ses pièces détachées.  Cette activité lui est très rentable et  lui procure assez de revenus car il reçoit beaucoup de commandes dans le mois.  
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’élargissement de son activité,  Monsieur Chaka a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle, il est à son deuxième  prêt individuel, après avoir remboursé sans aucune difficulté le premier.  
Ce prêt servira à acquérir une quantité importante de pièces détachées de moto Djakarta  pour la vente.  Il s’approvisionne  au grand marché de Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans la ville  de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et  d’hommes, au comptant ou a crédit.  
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Chaka compte réaliser un  bénéfice de 110 000 FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts, prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Il envisage rembourser ce prêt correctement pour qu’il puisse bénéficier un autre dans le but d’élargir son activité.
texts.en:
Monsieur Chaka, 38, is married to two wives, the father of seven children, and lives in his own house with his family in the Darsalam I neighborhood of the prefecture of Koutiala (Sikasso Region). Because of family problems, he was not able to continue in school, for which reason he quickly began to earn his living, at a young age, working with his brother. 15 years ago, Chaka began specializing in Djakarta motorcycles and their spare parts. This business is quite lucrative and brings in enough income, since he receives a good number of orders each month. In order to satisfy the needs of his clientele and expand his business, Mr. Chaka came to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his second individual loan, having correctly reimbursed the first. This loan will allow him to acquire a lot of spare parts for Djakarta motorcycles. He buys his supplies in the big open-air market of Koutiala and sells his goods in the town of Koutiala to a clientele composed of women and men, for cash or credit. With this loan, Mr. Chaka expects to make a profit of 110,000 F CFA per month which he will use to reimburse the interest, cover family expenses, and invest any remainder back into his business. He intends to reimburse this loan correctly so that he will be able to get another, with a view to expanding his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of spare parts for resale

loans.name: Evgeniy

texts.en:
Evgeniy is married. He and his wife Anzhella have two children. Evgeniy sells sport shoes at one of the markets in Melitopol town. He started this business 13 years ago. Today he owns two business locations and offers a large assortment of sport shoes. He has many repeat customers that can buy inventory with a discount. Evgeniy loves wearing sport shoes himself and enjoys his work. 

Evgeniy has used business loans before and found them very helpful for his business development. Evgeniy would like to borrow 20,000 UAH to increase the assortment of summer sport shoes. He hopes to receive additional income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María Dolores tiene 45 años de edad reside en Chilanga Departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera vive con su único hijo, tiene una tienda de venta de productos de primera necesidad.
Tiene cinco años de manejar su tienda; sus clientes son vecinos y personas que transitan por la zona, atiende en un horario de 6: 00 am - 6:00  pm, ella necesita un préstamo para comprar productos al mayoreo donde le darán un precio más bajo y así poder obtener más ingresos, ella comprara azúcar, frijoles, arroz, aceite, y otros productos que sus clientes demandan, con esto ella tendrá variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Los sueños son crecer el negocio y con los ingreso ahorrar para comprar una casa darle donde vivir a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
María Dolores is 45 years old and lives in the Chilanga in the department of Morazán. She is a single mother and lives with her only son. Her business is a general store, selling basic everyday goods. She has been running her shop for five years. Her customers are her neighbours and people passing through the area. Her opening hours are from 6am until 6pm. She needs a loan in order to buy wholesale goods at a lower price, so that she can increase her income. She will buy sugar, beans, rice, oil, and other products requested by her customers. This will enable her to offer a greater variety of products to her customers. Her dream is to expand the business and, with the profits, save to buy a house where her little boy can live.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, beans, rice, and oil.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena tiene 41 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su padre en el sector Huanabal, un centro poblado del área rural del distrito de Mesones Muro, un distrito agrícola perteneciente a la provincia de Ferreñafe, la zona se encuentra ubicada a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a labores asociadas a la agricultura, ella cría animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Con los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad solventa sus gastos personales y apoya a su padre en el sostenimiento de la familia.

María desea mejorar la alimentación de sus animales adquiriendo alimento balanceado de modo que puedan desarrollarse de mejor manera, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer honrada y responsable, anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María Magdalena is 41 years of age. She is a single woman and lives with her father in the Huanabal sector, a population center of the rural area of the Mesones Muro district. This is an agricultural district belonging to the province of Ferreñafe. The zone is located forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been dedicated for ten years to agriculture. She raises small animals in corrals located in the rear of her residence and when they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to her neighbors and to the businessmen that always visit the zone where she lives. With the income that she receives from this activity she settles her personal expenses and helps her father in the support of the family. María desires to improve the diet of her animals acquiring balanced food so that they can develop in a better way. Because of this she has requested a loan of 500 new soles from Edpyme Alternative to help her achieve her objective. She is a responsible and honest woman. She has worked with our institution previously, showing exactness and responsibility in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy balanced food for her animals

loans.name: Majeedan's Group

texts.en: Majeedan lives Multan, an historic city in Pakistan. She has lived in the area of Ghouspura with her husband since she got married. She is the mother of three sons and a daughter. Her children couldn’t complete their education and had to start work in their teens. Her husband has a business making and selling bed-sheets and his three sons assist him in his business. Majeedan is a seamstress and stitches clothes for her neighborhood clients to earn a living for her family. She has applied for a loan for the third time from Asasah for her eldest son. With the loan, he will buy threads in bulk and start his own bed-sheet business because he has acquired enough knowledge and feels that he can run his own business well. In this way they can all earn good profits and change the living standard of their family. Majeedan hopes that she will be able to marry her daughter within a few years by collecting the dowry required from the profits of her family business. She has proved to be a very responsible borrower and always attends meetings on time.

loans.use: Purchase threads to make and sell bed sheets

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa de Jesus I. se dedica al comercio, tiene 10 años de haber iniciado con la venta de abarrotería, mismo que opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “HEYDI”.

La Sra. I. a sabido ganar la clientela por la atención y amabilidad con que atiende; en su negocio se encuentra un buen surtido de productos de lo mas importante para el consumo diario como ser: Arroz, manteca, azúcar, huevos, jabón, pollo, detergentes, etc…
Doña Teresa es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres cuidándolos a ambos y fue así como ella tomo la decisión de dedicarse al negocio para no solo cuidarlos si no tener una fuente de ingresos que le permitiera cuidar mucho mejor de ellos por que ya son de edad avanzada mismos que depende en su totalidad de ella.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesus works in commerce. Ten years ago she started a general store named "Pulperia Heydi". She has built her clientele by attending to her clients with friendliness and attention. She has a good variety of first necessity products in her business such as rice, butter, sugar, eggs, soap, chicken, detergents and others. Teresa is single and lives and cares for her parents in their home. She decided to have her own business so that she could not only take care of her parents but also have a source of income to better provide for them. Her parents are of advanced age and depend solely on her.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bread, cookies, sugar, flour, eggs, spread, butter, oil, beans, tortillas, soap, "churros", spaghetti, pasta, salsas, mints, toothpaste, toilet paper, oat, juice.

loans.name: Jequicene

texts.pt:
Jequicene C. nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane Sul de Moçambique tem 50 anos de idade, casado e pai de 12 filhos de idade idades entre 7 a 28 anos de idade. Fez a 5ª classe não deu continuidade devido a distância que o separava da casa a Escola que lecionava o outro nivel. Vive na casa propria com sua familia. Responsabiliza se pelos seus pais que vivem com ele em sua casa.  
Sai de Inhambane para Namaacha a procura de emprego, após 12 anos de trabalho como guarda começa a praticar negócio de venda de potes consegue construir duas casas uma ves que tem duas Esposas e ainda comprar uma viatura para lhe facilitar no seu trabalho. Agora para além da venda de potes, faz transporte de passageiros na sua zona e tem um rendimento diario de 200.00mtn. também faz criação de frangos onde gasta 50,000.00mtn para criar 800 pintos, tem ganho um rendimento de 15,000.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da sua casa e poupa cerca de 2.000.00 a 3.000.00mt por mês na sua bancaria. 

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Jequicene na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 22.000mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos, raçoes e vitaminas para aumentar quantidade da sua criação. Os dois primeiros de (18.000.00mt e 22.000.00mt) foi para a mesma finalidade, esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para construir um estabelecimento para venda de potes.
texts.en:
Jequicene was born in the Inhambane province, South of Mozambique. He is 50 years old, married and the father of 12 children between 7 and 28 years of age. He went to school until 5th grade and didn't continue due to the distance between his home and the middle school. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his parents who live with him. He left Inhambane to Namaacha looking for a job. After 12 years working as a guard he started a business selling pots. He managed to build two houses given that he has two wives and to buy a car to help him in his job. Currently, besides selling pots he also transports people in his area making 200.00 meticais per day. He also raises chickens and spends 50,000 meticais to raise 800 chicks. He has an income of 15,000 meticais which is applied towards household expenses. He saves around 2,000 to 3,000 meticais in his bank account. This is Jequicene's third loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. It is for 22,000 meticais and will be used to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins to increase his flock. The two first loans (for 18,000 and 22,000 meticais) were used for the same goal. He is confident he will pay the loan back ahead of schedule and request another loan to build a shop to sell pots.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicks, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Jay

texts.en: Jay J. is from the village of Layawan, Oroquieta City. She is 34 years old. Jay is single and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Jay makes and sells food. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income comes from selling specialty food like home made longanisa, viand and snacks in the local community. Jay has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Jay joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which she will use to purchase raw ingredients for making her products. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jay from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: Kiden B. is currently in the business of selling sugar, rice and cooking oil in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar and cooking oil to sell. Kiden is 28 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of sugar and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Rosa Silvia

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera y tiene a cargo un hijo. Reside en una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo. La ciudad es bastante conocida por su movimiento comercial y de transporte. Es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la venta de pescado fresco en las inmediaciones del Mercado Modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo (el mercado de abastos mas grande de la ciudad) ella adquiere su mercadería muy temprano por la mañana en el terminal pesquero de la región. Rosa se vale de este negocio para sacar adelante a su menor hija y aportar con los gastos de su familia.

Rosa desea adquirir más pescado para poder ampliar su negocio y aumentar su nivel de ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

Rosa es una persona tranquila y bastante luchadora. En el sector donde se ubica su puesto, todos la conocen por su amabilidad y buen carácter.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old, she is single and she has a child who is in her care. She lives in an urban region, marginal to the city of Chiclayo. The city is very well known for its merchants and its transportation. The city is the capital city of Lambayeque. 

For more than 10 years she has been selling fresh fish in the surroundings of the Modelo market in the city of Chiclayo (the largest market in the city). She acquires her products very early in the morning in the fishing district of the region. Rosa values her business as it is her way to support her daughter and be able to cover the family's expenses.

Rosa wishes to purchase more fish in order to expand her business and see an improvement in her sales. To this end she has requested a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. 

Rosa is a very calm and enterprising person. In the district where she has her stand everyone knows her for her kindness and pleasant character.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish.

loans.name: Tetepelcingo Group

texts.es:
El siguiente  grupo se llama  “tetepelcingo”, se le dio este nombre porque todas  son nativas de este poblado, mismo que en mixteco, significa; “cerro de agua” (yucu nduta”). La lengua mixteca es hablada por todas las personas que  habitan en este pueblo; donde la magia de la naturaleza y el colorido tradicional de costumbres, se mezclan en un raudal de tradiciones, San Miguel Tetepelcingo, se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos al sur-oeste de Pinotepa Nacional y se caracteriza por sus telares artesanales, el numero de personas que integran el grupo es de 12, que en su mayoría son artesanas y  su representante se llama Demetria Hernández L.. 
En esta ocasión  hablaremos de la señora, Gloria Hernández Nicolás, que tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y su esposo se llama Francisco y tiene 32 años de edad quien es campesino de toda la vida y cultiva maíz, fríjol, calabazas y chile, doña Gloria es madre de 4 hijos que son: Edith de 15 años, que estudia la secundaria, Ricardo de 12, Francisco de 10 y Juan Carlos de 9 años de edad, estos tres últimos estudian la primaria.
Gloria es artesana desde los 11 años de edad, su trabajo es la elaboración  de servilletas para las tortillas, manteles, fundas para las almohadas y telares para vestir, todo esto es elaborado por una técnica muy antigua denominada telar de cintura que en mixteco se dice “sahcma-tavi” es una técnica muy original y rigurosa, ya que se cuida el origen de los hilos hasta la creación de las prendas, todo esto es un legado que data de tiempos muy remotos.
 Gloria solicitó su crédito en Fundacion Realidad para la compra de mas material para la elaboración de sus textiles, mismas que son; hilos de algodón para telar de color blanco, azul, púrpura, rojo, amarillo, verde, naranja, café, estos colores de hilos son fundamentales y característicos de sus prendas, así también ella pudo renovar algunos instrumentos de trabajo como son bastidores y rempujadotes, instrumentos que se fabrican a mano. Nos comenta que sus artesanías las elabora en su casa y después las distribuye en los alrededores de pinotepa y jamiltepec, y muchas veces es muy difícil el traslado ya que en temporadas de lluvia hay cortes de carretera o deslaves de los cerros. Nos dice que este oficio se lo enseño su madre y es el único medio por el cual las mujeres de la localidad se pueden sentir útil, todavía recuerda ese momento especial cuando creo su primer telar y ver que el producto de sus manos tienen un uso en algún hogar, en una mesa ya que las servilletas son para envolver las tortillas de maíz.
El gran sueño de Gloria es  promover sus artesanías en mercados nacionales y extranjeros ya que de esa forma se garantizaría el trabajo a todas las productoras de esta población, le gustaría crear una sociedad cooperativa donde sus productos sean apreciados por la gente también aspira a incrementar la producción de sus productos, vender mas para invertir y crecer en cuanto al numero de pedidos. Le gustaría mejorar su vivienda y ofrecerles una educación mejor a sus hijos para que ellos algún día puedan a aspirar a algo más.
La mayoría de este grupo son artesanas y son muy comprometidas con su oficio, es gente muy responsable y si de cumplir se trata ellas lo demuestran siempre, entre ellas existe la confianza necesaria y ese espíritu de ayuda mutua, son solidarias en todo y tienen muy buenas costumbres.
A nombre de todas las que conforman este grupo les agradece a fundacion y a los que colaboran en todo este proyecto que mejora vidas y que encuba los sueños de los más desprotegidos, nos dice que “la esencia del ser humano es poder ayudar a los demás.” 
Los nombres de las integrantes del grupo “Tetepelcingo” y sus actividades productivas son: 

Emilia Mariana Nicolás. – Bordadora
Reina R. López.- Bordadora
Rufina Hernández López.- Bordadora
Sofía Hernández.- Bordadora
Victoria López B..-  Bordadora
Gloria Hernández Nicolás.- Bordadora
Josefa Hernández L..- Bordadora
Demetria Hernández L..- Bordadora
Marina L. Hernández.- Venta de refrescos
Berta O. García.- Bordadora
Yolanda López L..- Bordadora
Inocencia L..- Bordadora
texts.en:
The next group is called “Tetepelcingo”, a name which was given because they are all natives of this village and which means in Mixtec “hill of water” (yucu nduta). The Mixtec language is spoken by all the people who inhabit this village where the magic of nature and their colorful traditional customs mix together in abundance. San Miguel Tetepelcingo is located 45 minutes to the southwest of the town of Pinotepa Nacional and is characterized by its handcrafted weaving. There are twelve persons who make up the group, most of them craftswomen, and their representative is Demetria Hernández L.. 

On this occasion we will speak with Gloria Hernández Nicolás. She is 31 years of age and married to Francisco, 32, a lifelong farmer who cultivates corn, beans, squash and chile. Gloria is mother to four children who are: Edith, 15, who is in middle school, and Ricardo, 12, Franciso, 10, and Juan Carlos, 9, all three of whom attend elementary school. Gloria is a craftswoman since the age of eleven. Her work is the making of tortilla cloths, tablecloths, pillow cases and handwoven clothing, all of it created using an age-old technique called “telar de cintura” [waist weaving] which is called “sahcma-tavi” in Mixtec. It is a highly original and demanding technique since the origin of the threads is maintained up through the creation of the finished article. The entire process is a legacy dating back to the very distant past. 

Gloria requested her loan with Fundación Realidad for the purchase of more material for making her textiles, as follows: cotton yarn for weaving, in white, blue, purple, red, yellow, green, orange, and brown. These colors are fundamental and characteristic of her work. She was also able to update certain tools such as frames and large pushers which are made by hand. She tells us that she does her handiwork at home and then distributes it in the areas surrounding Pinotepa and Jamiltepec. The journey is often quite difficult since during the rainy season there are road blockages or landslides. She says her mother taught her this profession and it is the only means by which the women in the area may feel useful. She still remembers that special moment when she made her first woven cloth and saw that the product of her hands has a use in the home, on a table since the napkins are for covering the corn tortillas. 

Gloria’s great dream is to promote her handicraft in national and international markets, as in this way, work would be guaranteed to all the producers in this village area. She would like to create a cooperative society in which their products are met with appreciation. She also aspires to raise production, sell more in order to invest, and increase the number of special orders. She would like to improve her living quarters and offer a better education to her children so that some day they may aspire to something more. 

Most of the group members are craftswomen and very dedicated to their profession. They are very responsible persons and when it comes to following through they always do. The women share the requisite trust and a spirit of mutual support. They help each other in everything and are very well-mannered. 

On behalf of all those who make up this group, she thanks the foundation and those who in every way contribute to this project, a project which improves lives and stokes the dreams of the most vulnerable among us. She tells us “The essence of the human being is the ability to help others”. 

The names of the Tetepelcingo group members and their businesses are:

Emilia Mariana Nicolás. – Weaver 
Reina R. López.- Weaver
Rufina Hernández López.- Weaver
Sofía Hernández.- Weaver
Victoria López B..-  Weaver
Gloria Hernández Nicolás.- Weaver
Josefa Hernández L..- Weaver
Demetria Hernández L..- Weaver
Marina L. Hernández.- Sale of drinks
Berta O. García.- Weaver
Yolanda López L..- Weaver
Inocencia L..- Weaver

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for producing handcrafted woven and embroidered items, for example, white twisted cotton yarn, skeins of yarn in red, green, blue, orange, brown and purple colors, cotton embroidery thread known as candle thread, and for the replacement of certain tools used in waist looms, that is, wooden frames and pushers

loans.name: Kishegyere Kwetungura Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
M. Francis is the leader of Kishegyere Kwetungura group in Kihihi. He is 36 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.
Francis is involved in growing tea and selling tea leaves to Kayonza tea factory in Kihihi. He says that out of his sales plus the sale of coffee, he is able to make 240,000 UGX as monthly profits. At times when his output is small, he buys tea leaves from other farmers and supplies them to the factory. This is why he now needs a loan to buy more tea leaves and also expand his tea farm. Francis has been in this business for ten years and having a ready market has benefited him a lot.

loans.use: To buy more tea leaves and expand his tea farm

loans.name: Alfredo Antonio

texts.es:
Alfredo de 48 años, tiene un taller de cerrajería y fabricación de muebles. Vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.  

Por la falta de oportunidades el comenzó a trabajar en el taller de cerrajería con algunos trabajos y aprendiendo poco a poco ya que investigaba para poder fabricar los muebles y así pudo mantener a sus dos hijos. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm con dos empleados que le ayudan en la cerrajería haciendo reparaciones de puertas, chapas, vitrinas de madera, vidrio etc.      

Con el préstamo quiere comprar maquinas, heamientas para su taller de cerrajería. En el futuro quiere tener más ingresos adecuando su negocio ya que está en la parte delantera de su casa.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 48 years old. He has a locksmith shop and a furniture making business. He lives in the suburbs of Fortin de Guayaquil, which is known for its dirt roads.
Since he was lacking in opportunities, he began working in a locksmith shop with some jobs. He began to learn, little by little, as he was curious, how to make furniture. This is how he is able to support his two children. Actually, he works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. He has two employees that help him with the locksmith shop. They repair doors, veneers, showcases, glass, etc.  
With this loan he would like to buy machines and tools for his locksmith shop. In the future he would like to have sufficient earnings from his business in order to improve the front of his house.

loans.use: machines and tools

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Llojeta, de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene seis hijos, el señor es empleado cerrajero y su esposa vende pantuflas en un puesto ambulante, con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen, en anterior crédito realizó la refacción de una habitaciones en su vivienda. El señor se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.

El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de cemento, arena y costo de pagar la mano de obra para refaccionar el patio de la casa de sus padres.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Victor lives in his parents' house in the Llojeta zone of the city of La Paz. He is married and has six children. He is employed as a locksmith and his wife sells slippers from a travelling cart. They get by with the income they earn. The last loan was used for the refurbishment of one of the rooms in his house. He is satisfied with the loans we have given him.

The loan will be used for the purchase of cement, sand, and the cost of paying the labour in order to refurbish the patio of his parents' house. 

His previous history qualifies him for the obtention of a new loan and he is considered a good client.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and payment of labour to refurbish the patio of his parents' house.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Mrs. Soeun M. and Mr. Samoeurn Sum are married and live in Sameakki village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support her family. She also sells Khmer cake, while her husband is a horse cart driver. Now she has a problem, because her field has infertile soil. To improve production, Mrs. Soeun M. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She is going to add the rest of the loan to her savings to buy another horse. She is the mother of five children: one of whom is a laborer while the others are studying in public school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Felipa Danelia

texts.es: Felipa Danelia tiene 49 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio, pues siempre ha buscado la forma de salir adelante tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solamente 1 está a su cargo. Ella es una persona muy luchadora que ha salido adelante con todas las dificultades que ha enfrentado como es ciertos problemas de salud. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como telas, cosméticos, calzado entre otros. Sueña con finalizar su carrera y poder seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Felipa Danelia is 49. She sells general merchandise. She has had this business for over 8 years, and has always been looking for ways to succeed. She has three children, of whom only one is under her care. She is a very hard-working person who has surmounted all of the challenges she has encountered, such as certain health problems.
She will use this loan for the purchase of basic material, such as fabrics, cosmetics, and shoes, among other items. She dreams of finishing her degree and succeeding.

loans.use: working capital; the purchase of basic material, such as fabrics, cosmetics, and shoes, among other items.

loans.name: Jose Santos Porfirio

texts.es:
Don Santos de 65 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa y un hijo, se dedica a la reparación y venta de llantas, este negocio lo atiende hace 15 años, de 7:00am a 5:00pm, sus clientes son las personas que transitan por el lugar y vecinos.
Don Santos necesita compra llantas pero no dispone de dinero para realizar la compra, por lo que solicita un préstamo que le ayude a realizar la compra por lote ya que de esta forma es más cómodo los precios y le permite obtener mejores ganancias.
Su objetivo es velar por el mantenimiento del negocio, estar atento a la inversión continua al negocio para fortalecerlo y mantenerlo competente.
texts.en:
Santos is 65 years old and lives in Corinto, in Morazán department, with his wife and one child.  His business is repairing and selling tires.  He has been in this business for 15 years and works from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  His customers are passersby and neighbors. 

Santos needs to buy tires but he doesn't have the necessary money.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan that will help him to make a large purchase of tires.  This will enable him to buy at more affordable prices and thereby make more profit.

Santos' goal is to look after his business.  He plans to pay attention to the need to continually invest in his business in order to strengthen it and keep it running smoothly.

loans.use: To buy tires to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris, es una mujer de 31 años; que está casada con Wilder; con quien tiene 4 menores hijos a los que cuida mucho en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). Hace 15 años que se dedica a la siembra de cítricos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son los días de esfuerzo y sacrificio que en cada cosecha tienen su recompensa, puesto que sus buenos cuidados le resultan muy favorables en cada cosecha que comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad. Como ella es una mujer trabajadora; también ayuda a limpiar la maleza de otros terrenos agrícolas, donde recibe un buen dinero por su esfuerzo. Ahora desea trabajar con mucho ahínco para poder expandir sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una mujer respetuosa y muy trabajadora. Doris, hace poco heredó de parte de su padre una parcela de terreno agrícola, donde piensa sembrar café, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varias plantitas de café como también sacos de abono orgánico para comenzar con la siembra.
texts.en:
Doris is a 31 year old woman, married to Wilder with whom she has 4 young children that they care for in their own home.  They live in the indigenous community of Kivinaki in the central Peruvian forest.  For 15 years she has cultivated citrus crops.  What she likes most about her work are the days of labor and sacrifice, which pay off with each harvest since her good care of the crops results in favorable returns when they take the crops to the central market of the city.   Since she is a hardworking woman, she also helps to clean the underbrush on other farmlands, and is paid well for this work.  

Now she would like to work diligently to expand her 2 hectares of farm land.  She belongs to the village bank "Flor de Almendra" and this is her first loan with MFP, where she is known as a very respectful and hardworking woman.  Not long ago, Doris inherited a parcel of farmland from her father, where she would like to plant coffee.  With this loan she is thinking about buying some small coffee plants and also sacks of organic compost to begin planting.

loans.use: Buy coffee plants and sacks of manure

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y  reside junto a su familia en el sector Juan Mesías del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por tener altos índices de pobreza, ya que las personas viven generalmente en zonas urbanas marginales que carecen de servicios básicos.

Gladys es enfermera y trabaja en el Centro de Salud del distrito donde vive. Esta actividad la realiza hace 7 años  en el mismo centro de salud, por ello conoce a la perfección este rubro ya que ella cuenta con experiencia y buenas relaciones laborales. Gracias a esta actividad ella solventa los gastos económicos de su familia.

Ella desea obtener su préstamo para solventar gastos personales y realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda de modo que su familia pueda vivir en mejores condiciones. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Gladys es una persona bastante trabajadora y estimada por sus compañeros de trabajo, ellos la consideran alguien responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gladys is 40 years old, single, and resides with her family in the Juan Mesias region, part of the Jose Leonardo Ortiz District.  It is one of the most populated parts of Lambayeque, characterized mainly by its high poverty rate.  Most of the people in this urban area are marginalized and lack basic social services.  

Gladys is a nurse who works at the Local Health Clinic.  She has worked in this position for the past 7 years.  She is very familiar with her job and maintains very good work relationships.  Thanks to her job, she has been able to cover the costs of her family.  

She hopes to obtain a loan in order to pay for her personal costs and to improve her family's home so that they can all live in better conditions.  This is her first loan of 1500 soles with Edpyme Alternativa.   

Gladys is a very hardworking person, that is respected by her fellow colleagues.  They consider her to be very responsible and to have a great desire to move ahead.

loans.use: To cover personal costs and to improve her home.

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: Gina tiene 28 años, es una noble mujer. Vive en una casa alquilada, junto a su esposo Christian de 36 años y sus 2 hijos pequeños. Desde hace 4 años, esta emprendedora joven, recorre las calles de su distrito, ofreciendo a sus familiares y demás amistades productos de belleza, negocio que le va bien, ya que tiene buena aceptación en su barrio. Lo que más le gusta de este negocio, son los premios que se gana después de cada pedido que realiza por ello trata de vender siempre mucho mas ganar algún incentivo. En esta oportunidad por campaña escolar sus clientas le han pedido  maletas escolares, por ello le urge comprar, para poder atender el pedido pendiente que tiene. Su fin es de ampliar su negocio y convertirse en una gran comerciante. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete pagar todas sus cotas de manera puntual, como lo hacia en todo este tiempo. De obtener el crédito que solicita comprará maletas escolares, para atender los pedidos pendiente que tiene.
texts.en: Gina is a 28-year-old dignified woman. She lives in a rented home with her husband, Christian, age 36, and their 2 young children. For 4 years, this young entrepreneur travels the streets of her district selling beauty products to her friends and family. Her business is prosperous since she is well-received in her neighborhood. What she likes the most about this business are the prizes she wins after each order, which is why she always tries to sell a lot more so that she can earn an incentive. At this time, because it is the school season, her customers are requesting book bags, which is why it is essential for her to buy them so that she can fill those orders. Her aim is to expand her business and transform herself into a more prominent entrepreneur. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she commits to making all of her repayments punctually, as she has been doing this whole time. Upon receiving this loan, she will purchase book bags to fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to purchase book bags

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a Soft Shell Craft  business in the Philippines.

Nenita is borrowing PHP 1,800  through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Nenita is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove,she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
María de oficio domestico, con más de diez años laborando, para lograr el bienestar de su familia como pagar sus gastos básicos, madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales dos están casados y dos estudian. 
Como objetivo ha sido la construcción de su casa, ya que es de madera y desea subir las paredes de concreto, para una mejor seguridad de su familia, lo que durante seis ciclos está trabajando con Afodenic mediante el financiamiento, en la compra de materiales de construcción el cual ha comprado poco a poco ya que su crédito es poco por no contar con mucha disponibilidad ya que su salario es bajo y tiene que cubrir otros gastos.
Comprara: cien bloques, un quintal de hierro, diez bolsas de cemento, lo cual espera comenzar la construcción pronto.
texts.en:
To help with the welfare of her family Maria has worked as a cleaning lady for the past ten years and is able to pay basic expenses.  She is the mother of four children, two already married and the other two in school.

She would like to do work on her house since it is made of wood and she wants to have concrete walls for better security for her family.  She has worked with Afodenic for six loan cylces to purchase construction materials.  Because her salary is low and she has to cover other expenses, she has been purchasing the construction materials little by little.  She will purchase cement blocks, 100 pounds of iron, and 10 bags of cement since she wants to start building soon.

loans.use: To buy construction materials so that she can build concrete walls and put on a safer roof

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 49 años de edad, es osltero, vive junto con su madre en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de las Lomas a una hora aproximadamente del departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Pedro desde hace algún tiempo a instaladoen su casa una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad donde sus clientes encuentran (pan, arroz, huevos, atún, algunas frutas, etc.),distintos productos para su consumo diario,lo que le permite tener ingresos con sus ventas y poder solventar los gastos  y necesidades de su casa.

A solicitado Pedro un préstamo a Epyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de productos para implemtar su tienda y así sus clientes tengan más diversidad de productos que le hagan falta, esto aumentará sus ventas para poder pagar su crédito y tener un mejor nivel de vida.  Pedro tiene como objetivo tener una tienda grande con todo tipo de productos para vender al por mayor y menor, que lo podrá lograr con esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Pedro is 49 years old and single.  He lives together with his mother in their own home which has piped water and electricity.  Their home is located in Las Lomas district, approximately one hour from Piura department.  The people in this area work in farming, livestock raising and commerce.

Some time ago, Pedro set up a small grocery store in his home where his customers can find essential household products (bread, rice, eggs, tuna, some fruit, etc.).  This profits that he makes on his sales allow him to cover his household's needs and expenses.

Pedro has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a larger quantity of products to stock his store, so that his customers will have a wider range of products that they need.  This will increase Pedro's sales so that he can repay his loan and enjoy a better standard of living.  Pedro's goal is to have a larger store with all types of products that he can sell both wholesale and retail.  He will be able to achieve this through his effort and hard work.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock his store

loans.name: Nidia Violeta

texts.es:
Nidia  es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene una hija. Por diversos motivos no pudo concluir sus estudios superiores.
Desde hace  cinco años  trabaja  con el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su  primer préstamo  fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artículos de joyería y reloj de diversos modelos.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta de zapatillas.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará dos docenas de zapatillas para niños, dice que realiza sus compras en Desaguadero y las vende en la ciudad de Arequipa.  En el negocio le ayuda su esposo quien tiene trabajos eventuales (realiza soldaduras).
Su sueño es tener una tienda bien implementada de prendas de vestir y zapatillas.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y los ahorros que ganan.
En la foto podemos verla junto a su hija.
texts.en:
Nidia is a member of the communal bank "3 de Mayo," located in the Llave district of El Collao province in the department of Puno.  She is 25 years old, lives with a partner, and has a daughter.  For a number of reasons she was not able to complete her college studies.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 5 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, which she invested in her business selling jewelry and a variety of models of watches.  Now she has a business selling sneakers.  

With this loan of 500 Peruvian soles, she will buy 2 dozen sneakers for children.  She says that she makes her purchases in Desaguadero, and sells her products in the city of Arequipa.  Her husband, who works part-time as a welder, helps her with the business. 

Her dream is to have a well-equipped store where she could sell clothing and sneakers.

What she likes about her communal bank is that the members are punctual with their payments, and she likes the interest that she gets on her savings.

In the photograph, you can see her with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy 2 dozen children's sneakers to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 43 years old and married with seven children. With five children in school, Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and  groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lilia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, milk, sugar, and sardines. 

In the future, Lilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 24 years old.  He is married, and has 2 children aged 4 and 10 years. In 2005, he established his business. He began his business because he needed a means of employment for the upkeep of his family.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 750,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. He has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to improve his working capital by adding stock in larger quantities.  He wishes to buy 10 cartons of batteries @ SLL 150,000; 20 boxes of cigarettes @ SLL 70,000 and 20 cartons of toilet soap @ SLL 55,000.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 250,000. In the future, he plans to open another shop, buy a bike as transport to meet customers, and educate his children well.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for assorted items for stall.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
Arístides es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Arístides nos cuenta que nació en la ciudad del Cusco de la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco (Perú), él tiene 65 años de edad y está casado y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, Arístides vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. 

Arístides es artesano de profesión y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora muñequería, bisutería y otras cosas más. Ya son 20 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. En esta oportunidad el socio requiere el préstamo para uso personal osea desea para comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Aristides is a responsible and hard-working person who, because of these qualities, was invited by his companions to participate in the “Chaska” Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association.

Aristides tells us that he was born in the city of Cusco, province and department of Cusco (Peru). He is 65 years old, married, and he and his wife have 4 children.  At present, Aristides lives in the city where he was born and his economic activities take place.
