He started his motorbike transportation business 2 years ago after raising some cash from tobacco sales. He has now been able to raise some cash from the business to purchase a second motorbike. The loan of US450 from PEMCI is to make up for the shortfall. With the two motorbikes operational he will be able to repay the loan without fail. Motorbike transportation is emerging as a quicker alternative to bicycle transportation known as Boda Boda. The Motorbikes are used to ferry passengers long distances that the bicycles cannot reach. This emerging alternative will have a very positive and effective impact on the economy and the communities in the area.

loans.use: To buy an Additional Motorcycle

loans.name: Nol

texts.en: Nol S. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and eight children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  She works planting corn and gathering fish in the rainy season.  Her husband, meanwhile, is a construction worker and makes about $2.50 per day.  Three of her sons work construction with their father, one of her daughters works in a garment factory, and the other four children help to grow crops.  The family plans to use this loan to buy more corn seeds and also to buy a machine to help harvest their crops.  Additionally, they hope to buy a boat to help them gather fish during the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy a machine to help harvest crops and to buy a boat to gather fish

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is characterized as a very dedicated entrepreneur simply because she will not rest until she has sold at least something she has to offer. Whether in the cold or the scorching heat she has amazing perseverance in her business. Yelena owns a small kiosk at the central market in Berdyansk, where she sells women’s clothing and shoes. She has about 40,000 Ukrainian Hrivna, about $8000, invested in inventory and her net profit comes to 12,000 Hrivna or about $2400 per month.

Yelena and her husband, Vadim, have two wonderful children. Many times their friendly and joyous family can be seen together at the market. According to Yelena, her family gives her all the support needed for her business to be a success.

At the current stage of her business, Yelena would like to boost the variety of seasonal shoes she has to offer. She has asked for a loan of $1,200 to accomplish this goal.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal shoes

loans.name: Milton

texts.es:
Milton has a Nissan that he uses as a radio-dispatched taxi for the Apolo Radiotaxi Company.

His house is in the Villa Armonia district of La Paz. He is single and has one year of experience in this line of work.

This is his first loan request. He would use the loan to buy a two-way dispatch radio for his taxi; currently he rents the radio he uses. In this way Milton could avoid the monthly payment for rental of his radio, and he would benefit by having a mountain of extra change in his pocket.

His work qualifies him to receive this loan, because he has experience in transportation and he has sufficient income to cover loan repayments and personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Milton tiene un vehiculo Nissan que trabaja como radio taxi en la Compañía de Radio-taxis Apolo. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de villa Armonia de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y tiene experiencia de trabajo de un año. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para capital de inversión (compra de radio de comunicación) ya que actualmente el alquila una radio. De esta forma Milton podrá evitar el gasto mensual de alquilar una radio y se vera beneficiado con un monto extra de dinero en su bolsillo. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en transporte, lo cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo y sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: To buy a two-way dispatch radio

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 33 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is unemployed. She is living with her family in a rented house. She has a small general store. She applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new ice box and more new goods for the store. She also wants to renovate the shop by painting it and making new shelves. She wants to increase her income and improve her living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new ice box and more new goods

loans.name: Haelen

texts.en:
HAELEN, age 34, runs a general store called "Imma's Shop" (named after her son Immanuel), and also sells clothing from house to house. She lives with her shopkeeper (her niece) in back of the store in a one-room house. Haelen sends money to her mother in the village, who is raising her 14-year-old son. She was brought to Dar es Salaam over 4 years ago by her sister in order to find work, after she and her husband separated. Since then, her sister has passed away.

Haelen opened her shop in 2003. There, she sells sugar, beans, rice, sodas, ice cubes, and other general food items. She makes about $18 a week from this business. Rent for her shop costs about $20 a month and she pays her shopkeeper a salary of the same amount.

Realizing that the shop business was not dependable because of the fluctuating costs of her inventory, Haelen started selling clothes on the street about 6-7 months ago. From this business, she makes a profit of about $35 a week. Her customers generally pay her by weekly installments. Besides paying for school fees and general expenses, she is using her profits to build a house on land that she recently purchased.

Earlier this year, Haelen took out a loan which helped her move her shop to a different location. Having paid this back successfully, she hopes to take out another loan to increase her shop’s inventory and to buy more clothes to sell.

She belongs to the group "Giraffe," which consists of 27 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost her telephone and grocery business

loans.name: Khasan

texts.en: Khasan B. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. He decided to become the client of MicroInvest in 2006 because he heard many successful stories about it from his friends who had benefitted from its loans. Increase in income helped him return his previous loan. Mr.B. is engaged in the home business livestock raising . He also works as a security guard in the food bazaar in the Nausky region.  He is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of fodder for his livestock.

loans.use: for purchase of fodder

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias B. has been a carpenter for three years. He is 25 years-old and single.

He is requesting $525 to buy wood and supplies for his carpentry business. Mathias is also a member of a lending group called “Kyere Nyame Association”, which consists of 11 entrepreneurs in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy wood and supplies for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
K. Shoira has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004. She considers herself to be a serious and business-like client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure.

Mrs. K. Shoira sells men's clothing and shoes. She works with the direct suppliers, so she trades at prime cost and has many repeat customers. Mrs. K. Shoira has applied to KIVA for a business development loan of 2500 STJ for 8 months to develop her business by importing new seasonal goods.

loans.use: To buy new seasonal goods

loans.name: Ana Edelma

texts.es:
Ana Edelma G. R. is an energetic, creative businesswoman. In order to help her husband raise their two children, she runs a curiosity shop out of her home. To increase her revenue, she goes door-to-door selling cleaning products to customers and friends. This way she can earn more and improve her quality of life. As she herself says: "these days everything is more expensive, and you have to work hard to be successful." She is a leader in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana Edelma González R. es una mujer empresaria muy dinámica y creativa, para poder ayudar a su esposo en la educación de sus 2 hijos, cuenta con un negocio de venta de curiosidades, el cual esta en su casa. Para incrementar sus ingresos, ella esta vendiendo de manera ambulante con sus clientes y amigos productos de limpieza y de esa forma poder mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, ya que como Ella misma lo dice: “en estos días todo esta mas caro, y es necesario esforzarse mas para tener éxito”. Ella es una mujer líder dentro de su comunidad.

loans.use: To buy more goods at a better price

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana María R. is married and has two dependent children. She has a general store in which she serves customers herself in her house in the “Five Pines” district of the town of Chinandega. She has devoted herself tirelessly to this business with the aim of improving her family’s economic conditions which desperately need this support. Her husband has also helped her in the store and both together have made huge efforts to advance their school-aged children.

Today, it is of particular importance to note that she has applied to Ceprodel to meet these needs by obtaining a credit which will permit her to buy products such as vegetables and other consumable goods. She strongly trusts that her request will be approved and she will be able to access this loan so she can continue with her grocery-store business from her home.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Juana María R. es casada y con dos hijos a su responsabilidad. Su negocio es la pulpería el cual es atendida por ella misma en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se ha dedicado arduamente a este negocio con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo. Su esposo también la ha apoyado en la venta y ambos juntos hacen los mas grandes esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus hijos en edad escolar.

Hoy en día es de suma importancia mencionar que ha acudido a Ceprodel para suplir su necesidad y obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos como las verduras y otros comestibles. Ella confía grandemente que su petición será aprobada y podrá obtener el crédito para continuar con su negocio de pulpería en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Stock her general store with more products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing and housewares for a small business.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy S. is a villager in Trapaing Ronas Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Virak Svay, is a construction worker. They have three children. All three are too young to work or attend school.

In order to travel to work easily, Mrs. Sophy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to use for work. In the past, Mrs. Sophy S. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding. She has fully paid off her original loan. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use for work.

loans.name: Angel Alfonso

texts.es:
Angel has a job as a driver, but upon seeing that with his wages, he wasn’t able to support his children, he decided four years ago to dedicate himself to the sale of toys in the villages. Upon realizing that it was going very will for him, he started to sell at he village fairs, and this is how each day he has increased his sales.

He needs a loan of $250 which he will repay in four months to buy merchandise and have a better inventory to sell at the town fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Ángel tiene un empleo de chofer, pero al ver que con su sueldo no le alcanzaba para mantener a su hijos decidió hace 4 años dedicarse a la venta de juguetes en los pueblos, al darse cuenta que le iba muy bien, empezó a vender en las ferias de los pueblos, y es así como cada día han ido aumentando sus ventas.

El necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y tener mayor inventario para vender en las feria del pueblo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Martina Sabina

texts.es: Doña Martina a sus 48 años de edad, ha podido sobresalir de tantas dificultades pues es madre soltera de su hija de 15 años de edad, está separada, pero el padre de su hija la apoya económicamente, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene que velar por su hija para que pueda salir adelante en sus estudios, actualmente está en secundaria y se requiere de muchos gastos y atención personal. Doña Martina trabaja en un comedor y es la que prepara los alimentos que ahí se ofrecen, tiene cinco años de estar laborando en el comedor, aunque no es fácil por que desde muy temprano llega a su trabajo y sale tarde, y tiene que estar pendiente de su hija, su abuelita cuida de la adolescente para que ella no esté sola en la casa. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para poder hacer reparación en el techo que está en mal estado para eso necesita comprar perlines y zinc. A largo plazo es poder cambiar de trabajo para tener más tiempo para su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Martina at 48 years of age has been able to overcome many difficulties. She is the single mother of her 15 year old daughter, and is divorced, but the father supports his daughter financially. Martina lives in the North Laureles neighborhood. She has to monitor her daughter so that she comes out ahead academically, as she is currently in high school and requires many things and personal attention. Ms. Martina works in a cafeteria, and is the one who cooks the food that is offered there. She has been working there for 5 years, although it is not easy because she arrives early and leaves late, and has to be available to her daughter. Martina's mother looks after her daughter so that she doesn't have to be home alone. The loan is to repair the roof of the house, as it is in bad shape. To do this, Martina needs purlins and zinc. In the long run, Martina would like to change jobs to have more time to spend with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase zinc sheets to roof her house.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is a wife and the mother of four children, who are now independent.  She is a member of the group named 'Adjinyemise' Trust Group.  Members in this group guarantee and provide support to one another in repaying their loans. 

Faustina Akwertey has been selling used clothes for the past year at the Odumase market in Koforidua, Ghana. She relies on the income from her sales to support her household, both in the provision of food and payment of utility bills.  She is requesting a loan to enable her to inject more capital into her business.  She will purchase more bales of used clothes.  She hopes to reinvest her income into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more lace and used clothes.

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Rosario del Pilar M. Chávez  tiene 28 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal  Santa Elena II, vive en Mz. A 39 lote 16 Manuel Arévalo  II etapa del distrito La Esperanza provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Rosario es Auxiliar Contable, pero no ejerce su profesión, se casó y tiene  un hijo que depende económicamente de ella.
Rosario del Pilar se dedica a la venta de productos de Unic, es vendedora 3 estrellas eso indica que es una mujer emprendedora  y que lo que se propone lo cumple.
Recuerda que el primer crédito de 200 soles  que fue devuelto en 4 cuotas sirvió par incrementar su negocio.
Con este crédito de 1200 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá, una parte en su negocio y otra parte la tendrá como capital.
Rosario tiene un gran sueño y seguramente lo logrará porque es una mujer emprendedora y con mucha visión de negocio, ella sueña con ser directora de Unic y lograr el auto unic.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario del Pilar M. Chávez is 28 years old and belongs to the Santa Elena II Community Bank. She lives at Mz. A 39 lote 16 Manuel Arévalo II etapa in the La Esperanza district of the Trujillo province in the La Libertad department of Peru. Rosario del Pilar is a Junior Accountant but she doesn't practice her profession. She is married and has one child who is economically dependent on her. Rosario del Pilar sells Unic products. She is a three star saleslady, which indicates that she is a hard worker and finishes what she starts. Her first loan of 200 soles was repaid in four installments. Rosario del Pilar used the loan to grow her business. This loan of 1200 soles will be repaid in six installments. Rosario del Pilar will invest a portion of the money in her business and the other portion she'll use as working capital. Rosario del Pilar has a big dream, and because she is a hard worker with great business vision she'll surely achieve it. She'd like to be the head of Unic and earn the Unic car.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetic products. Capital

loans.name: Komi

texts.en: Komi A. is 35 years old and a married father. He lives and works in the village of Wome, a small village located in a beautiful, lush area of Togo near the border with Ghana. Komi’s children all attend school, and he provides for them as best he can, while his wife takes care of the family and their home. As most people do not drive cars in Wome and instead drive motorcycles, Komi started a mechanical business. As seen in this photo, Komi buys used motorcycles and parts and puts them together again, in order to then sell the new, improved motorcycles. With this loan from Kiva, Komi looks forward to expanding his business and the space in which he works so that he may better serve his ever-growing clientele. He thanks Kiva for the opportunity to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To expand his business and the space in which he works

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Khat S., 47, is married and lives in Saang District, Kandal Province, Cambodia. She works with her husband on her rice paddy growing rice, corn, nuts, and cucumbers, making collectively around $5.50 per day from her activity. Khat S. has six children. Two of them are students and four of them are employed as workers. Khat S. learned farming skills from her parents starting from when she was 10. Even thought it’s hard work, she really adores it and will never give it up.

This year her output is decreased. Some of her crops were destroyed by insects and rats. In order to prevent that happening again and to increase her output margin, Mrs. Khat S. and her husband would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase insecticide, seeds, gasoline, and fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase insecticide, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Teopista Nantume Group

texts.en: N. Teopista is a farmer with plantations of bananas, beans, maize, cassava, and potato. She has a stall at her home where she sells cabbage, tomatoes, onions, carrots and spices, some from her plantations and other items that she buys from fellow farmers. She is married with 5 children, all in school, and she pays their school fees single-handedly with the help of loans. She has been able to buy herself a plot and more household items, a thing she had lost hope of achieving. She needs her portion of this group loan to buy more produce for sale.

loans.use: Buying more produce for sale.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C. grows pigs in her backyard. She has been raising pigs since 2004, using her own little savings. She started her business with two piglets. Up until now, she grows pigs because she enjoys the work and is able to earn a profit from this kind of endeavor. She is 53 years old. Two of her eight children are still in college. She needs more income to support their studies.


She is asking for a loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for the pigs. Specifically, the loan will go to pay for two sacks of starter feed, three sacks of hog grower feed and four sacks of hog finisher feed. With her loan, she is assured that she will have bigger pigs to sell and will have additional income for her family. She is also looking into some other possible income areas to support her family. CEVI provides everyone a chance to change his or her life. Through the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage that they give, many are able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Ilolo Group

texts.en:
Sara has been selling alcohol in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for four years. She belongs to the Ilolo group loan (Group code 2003). Every day she works at her business for six hours.
  
She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more alcohol for her business. She is hoping that with this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Sara is 35 years old, married, and has four children. She also cares for two additional dependants. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Esnati, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more alcohol for her business.

loans.name: Suisami

texts.en:
Suisami A., 42, is married with 4 children. She has 4 years of experience planting taro, yams, and bananas. She sells to the village people and general public 3 days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).

She has no previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Suisami’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and supplies for her farm

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: La señora Silvia reside en el barrio Hialeah en la ciudad de Managua, su esposo es albañil y tiene tres hijos de 7,15 y 18 años  de edad, ella tiene 35 años de edad, su negocio es una pequeña pulpería que administra desde hace cuatro años, el cual inicio con la necesidad de ayudar  a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar, sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su casa, apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios. Con esta solicitud de crédito va invertir en materiales de construcción para poner  techo  a  un cuarto ya que ha ido construyendo poco y lo que mas desea es poder tener una casa digna y segura para su familia, la ventaja que tiene que no gasta en mano de obra que es cara ya que su esposo la construye, este es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por sus metas alcanzada. A futuro espera vender otros productos que le generen buena ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs.Silvia lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of the city of Managua, her husband is a builder and they have three children, 7,15 and 18 years old. She is 35 years old and her business is a small general store which she has been running for the last four years. She started the store in order to help her husband with the home expenses, and she plans to finish her house and help their children with their education. She will use the proceeds of this loan to purchase construction materials for a roof of a room that they have been building little by little. What she most wants is to have a proper home that will be safe for her family. She has the advantage of not needing to pay for labor since her husband is doing the building. This is her second loan with Afodenic and she is thankful for the goals that she has been able to achieve. She plans to sell more products in the future that will generate good income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for a roof and construction of a room in her house.

loans.name: Chineye

texts.en: Chineye is 30 years old and married with a child. She is a tailor by profession and also sells clothes and tailoring materials. Chineye is requesting a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida tiene 48 años de edad, tiene una sola  hija quien vive con ella la cual es empleada en un supermercado y le ayuda con los gastos familiares. Ella vive en un barrio muy populoso de la ciudad de Itá, en donde posee una despensa hace mas de 16 años, allí surte a sus vecinos y amigos de: carne, carbón, azúcar, yerba, bebidas en general y otros insumos de primera necesidad.
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de dichas mercaderías, a modo a aumentar su inventario y de esa manera sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Zoraida is 48 years old, has one daughter who lives with her and who is employed in a supermarket and assists her with the household expenses. She lives in a well-populated neighborhood of Ita city, where she has owned a convenience store for over 16 years. Her neighbors and friends buy meat, charcoal, sugar, tea, beverages, and other basic needs products. The loan she seeks will be used to buy the aforementioned merchandise thereby increasing her inventory and in this way also her family’s income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, beverages and other merchandise.

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en: I. Dodo is 42 years old and the father of three children. His main work consists of breeding cattle. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. A very ambitious man, Dodo would like to buy a greater number of cattle, and to build a barn to house them, in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni for the realization of this project. When his dream is carried out, Dodo will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family. With your help this will be possible. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle and young cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann sells provisions, such as drinks, wine, noodles, bathing soap, breveages, etc. Ann is 37 years old and married, with a child. Ann is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.
